loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is a 54 year-old mother with 11 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years to earn a living. Nora requested for a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa is 29 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture farming food for more than five years. Thoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region. And the income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs to have a comfortable life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will make her little dream come true.

In the future, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs Minh is 40 years old and is married. 
She has been working in agriculture farming food for more than 5 years.
Minh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. Moreover the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs for comfort in her life.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.
In the future Minh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 60 year-old married man and a Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started long ago selling hardware to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Due to the low social and financial conditions of Palestinians, especially those who live in camps, Mohammad's income is not enough anymore to cover his increasing living costs.
Mohammad is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to repair his car, which he uses to transport his hardware. This loan is very important to Mohammad for it will facilitate his business. He hopes to buy a pickup truck in the future.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses for his hardware business

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería y a la elaboración   de productos lácteos como yogurt y queso, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Santusa belongs to the San Bartolome de Tambo Real communal bank. She continues working in livestock and making dairy products such as yogurt and cheese. She has been doing this business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She wants to keep working to continue to support her family. She is asking for a loan to fix up her barn. She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her to develop her job and promises to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to fix up her barn.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs An is 35 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture farming food for more than five years. An lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province .
Her family is a low-income household in village. The market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to be comfortable in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will make her little dream come true.

In the future, An hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm.

loans.name: Cleuterio Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un señor con 61 años de edad, luego de que su esposa y él se quedaran sin empleo, y ver como su situación económica desmejoraba poco a poco, este hombre toma la iniciativa de montar su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a la cría y venta de aves, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual comprara pollos, cerdos y realizan la adecuación de los galpones y marraneras.

Sus deseos de salir adelante son admirables, pese a su edad sus esfuerzos no disminuyen, su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder ayudar a sus hijos a pagar sus estudios profesionales.

Con su aporte este señor podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 61-year-old man. After he and his wife were left unemployed, and seeing how his financial situation was deteriorating little by little, this man took the initiative and started his own business. He wants to raise and sell poultry and that is why he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy chickens, pigs and to make adaptations to the coops and sties.

His desire to get ahead is admirable; despite his age, his efforts are not reduced. His goal is to continue working until he achieves his dream of improving his housing conditions and can help his children to pay for their professional education.

With your support, this man will be able to make his dreams a reality. Go on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and make some adaptations to the coops and sties.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar, her husband and their two little sons live in Angeghakot village in the Syunik region. Gohar and her husband have been involved in farming for 10 years already. They currently keep three cows, calves, 30 sheep, 2 piglets and 17 chickens. They also cultivate a large variety of fruits and vegetables (wheat, hammer wheat, potatoes and cabbage), as well as some fruit trees.

Aiming to enlarge the farm and develop it further, Gohar and her husband need some financial support. That's the reason Gohar is asking for this loan. As this is Gohar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan will be used to purchase wheat seeds, fuel for land cultivation work, two calves and forage for the cattle. Additional income would greatly assist this family to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fuel for land cultivation work, two calves and forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Ghyemi Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una señora con 33 años de edad, tiene cuatros hijos menores los cuales adora con todas su alma, se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, de allí obtiene los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Es una mujer trabajadora, humilde y llena de sueños, su meta es continuar con su negocio y que en un futuro pertenezca a sus hijos.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara cerdos, alimento y vacunas para los mismos.

Los diversos factores que la han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante con sus proyectos. Se le debe apoyar.
texts.en:
Sofía is a 33-year old woman. She has four young children who she loves with all her heart. She works raising and selling swine, and that is where she gets the sufficient income to cover the necessities that her home deserves. She is a hard-working, humble woman, full of dreams, and her goal is to continue with her business that could belong to her children in the future.

Currently, she finds herself asking for a loan to buy pigs, food and vaccines for them. The diverse factors that have led her to failure on previous occasions are not a hinderance to try again and get ahead with her projects. You should support her!

loans.use: to buy pigs, food and vaccines for them.

loans.name: Vianys Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una señora con 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad, desde tres años monto su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda en el Municipio de Tierralta.
Anteriormente todo iba muy bien ya que en el sector era la única tienda, pero últimamente sus ventas no han sido suficientes para esta mujer que quiere surgir a toda costa, esto se debe a la competencia pero principalmente al poco surtido, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio con productos de la canasta familia, de aseo personal y hará algunas reparaciones a su local.
Su mayor anhelo es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad.
texts.en: Esther is a 36-year old woman. She is married and has three young children. Three years ago she set up her own business, a small store in the town of Tierralta. Previously, everything was going really well because it was the only store in the area, but lately the sales have not been enough for this woman who wants to rise up at all costs. This is because of competition but also from a small supply. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to supply her business with basic family need products and personal hygiene products, and she will make some repairs to her store. Her biggest wish is to be able to pay for her children's education because their wellbeing worries her. With your support this woman can make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic family need products and personal hygiene products, and she will make some repairs to her store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia Juliana continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma,
La socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
texts.en: Juliana continues working in agriculture and livestock. She has been doing this business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her work every day. She is a very responsible person. She is thankful for the given opportunity through Kiva and also promises to comply with the payment schedule. She wants to be able to continue working to keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and others.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy  pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia continua  dedicándose a la  ganadería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en: Nancy belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank. She continues working in livestock. She is a responsible and determined person. She is thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with the established payments. She will continue working in agriculture since this is the way that she supports her family. She is asking for a loan to fix up her barn.

loans.use: to fix up her barn.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Her business is farming and selling household items through hawking.

She has been in the business for three years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to save for her children’s future. Her hopes and dreams are to have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm.

loans.name: Caribeans Girl Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 10 meses, para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

LIZA MERLY: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente de 46 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos mayores de edad, cursan su carrera universitaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, vende ropa usada en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de hogar. Ella sueña con establecer una comideria.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women of the Miskito ethnic group from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work every day with the determination to achieve growth in their small businesses. They have been organized as a solidarity group for 10 months, to be able to obtain a loan with Pana Pana.

LIZA MERLY: Is a member of this solidarity group. She is a smiling lady of 46 years, married with two adult children who are pursuing their careers in college. Aiming to have her own source of income, to contribute to the household expenses and to the education of her children, she sells used clothing in one of the markets of the Puerto Cabezas municipality. She is requesting financing to buy a bale of clothes in Managua. She dreams of establishing a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes in Managua.

loans.name: Edwin Enrique

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre con 26 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, desde hace tres años. Luego de quedar sin empleo, se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado porcino. Anteriormente sus ventas eran muy buenas, pero en el momento han bajado mucho, esto se debe a la competencia en el sector y principalmente al poco ganado con el que cuenta. Po reste motivo se encuentra solicitando un  préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos, pollos, alimentos y vacunas para los mismo.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando, formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus dos hijos.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en: Edwin is a 26-year old man. He is hard-working and humble. Three years ago, after being left unemployed, he started to work raising and selling swine. Previously, his sales were very good, but at the moment they have dropped a lot. This is due to competition in the area and from the few pigs that he has. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy pigs, chickens, food and vaccines for them. His dream is to continue working, strengthen his business and, in the future, leave it to his two children. He knows that with help from Interactuar and the collaborations from Kiva, his dreams will come true.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, food and vaccines for them.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer con 20 años de edad, luego de terminar sus estudios y no encontrar un buen empleo, esta mujer se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, con lo ingresos generados de allí cubre las necesidades de sus hijos como lo es la alimentación y vestimenta.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimentos para los mismos.
Su mayor sueño es pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues lo son todo para ella y su bienestar le preocupa.
La actividad que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Angélica is a 20-year-old woman. After she finished her education and couldn't find work, this woman decided to raise and sell livestock. She has made great progress with this business. With the income generated, she covers the needs of her children, such as food and clothing.

She is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs and food for the pigs.

Her greatest dream is to pay for her children's education, as they are everything to her and she worries about their wellbeing.

The work this woman does to survive along with her family is worthy of applause and it would be wise to loan her the support assistance she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Sifea

texts.en: Sifea is a 41-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Sifea requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, and chemicals to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Paulina Doris

texts.es:
La socia Paulina sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche, la socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente  agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, la socia continua vendiendo la leche a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche.
texts.en:
Paulina continues with her business selling milk. She belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank, from the Arariwa Association.

She has been doing this job for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She feels thankful for the given opportunity through Kiva and also promises to comply with the payment schedule. She continues selling milk to her customers that seek her. She wants to be able to continue working to keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Marina alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería y agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de leche, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en: Luz Marina belongs to the "San Bartolome de Tambo Real" communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Anta, department of Cuzco. She alternates her daily jobs, working in livestock and agriculture. She has been doing this work for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible person. She feels thankful for the given opportunity through Kiva and also promises to comply with the payment schedule. She works selling milk and this is how she supports her family. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Eusebia, la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua  su negocio de  ganadería principalmente a la crianza de ganado vacuno , la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the communal bank 'San Bartolome de Tambo Real'. She raises livestock for a living, mainly rearing cows. She has been doing this for a while and business is going well thanks to her hard work every day. She is a responsible person.

She is very grateful for the opportunity offered to her by the loan system and she promises to pay it off on time.

She would like to continue working in agriculture as well, so that she can support her family. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and compost.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia Irene pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue dedicándose a la producción y venta de leche, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de leche, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
Irene belongs to the communal bank 'San Bartolome de Tambo Real'. She produces and sells milk for a living. 

She is a very responsible person. She is grateful for the opportunities offered to her through the loan system and she promises to pay them off on time. 

She would like to continue selling milk in order to support her family. 

She is applying for a loan to help her repair her cattle shed.

loans.use: to repair her cattle shed.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Presentación sigue dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de leche, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL village bank. The bank is located in the province of Anta, in the state of Cusco.

The member, Presentación, continues to work with livestock. The member has had her business for some time, and she is doing well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. The member is a responsible person.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through this process and she promises to comply with the payments according to the installment schedule. At the same time, the member continues to work selling milk, since that is how she and her family can get ahead.

The member requests the loan to fix her barn.

loans.use: to fix her barn.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old. He is not married with children.

Joseph runs a retail business where he exchanges used household goods with plastics, commonly referred to as 'malimali', which he later sells at a profit. He has run this business for the last year.

He has requested a loan, which he will be using to purchase additional plastic basins, buckets, water storage tanks as well as flasks as stock of malimali.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan and open another business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic basins, buckets, and water storage tanks as well as flasks for his 'malimali' business.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean is a 63-year-old married man with four children - two of whom are married. Being a farmer on the rice field, he can only make 10 USD per day to support his family. Mean resides in a rural area of Snuol District, Kracheh Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for nearly 22 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Mean would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: E

texts.en:
Mr. E, who is 33, comes from Kampong Thom Province. He is a farmer and father of one child. His wife is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. To make a living, Mr. E manages and operates a farming business, growing cassava to sell. He earns on average $7.00 (USD) a day. So far, he has been in this career for 15 years.

To ensure that his harvest will be good, Mr. E requires some workers to assist him to weed the cassava fields, yet he doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan to hire workers to weed his cassava fields and to buy insecticides. He would like to thank all the lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed his cassava fields and to buy insecticides

loans.name: Hermelito

texts.en: Hermelito has owned and operated a transportation transport service for five years to earn a living. He has supported the family's daily needs with this income in addition to farming. While he waits for the cropping and harvesting season, he does transportation services to earn a living. Recently, he took a new loan to buy tires and repair his motorcycle to commute between his farm and another village in town. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Đoài

texts.en:
Mrs Đoài is 27 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making iron furniture for six years.

Đoài lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Đoài's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will make her little dream come true.

In the future, Đoài hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Dumanjug, Cebu. Emilia raises domesticated animals and she trades goats to the locals in her place. She has seven children. Her oldest is 21 while the youngest is 6. Her husband earns a living by transporting passengers to town dwellings in her place.

Emilia needs a loan to buy materials for house repair like wood, cement, nails and galvanized iron. These will help her provide better shelter to her family. Slowly, she can also start to settle her obligations and be able to improve her livelihood.

Emilia hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Emilia thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repair like wood, cement, nails and galvanized iron.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Parveen has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business in order to get a boost in her earnings with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business in order to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Deeba

texts.en: Deeba is a married woman and wants to support her husband financially. Deeba has been running a shoe-making business for many years and has a good client list. Deeba needs to increase sales to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Currently, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather and polishes to increase production. In this way she would be able to increase her sales and earn more income. She intends to utilize part of the profits on her family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather and polishes to increase production.

loans.name: Naveed

texts.en: Naveed  was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. So she started taking loans from Kashf Foundation for her husband to initiate a milk sales business. He purchases milk from the market in large quantity and then sells door-to-door on his bicycle. He earns a good amount of income to bear their household expenses. Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase good quality milk along with utensils to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase good quality milk along with utensils to increase sales and profits

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
As a farmer from Baray District, Kampong Thom Province, Phal, 36 years old, is working very hard on the cassava field near her house. She is a hardworking mother of five children and can earn approximately 5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than 10 years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Phal is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

She thanks her lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy some farm supplies

loans.name: Tro

texts.en:
Tro, 33 years old, is a fisherman who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. He is a hard-working father of two children who are enrolled in the primary school. His wife is also a fish seller and farmer on the rice field. This couple can make a net profit of approximately 10 USD a day.

At this time, Tro is facing a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy a boat for fishing yet he can’t afford it. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loans with a lower interest rate than its normal loan, he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. He would like to thank all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and her three children who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Rhodester

texts.en:
Rhodester is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with four children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 37 years old. She is married with one child. She has had a cafeteria business for 3 years. She will be using the loan to purchase furniture and hopes this will help her open another business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to help her open another business.

loans.name: Kavuli

texts.en:
Kavuli is 60 years old. She is married and a mother of seven children. Her business is keeping livestock and farming. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and animal feed. She will use the profits from her expanded business to reinvest into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Siddiqa

texts.en: Siddiqa is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been making and selling bangles for many years. She also buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. As her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the family needs she started her own business to contribute to the family income. Siddiqa has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs in order to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales in order to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Kalasa

texts.en: Kalasa is a 45 year old mother with 4 children. She runs and operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Kalasa has requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages and plastic bags to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages and plastic bags.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha, who is 22, comes from Kampong Thom Province. She is a farmer and mother of one child. Her husband is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. To make a living, Sitha manages and operates a farming business, growing cassava to sell. She earns on average $7.00 (USD) a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years.

To ensure her harvest is good, Sitha requires some workers to assist her to weed the cassava fields, yet she doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to hire workers to weed her cassava fields. She would like to thank all lenders for her financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed her cassava fields

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 22 years old. He is married with no children.

He has had a motorcycle business for three years and it has been profitable.

Job has requested a loan with which he will complete payment in order to secure an additional motorcycle.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to purchase a piece of land and begin to build a house for his family.

His hope and dream for the future is to build rental houses.

loans.use: to complete payment in order to secure an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 45-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies' and gents' clothes. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers. This is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now with the increase in their needs they consider it necessary to grow the business also. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband. Therefore, Rehana took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothes to sell.

Rehana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale purposes for her husband's clothes selling business.

loans.name: Vololoniaina

texts.fr:
39 ans, Vololoniaina est mariée et le couple a cinq enfants de 5 à 16 ans dont quatre sont scolarisés. Le second qui a 15 ans , a une maladie et doit suivre un traitement maintenant et ne peut pas être scolarisé. 
Elle exerce avec son mari une activité de vente de sandales et de chaussures depuis 2014. Avant, elle tenait une petite gargote. Son mari est aussi maçon. A cause de leur enfant malade, le couple travaille dur pour pouvoir financer et suivre régulièrement le traitement. Elle est très courageuse ta de la persévérance. c'est une femme exemple de force et combative.
texts.en:
Vololoniaina is thirty-nine years old, married and has five children. Her children are aged between five and sixteen years old and four of them attend school. The second-eldest is ill and receiving treatment so is currently unable to attend school.

Together with her husband, Vololoniaina has been selling shoes and sandals since 2014. Before this she ran a small restaurant. Her husband also works as a mason. Because they have a child who is unwell, the couple must work very hard to provide for medical care.

Vololoniaina is a very brave and persistent woman, she is a fine example of strength and determination.

loans.use: to buy a range of sandals and sports shoes.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a very enthusiastic entrepreneur from Kandi. She is 51 years old, married and a mother of two girls. She lives with her daughters and husband Tarun in a very small village named Shibarambati in the Murshidabad district in West Bengal. She and her husband jointly run a sewing business from their house. Both of her daughters go to school.

Gita has many years of experience in stitching clothes and has had many clients over this time. She stitches various garments like shirts, trousers, pants etc. They purchase fabrics, stitch the garments and finally sell the finished product to their neighbors and the local market. Her customers are satisfied with her stitching. But their income is insufficient to continue their daughters’ education. Now they decided to expand their business. So they require a good sewing machine to stitch more garments. Thus, Gita is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to continue her sewing business.

She is pleased and hopeful for the success of the business. Now she can secure her daughters’ future.

Gita thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia Leonarda  pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua  dedicándose a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores,  la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Leonarda solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the communal bank 'San Bartolome de Tambo Real'. She raises livestock and small animals for a living. She is very dedicated and responsible person.

She is very grateful for the opportunity offered to her by the loan system and she promises to pay it back on time. It helps her to look after her family. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Walter, él socio sigue dedicándose a la  ganadería, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, él socio  continua dedicándose a  operar  maquinaria pesada, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la arreglar su establo entre otros.
El socio Walter pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Walter raises livestock for a living. He is very responsible and dedicated to his work. He is very grateful for the opportunity offered to him by the loan system and he promises to pay it off on time.

In his job he often operates heavy machinery. Carrying out these activities he is able to look after his family.

He is asking for a loan to repair his cow shed, amongst other things. He belongs to the communal bank 'San Bartolo de Tambo Real' in the Tambo Real district of Anta in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to repair his cow shed and other things.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue  dedicándose a la ganadería y a la  venta de quesos y yogurt, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'San Bartolo de Tambo Real'. To make a living, she raises livestock and sells cheese and yoghurt. She is a very responsible person.

She is very grateful for the opportunities offered to her by the loan system and she promises to complete her payments on time.

This allows her to look after her family. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pieces of rosewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's underwear for sale.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée habitant à Tokoin. Ayant un enfant à charge, Yawa est une revendeuse des serviettes de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Yawa désire ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de serviettes moyen et grand modèle en vue de bien vendre puis d’avoir des gains et contribuer aux charges de la famille en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
Yawa is forty-two years old, married and has one child in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells second-hand towels. She buys her stock once a month from the market and sells it on foot from district to district.

Yawa has requested this loan to buy dozens of medium and large towels to increase her sales. Her improved earnings will help her husband pay for school fees for their child for the coming academic year.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen large towels and 8 dozen medium towels.

loans.name: Laisse-Ton-Oua Group

texts.fr: MADIA est celle qui tient la corde du bélier dans le groupe. C’est une éléveuse d’ovin de nationalité Malienne agée de 42 ans, mariée à un cultivateur commerçant et mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 garçons  sont  scolarisés. Elle exerce cette activité d’élévage  ovin dépuis 20 ans.Elle achète ses bétails à Diallassagou. Elle  les élève et les revend après quelques mois à Mopti avec intérêt. Le prêt lui permet d’augmenter la quantité de  ses moutons, et le revenu sera consacré à bien nourrir ses enfants, à leurs achetés des chaussures et vêtements et payé leurs frais de scolarisation.  Son seul rêve est d’avoir beaucoup d’animaux et pouvoir supporter les frais  scolaire de ses enfants jusqu’au bout.
texts.en:
Madia is seen in the photo holding the sheep's rope. She is forty-two years old, married to a farmer and mother to four children of whom two boys attend school. Madia is Malian and has been raising sheep for twenty years. She buys her animals in Diallassagou, raises them and sells them for a profit, several months later in Mopti.

Madia will use her loan to increase the number of sheep she has. Her improved profits will pay for good food for her children, buy them shoes and clothing, and pay for their schooling.

Her one goal is to have enough animals to provide for long-term schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre con 33 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos menores de edad, desde niño se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de campo, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre quien hacía lo mismo. Ahora cuenta con un gran cultivo de café el cual fue heredado por un familiar.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como insecticidas, fungicidas y fertilizantes.
Sueña viendo su casa bonita, ya que esta fue construida hace tiempo y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 33 years old, married and has two children. Since he was a child, he has worked in the fields, a job he learned from his father who learned from his father. Now Alfredo has his own coffee fields which he inherited from a relative.

He is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as insecticides, fungicides, and fertiliser. His dream is to live in a nice house; the one he has was built a while ago and is in a poor state of repair.

With your support, this man will be able to realise his dreams, So please, get going, and make him a loan.

loans.use: buy supplies such as insecticides, fungicides, and fertiliser.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона милая и спокойная женщина. Ей 40 лет и у нее прекрасная семья и двое детей. На протяжении 8 лет она занимается шитьем, а муж Мастоны водитель такси. Благо клиенток у Мастоны много и она получает неплохой доход. Но по истечению времени ее швейная машинка стала плохо работать, и Мастона вынуждена была отменить несколько своих заказов.  В этой связи Мастона обратилась за помощью в получении кредита. Она надеется, что Вы поможете ей приобрести новую швейную машинку и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Mastona is a sweet and calm woman. She is 40 years old. She has an excellent family and two children. Mastona has been working as a seamstress for eight years, and her husband is a taxi driver. 

Mastona is lucky to have a lot of clients, and she receives a decent income. However, over the course of time her sewing machine has stopped working well, and Mastona has needed to cancel a few orders. With this in mind, Mastona has appealed for help with receiving a loan. She hopes that you will help her to buy a new sewing machine, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre con 31 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde. Dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy niño, hoy en día le pertenece un gran cultivo de café heredado por su padre quien se dedicaba a lo mismo.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de bultos de abono, fertilizante e insecticidas.
Su deseo es continuar trabajando y más adelante mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
La actividad que realiza este hombre para sobrevivir es digna de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que necesita.
texts.en: Fredy who is 31 years old, is a very humble and hard working man. He has made a living from working in the fields since he was a child. Nowadays he owns a large coffee crop that he inherited from his father who made a living from growing coffee.  Fredy is asking for a loan to buy bags of manure, fertilizer and insecticides.  He wants to keep working and improve the condition of his home. The work that this man is doing to survive is commendable; and it is therefore advisable to give him the benefit of support that he needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Maria Omaira

texts.es:
Maria es una señora con 29 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda de su necesaria de su esposo para el sostenimiento de sus dos pequeños, esta mujer se vio en la obligación de buscar empleo y empezar a generar ingresos por sus propios medios.
Ella realiza el manicure y pedicure en municipio Puerto Triunfo, el dinero generado últimamente no es el suficiente para esta mujer, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de más insumos como esmaltes, alicates, máquina de cera para depilar y vitaminas para el crecimiento de las uñas.
Con esto espera seguir siendo la numero uno en arreglo de uñas, que toda su gente la siga buscando calidad, economía y buen servicio.
Su mayor sueño es comprar vivienda y brindarle a sus hijos un mejor fututo.
Aporte a los sueños de esta mujer realizando un préstamo.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year old woman. Because she doesn't get support from her husband to help raise her two little children, she was obliged to seek employment and start to generate an income though her own resources. She does manicures and pedicures in the Puerto Triunfo municipality, but the money she earns is insufficient. So María wishes to obtain a loan to buy more supplies such as nail polish, nail trimmers, waxing machine, and nail vitamins. With these purchases she hopes to continue being the number one nail salon which everyone seeks for quality, value for money, and good service.

María's greatest dream is to buy a house and provide her children with a better future.

Please help this woman realise her dreams!

loans.use: buy nail polish, nail trimmers, waxing machine, and nail vitamins

loans.name: Musharafa

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Мушарафа. Она добрая и гостеприимная. Ей 44 года. Мушарафа замужем и имеет уже четверых детей. Она вместе с семьей проживает на городе Душанбе. Мушарафа большую часть своей жизни проводит с детьми и занимаясь домашними делами. Но она находит время и для шитья. Она принимается заказы на шитье женской одежды. Сейчас чтобы продолжить швейную деятельность Мушарафа необходимо купить другую машинку. Она хочет купить профессиональную машинку, ткани  и швейные принадлежности. Новая машинка ускорит процесс работы и повлияет на качество шитья. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность. Мушарафа надеется на кредит и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Musharafa. She is kind and hospitable. She is 44 years old. Musharafa is married and has four children. She and her family live in Dushabe city. Musharafa spends most of her time with her children, and doing household chores. But she finds time for sewing. She takes orders for sewing women's clothes. 

Now, in order to continue her sewing business, Musharafa must buy another machine. She wants to buy a professional machine, fabric, and sewing supplies. A new machine will expedite her work process and affect the sewing quality. The requested loan will help her to expand her business. Musharafa is hoping for a loan and for your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma comenta que por medio de su despensa ayuda a su familia, y también ya tiene muy buenos clientes ya que es muy conocida en el barrio. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y el anterior lo uso en comprar insumos para su despensa, l cual le sirvió para poder tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar nuevamente insumos para su despensa, como ser fideos, harina, aceite, embutidos, productos lácteos, y otros, y asi seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
Norma describes how she uses her food store to help support her family. As she is well known in the area, she now also has very good customers. This is her second loan with Kiva. She used her previous loan to buy supplies for her store. This allowed her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

She is now asking for another loan to buy more supplies for her store such as noodles, flour, oil and meat and dairy products among other items. This will allow her to carry on selling her products as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, oil and meat and dairy products among other items.

loans.name: Olfa María

texts.es: Olfa es una ama de casa que reside en Arjona un municipio de Bolívar y su cónyuge es un comerciante de frutas, verduras y tubérculos que vende en las calles de esta localidad; hace dos años, Olfa quiso tener su propio negocio y decidió vender tubérculos en su vivienda, ella ofrece a vecinos y transeúntes del sector, exclusivamente yuca y ñame, también queso, que es un lácteo que combina muy bien con estos alimentos y que se encuentra dentro de los platos tradicionales de la región. Sus ventas se propician generalmente de contado sin embargo tiene clientes fieles a los que les ofrece facilidad en sus pagos, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en yuca al por mayor para ofertar con un tentador precio a sus clientes, sin dejar de tener las ganancias deseadas y por el contrario poder impulsar el resto de productos que ofrece. Su meta a futuro es crecer en su negocio y continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Olfa is a housewife that lives in Arjona, a municipality of Bolivia. Her spouse sells fruit, vegetables and root vegetables on the streets where they live. Two years ago, Olfa realised that she wanted to have her own business and decided to sell root vegetables from her home. She sells these to her neighbours and to people that pass by her home. She exclusively sells Yucca, yam and cheese, which is a dairy product that goes very well with the other two food products and which can be found in almost all the traditional dishes from the area.

Her sales are usually done in cash. However she has loyal customers that she allows to pay in instalments. She is asking for a loan with Kiva. It will be the first loan that she has done with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to invest in wholesale yucca so that she can offer her customers tempting prices, without compromising on her desired earnings. She also wants to boost sales for the rest of the products that she offers. Her aim in the future is to expand her business and continue to provide her family with the opportunity to have decent and healthy lifestyles.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale yucca.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with six children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been operating a food stall at the market on a retail basis for the last five years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of food prices.

Christine has applied for a loan of UGX 1,100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy margarine, loaves of bread, packaged milk, and tea leaves. Her goal is to expand her capital base. She lives in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Christine's monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, packaged milk, tea leaves, margarine.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children; three are in school. She sells milk at the market, both retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for several years. She also takes care of additional family members, working seven days a week.

Alex has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy jerrycans of raw milk. Her major challenge is the perishability of milk. She aspires to get more capital to increase her sales. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of raw milk.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.

Rehema has requested for a loan from MCDT–SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, mangoes, and pineapples. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality of food. Her goals and aspirations are to buy land to start farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include utilities and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, mangoes, and pineapples.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is married with four children and all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a tailor and has been in this business for 10 years, which she operates from home. She works seven days a week.

Teopista has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy rolls of material for making new clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She would like to get an electric sewing machine to improve the quality of her clothes. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material for making new clothes.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano es un joven de 23 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Chichicastenango. Mariano para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero, realizado cualquier tipo de actividad, él ya tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, pues el como muchos jóvenes por sus posibilidades  económicas no pudieron estudiar. Marino en estos días tiene una cuerda de terreno y su deseo es que esta tierra produzca, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas de brócoli y fertilizantes.  Con esta inversión el mejorar sus ingresos. Su gran esperanza de vida es construir su casa para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mariano is a young 23-year-old man. He is married and lives together with his wife in the region of Chichicastenango. Mariano works as a day labourer, doing various jobs in order to earn enough money to allow his family to get by. He has been doing this for ten years and like many youngsters he could not have a full education because of his financial situation.

Marino now owns a plot of land where he wants to grow broccoli. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy broccoli seeds and fertiliser. With this investment he will improve his income. His greatest dream in life is to build his own house in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy broccoli seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Shifah

texts.en: Shifah is married with seven children, four of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for many years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.  She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to owning a permanent business premises. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Shifah

texts.en:
Shifah is married with four children, and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years.

Shifah has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works from home on a retail basis, seven days a week. She aspires to building rental houses. She resides in the family house with access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years.

Christine has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works six days a week on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality of clothes. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is single with one child. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes by selling door to door and has been in this business for one year.

Ritah has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. She would like to get permanent business premises. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is widowed with seven children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells phones and also makes repairs. She has been in this business for seven years.

Beatrice has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy phone batteries, covers, chargers, and air time. She works six days a week on retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy phone batteries, covers, chargers, and air time.

loans.name: Ustinah

texts.en:
Ustinah is married with seven children and four of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for two years.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

She aspires to own a permanent business premise and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jesica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells soft drinks from home on a retail basis. She is also a primary school teacher. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy oranges, mangoes, watermelon, a bag of passion fruit and crates of soda. Her major business challenge is the seasonality and perishability of fruits. Her future plan is to build rental houses.

She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mangoes, watermelon, a bag of passion fruit.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is widowed with three children, all go to school. She operates a local pub. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, a jerrycan of local brew, and spirits. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water.

Her major business challenges include defaulters and thieves. She aspires to buying a bigger fridge to stock more drinks . She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, crates of soda, boxes of mineral water.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has seven children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all people on a retail and whole sale basis.

She has applied for a loan of 2,800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to build rental houses.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all go to school. She sells envelopes for photographs, cameras, dry cells for cameras, and stationery at both retail and wholesale. She has done this for the last 16 years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy reams of paper, dry cells for cameras, envelopes and binding tape. Her challenges include seasonality of her products.

She would like to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper, dry cells for cameras, envelopes, cameras.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with four children and all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

Fatima moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include the seasonality of used clothes. She aspires to owning a permanent business premises. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is single with three children and all her children go to school. She makes juice from fruit on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy pineapples, sugar, passionfruit, and watermelons for making juice. Her major business challenges include perishability of fruit juice. Her future goal is to buy a better fridge to stock more juice. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, sugar, passionfruit, and watermelons.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria es una mujer valerosa que con sus confecciones ha logrado conseguir el sustento para su familia, ella es madre de tres hijos menores de edad y en su condición de madre soltera ha tenido que asumir las riendas de su hogar y día tras día en su máquina de coser entrega lo mejor de su talento con el ánimo de satisfacer a su clientela.  Antes de iniciar su negocio, ella laboró por años en el vecino país de Venezuela en unas confecciones y logró perfeccionar sus habilidades en este campo.  Hoy en día sus confecciones son muy conocidas por los habitantes del municipio donde reside en Arjona, en la actualidad Candelaria está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en telas e insumos de confección, con estos recursos Candelaria estará preparada para cubrir su demanda y obtendrá las utilidades esperadas.  Su meta a futuro es tener variedad de telas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a brave woman who has managed to use her dressmaking skills to provide her family with he sustenance that they need. She is a mother of three small children. As she is a single mother she has had to become the household breadwinner. Everyday she gives her absolute all on her sewing machine in order satisfy her clientele. Before starting up her own business, she worked for years in dressmaking in the neighbouring country of Venezuela. Now her work is very well thought of by the inhabitants of the municipality where she lives in Arjona.

Candelaria is now asking Kiva for a loan. It will be the first time she has applied for financial support with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. The purpose of the loan is to invest in fabrics and dressmaking supplies. With these resources Candelaria will be able to cover the demands of her clients and will meet her expected earnings. Her goal in the future is to possess a greater variety of fabrics in her business.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics and supplies.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 38 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, farming food, for more than five years.

Hường lives in Quang Xuong district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to live comfortably.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Hường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will make her small dream come true. In the future, Hường hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Yamyle

texts.es:
Yamyle es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella vive con su hermana y ambas trabajan en un negocio familiar. Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por estudiar y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Yamyle is from the city of San Ignacio. She lives with her sister and they both work in the family business. She is studying for a degree in business administration, struggling to be able to improve her living conditions.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying her program fees, and in this way to be able to continue struggling to study and be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don Pedro de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, desde hace 40 años se dedica a la actividad de la crianza de ganado bovino, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de dos toretes para seguir con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Pedro, 58 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. For 40 years, he has worked raising cattle, he sells his products in the neighboring towns and with the earnings that he gets, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase two young bulls to continue with the animal raising and, so, to be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase two young bulls.

loans.name: Familia Emprendedora Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Familia Emprendedora” y está formado por 05 integrantes responsables y emprendedores. Natali de 29 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos menores de edad. Natali se dedica a la Agricultura. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Natali es contar con un terreno mas amplio para seguir sembrando en cantidad. El grupo “Familia Emprendedora” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Natali es la que esta al medio de todo el grupo y esta con una chompa negra y pantalón negro.
texts.en: The is the “Familia Emprendedora” and it is made up of 5 responsible and enterprising members. Natali, 29 years old, is partnered with 2 children who are minors. Natali works in agriculture. She has worked in agriculture for over 10 years. Thanks to her constant dedication, she can give a better quality of life to her family. She asked for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her planting. Natali's wish is to have a larger plot of land to continue planting in quantity. The "Familia Emprendedora" group is grateful to the Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals. Natali is the one in in the middle of the whole group and is wearing a black sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilgen Yamil

texts.es: Wilgen, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero, vive en casa de su madre en una aldea  del Municipio de Comayagua, cerca a Victoria Yoro. El se dedicaba anteriormente a sus estudios y hace dos años estableció su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de quesos y mantequilla o crema. Este producto lo distribuye en diferentes zonas. Con el propósito de mantener capital de trabajo y crecer con el negocio ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 21,000 lempiras para comprar leche de vaca, cuajo, sal para la elaboración de quesos y mantequilla para aumentar la producción y extender su negocio hacia otras zonas de su alrededor. Tiene como meta hacer producto de calidad y poder seguir adelante en la vida.
texts.en: Wilgen is 22 years old, single, and lives in his mother's house in a village in the municipality of Comayagua, near Victoria Yoro. He previously worked at his studies and two years ago he established his own business making and selling cheeses and butter or cream. He sells this product in different zones. With the goal of maintaining working capital and growing with his business, he has decided to ask for a loan of 21,000 lempiras to purchase cow's milk, rennet, and salt to make cheeses and butter to increase the production and expand his business to other neighboring zones. He has as his goal to make a quality product and continue onward with his life.

loans.use: to purchase cow's milk, rennet, and salt to make cheese and butter.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es: Manuel, de 35 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. El se dedicaba anteriormente a trabajar como motorista de taxi. Y hace 10 años que vende mercadería de manera ambulante y por pedidos, ofreciendo Camisas, short,gorras, blusas, pantalones, zapatos y otros, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia. El prestamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo en ODEF y es por 25,000.00 Lempiras que planea invertir en surtir mas su inventario para aumentar las ventas, va comprar camisetas, blusas, pantalones, faldas y calzado para vender. Su plan es poder crecer como microempresario y darle un mejor sustento a su familia con su negocio en el que ya tiene varios años de experiencia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 35 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children in the municipality of Azacualpa in Santa Barbara. Previously he worked as a taxi driver. And for ten years he has been selling merchandise as a street vendor and by specific requests from his clients. He sells shirts, shorts, hats, blouses and trousers among other items of clothing. This is the means by which he makes a living and provides his family with sustenance.
