The loan which he is asking for is his sixth cycle and it is for 25,000.00 lempiras ($1,150). He plans to invest this money into stocking up his inventory so that he can increase his number of sales. He is going to buy t-shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts, and footwear to later sell. His plan is expand his small business, in which he already has several years of experience, and provide his family with better support.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts and footwear to later sell.

loans.name: Pedro Felix

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre con 29 años de edad, dedicado desde muy niño a realizar labores de campo junto a sus padres. Ahora cuentan con una gran variedad de cultivos los cuales le generan muy buenos ingresos.
Este hombre actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara bultos de abonos, para así obtener una mejor cosecha.
Siempre ha trabajado con el propósito de cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia pero no lo ha logrado, sabe que ahora que cuenta con el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 29-year-old man, who has worked from very young doing the jobs of the countryside with his parents. Now he has a large variety of crops which generate very good income for him.

This man is now asking for a loan with which to purchase sacks of manure in order to get a better harvest.

He has always worked with the goal of realizing his dream of having his own house but he has not managed to get it. He knows that now that he has the support of Interactuar and the collaborators from the Kiva platform, his dreams will come true.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of manure.

loans.name: Jennifer Mariana

texts.es:
Jennifer es una mujer con 24 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, la adversidad que la ha perseguido  no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños, lo que se propone lo logra.
Su deseo es montar su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones, es por esto que solicita el préstamo, con el fin de comprar máquinas de dos agujas y maquinas fileteadoras.
Sueña viendo su negocio como el más reconocido en el municipio de Bello.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a 24-year-old woman, hard-working and very humble. That adversity that has followed her has not been an obstacle to her wanting to get ahead and achieve her dreams, what she decides to do, she does.

Her desire is to open her own business, a sewing workshop and for this she asks for the loan with the end of purchasing 2-needle machines and cutting machines.

She dreams of seeing her business be the most well-known in the municipality of Bello.

She knows that with the help of Interactuar and the collaborators from the Kiva platform, her dreams will come true.

loans.use: to purchase a 2-needle machine and cutting machines.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala. She is married with two children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a mobile money and telephone accessories business, on both a retail and wholesale basis, from the market. She has been in this business for the last 26 years, working seven days week.

Sarah has requested for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy phones, chargers, batteries, and air time. Her major business challenge is electricity and unstable mobile networks. Her goal is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy phones, chargers, batteries, and air time.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is married with four children and all go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She sells charcoal and green bananas from home on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. She works six days a week.

Zam's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to build rental houses. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her business is farming and she has been in the business for 9 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Gladys will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married with four children; three go to school. She has been operating a food stall at the market on a retail basis for four years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas. She works at the market six days a week.

Faith's major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of her food. Her dream is to buy land and start farming. She resides in the family house where they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is the age of 25 living along with her spouse and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She runs a small business at home with the help of her husband. Her practice is to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones over shawls and sell them at the market.

She has been purchasing raw material through her savings; her savings spend upon household goods and does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw material to continue her business. Therefore, Nadia has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will utilize the amount for purchasing sequins, gems, pearls and shawls to continue her business.
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy gems, sequins, pearls and stone to paste onto shawls for reselling.

loans.name: Lady Girl Group

texts.en:
Lory is the featured borrower of Lady Girl group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Lory is a 47-year-old widowed mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines. Lory is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Lolita is the first lady on the left, and Nora is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

loans.name: Osiris Del Carmen

texts.es: Osiris es una microempresaria de 45 años que goza de una fuente inagotable de imaginación y creatividad, ella desde niña aprendió empíricamente a tejer; solamente con observar logró adiestrarse en esta labor y lleva 15 años elaborando una serie de productos entre ellos zapatos, ganchos, mochilas, bolsos, chalecos y cualquier tipo accesorio que considere que a su clientela le va a encantar.  Sus principales clientes son vecinos, amigas y almacenes del sector donde reside, a quienes les realiza sus tejidos a partir de las 4 p.m. y termina aproximadamente a las 11 p.m. los cuales entrega los fines de semana. Con esta actividad Osiris genera ingresos que aporta a su familia, ella es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad y vive con su cónyuge, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que no interviene con sus quehaceres en el hogar puesto que los realiza en su tiempo libre.  En la actualidad desea ampliar su surtido y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en telas, hilos, correderas, nylon y botones.  Con esta inversión sus nuevas creaciones le darán una dinámica a las ventas y aprovechará la temporada de amor y amistad para proponerlas.  Su meta a futuro es contratar a una colaboradora y terminar de reformar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Osiris is a 45 year old small business owner who has a very creative and imaginative mind.

When she was little she learned to sew by watching others and was able to learn this skill.
For the past 15 years she has been creating a different products such as shoes, backpacks, bags, jackets and any type of accessory she thinks her clientele will like.

Her main clients are her neighbors, friends and warehouses in the area she lives in. She works from 4pm to approximately 11pm and delivers her goods on the weekends.

Through this work, Osiris generates an income which supports her family. She is a mother of two adult children and she lives with her partner. What she likes most about her job is that it does not interfere with her household activities which she takes care of during her free time.

Currently she would like to expand her assortment of goods which is why she is requesting a Credikiva through the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".

She will invest it in fabrics, thread, nylon and buttons.

With this investment her new creations will give her a boost in sales and she will take advantage of the season of love and friendship. Her goals for the future are to hire an associate and finish renovating her house.

loans.use: invest in fabrics, thread, nylon and buttons.

loans.name: Mirian Sugeily

texts.es:
Mirian Sugeily con 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su hijo, en casa propia,en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. En esta localidad en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, ganadería y agricultura.

Mirian Sugely se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, carnes y verduras, desde hace más de 1 año de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería para se negocio. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.No a tenido préstamos en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mirian Sugeily is 23 years old, in a civil partnership, and lives with her son. they have their own home in the Lagunas district, Chiclayo, Peru. In this region, the majority of people make a living from farming, commerce and animal husbandry.

Mirian makes a living selling grocery products, meats and vegetables. She has had this business for over a year, running a small store from her home. Mirian is seeking a loan to buy more stock for her business. In this way she can grow her store and improve her life.

Mirian is new to Edpyme Alternativa. She is yet to have any loans with the organization.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn flour, fruit essences for making minutas (flavored ice drinks), royal jelly,  tamarindo, pineapple, black corn flour, pumpkin seeds, etc.

loans.name: Institut St Pierre Group

texts.fr: Byamungu est enseignant dans un groupe de l’Institut St Pierre, qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Il est âgé de 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Son crédit sera affecté dans le projet d’habitat. Avec ce nouveau crédit, Il va acheter des matériaux de construction : des carreaux, sables, ciments, fer à bétons,  clous, etc. pour la réalisation du projet de construction de sa maison. Ainsi, Il remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Byamungu is a teacher belonging to a group from the Institut St Pierre, who benefit from loans from MFI Hekima. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of one child. His loan falls under the Housing sector.

With this new loan, Byamungu is going to buy construction materials (tiles, sand, cement, rebar, nails, etc.) to finish the construction project of his house. Thus, he thanks Hekima for its program offering small loans for teachers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: tiles, sand, cement, reinforcing metal bars, nails, etc.

loans.name: Dawiya

texts.en: Dawiya is 50 years old, married, and has eight children, some of whom attend school. Her living costs are becoming very expensive so she requested a loan from Vitas s.a.l., which she will use to pay her children's study fees. Her first goal is to insure a good educational level for them.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees

loans.name: Manowara

texts.en:
Manowara is a 41-year-old woman who lives in the village Shibrambati in Kandi of West Bengal. She is married to Kebir and blessed with three children (two sons and a daughter). Her daughter got married and her sons are drivers by profession. Both Manowara and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Manowara is a homemaker. Her husband has been running a Toto van and provides transportation services to his local area to meet the family’s expenses.

Now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. From the past few days, it has not been working properly and the tire has got punctured, so he has not been able to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the Toto.

Therefore, as a member of BJS, Manowara decided to help her husband and requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase good quality tires and cover the cost of repairing his Toto van.

She also wants to use the lent money to buy auto mechanic tools to keep in stock for repairing work. This loan will help her husband to continue his business smoothly.

Manowara is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase tires of good quality and tools to maintain her Toto van.

loans.name: Sibani Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Urmila,43, standing to the middle in the photograph, is the featured borrower of Sibani Shg A-2. She hails from a humble and low-income background of Titlagarh, Odisha, India.

Due to financial constraints she has access to very limited resources and all the income of her husband is used to meet the daily expenditures, so she was never able to build a toilet for her family. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields.

Therefore, Urmila, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR in order to build a hygienic toilet for her house. Access to a toilet will increase convenience and promote cleanliness in her community and ultimately she will be able to safeguard her family's health.

Urmila is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
31-year-old Purnima is a housewife who keeps herself busy taking care of her two children and her husband. She lives in a small mud house of Kandi in West Bengal with her family. Her son works in a garage and her daughter is studying in grade 5 in the local village school.

Purnima’s husband runs a small snack business. He purchases snacks like mixtures, candies, and different types of chips from the wholesale market at a cheap rate and sells them at the local market with a small profit margin. Nowadays, people are more attracted towards snack items so day by day the demand is increasing. Purnima's husband wants to expand his business by investing more money in it, but they do not have sufficient capital to buy bulk stocks for the business.

Thus Purnima is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, for the business. They will use the loan amount to buy more snack items in bulk from the wholesale market. With this profit they want to provide a good education to their daughter and will build a concrete house for themselves.

They convey their heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase various types of snacks for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Chitra

texts.en:
Chitra, 35, lives in a small village in Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is blessed with three children (two daughters and a son) who are all students. Chitra has completed her education up to grade 5.

Her husband is engaged in cultivation. Her husband's income is insufficient for the family, so Chitra started her livestock business. She rears goats, and after they mature, she sells them in her village market or local meat shops at a profitable price to support her family financially.

She started the business with a limited investment. Now she hopes to increase her business by purchasing more goat kids, but she lacks the capital. That's why she is asking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner.

She wants to use the loan amount to purchase some kid goats for her animal trading business. It will help her to generate more income and profit as well to meet her household needs. In future, she dreams to build a concrete house for her family with this profit.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goat kids for her goat selling business.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki lives in a small village of Falakata. She is only 20 years old and a hard-working mother of one toddler son. She is a housewife who has a secondary level education. Her husband's occupation is farming, and he works hard to meet the family needs.

Pinki's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Pinki also helps her husband with the cultivation during busy seasons. The crops he grows are sold in the market, which is their main source of income. But the income is spent in buying household requirements.

Now he wants to grow pointed gourd, which is fully a summer crop. They want to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the ongoing summer season, and so he wants to buy the necessary farm supplies for cultivating pointed gourds.

To help her husband, Pinki applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary farm supplies like good quality seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for pointed gourd cultivation.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for cultivation of pointed gourds.

loans.name: Bhabanisankar

texts.en:
Bhabanisankar is a 42-year-old differently abled man from the Khurda district of Odisha, India. He is married and has one son and one daughter in his care.

He owns a tea stall and earns his livelihood by selling tea and snacks to his customers in two shifts (morning and evening). Being the only bread winner in his family, Bhabanisankar works really hard to provide a comfortable living to his family. Bhabanishankar is a man with high ambitions who aspires to see his son become a banker one day.

He is requesting a loan amount of 85,000 INR to pay the course fees of his son's banking course. The loan amount will help his son complete his banking course successfully and get placed in a reputed bank and earn a handsome salary. Ultimately, Bhabanisankar will be able to enjoy a better and a higher standard of living and will be able to access relatively more resources.

Bhabanisankar is eagerly awaiting your kind support. He is in dire need of your help.

loans.use: to pay for his son's banking course fees.

loans.name: Sibani Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Roji, 42 years old, is living in a community of Titlagarh, India. She is standing to the extreme right in the photograph.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland near her house where she cultivates paddy rice and wheat. She has been in this type of business for around six years.

Roji wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for the group members and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet at home.

loans.name: Jamile

texts.en: Jamile is a 37 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, all of them are still studying.  Her husband owns a barber shop and as for her she works as a secretary in a small company in her town. Currently, she is demanding a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to pursue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees. .

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela is a 44 year old mother with 4 children. She is a Samoan citizen and she runs a business of sewing clothes and sell them at the market to earn a living. Rasela requested for a loan amount of more than $10,000 to buy electric sewing machine, rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, tape measure, needles, to help her with the business. She has been doing this for many years. She will use her profit to expand her business. Rasela became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine, rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, tapemeasure, needles, .

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. 

She sells beans and maize cereals, a business  she has done for the last for 6 years. 

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using to purchase additional kilos of beans for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Maureen will be able to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a better life and pay school fees successfully.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of beans for resale at a profit

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Analiza dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sanchita

texts.en:
Sanchita, 32, is an enterprising lady and mother of a son. Her son is a student of grade 10. Her husband is engaged in a shoe business. She lives with her family in a village called Ruppur in Kandi of West Bengal.

Sanchita runs a puffed rice business. Locally, puffed rice is called "muri." Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very popular in rural areas.

Sanchita makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood. Gradually her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demands by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help.

Sanchita is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice and necessary materials for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Sunry's Group

texts.en: Sunry’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sunry works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: Mussarat  is 44 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Mussarat  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase a new collection of good-quality clothes in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of good-quality clothes in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 24-year-old woman of a remote village of Kandi in the district of Murshidabad. Rina and her husband are illiterate but can sign their names only. They are blessed with three children (a daughter and two sons). One of her sons is a toddler and the other children are students.

Rina is a homemaker and her husband pulls a cycle-van (a kind of transport used in rural areas for carrying goods and people). He earns money by driving the rented cycle-van.

He is the main earning member for the family, but the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses. So they thought of purchasing a new van of their own, which will give them more income and profit than with the rental.

Rina took the initiative and has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cycle-van for her husband who has a great desire to provide his family members a normal standard of living. She hopes the profit from the business will give her family financial stability and better education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her a loan to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a new cycle van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Samsurnahar

texts.en:
Samsurnahar, 25, hails from Baganbari village, Falakata, West Bengal. She is married and lives with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). Her daughter is studying in grade 5 and her son is a preschooler.

Two years ago, Samsurnahar's husband started a carpentry business where he makes wooden furniture like beds, chairs, tables, wardrobes etc. He works 10 to 12 hours each day. Gradually he is getting recognized in the village for the quality of his work. The customers are impressed by the durability of his furniture and are recommending him to their friends in the area. But insufficient funds is the main obstacle to progress in his business.

Samsurnahar wants to help her husband. So she is requesting a loan from Kiva via BJS to purchase raw materials like logs of wood and some necessary tools. With the loan, he will be able to have the necessary resources and materials to make pieces of furniture according to the orders he gets.

He dreams of getting ahead and progressing with his family, improving their quality of life.

Samsurnahar is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase logs of wood and others necessary things for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region lives with her husband. Their daughter is already married and she lives with her family. Anush has a specialty of accountant and for several years she worked as an accountant at different companies.

Now he has her own business where she rents a market stall where she organizes the sale of food and household goods. She has rented this market for 10 years and during this period of time she managed to gain a lot of customers and now they regularly visit her market for fresh and good food.

This loan Anush now needs as she wants to renew her market’s assortment with some new types of sweets, sausages, juices and some household goods, that are of demand but she has not yet been selling in her market stall.

loans.use: to buy a new types of sweets, sausages, juices and some household goods in order to renew her market’s assortment

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen, who is 30, comes from Kampong Thom Province. She is a farmer and mother of one child. Her husband is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. To make a living, Sen manages and operates a farming business, growing cassavas to sell. She earns money on average $7.00 (USD) a day. So far, she has been in this career for 15 years.

To ensure harvest to be good, Sen requires some workers assist her to weed on the cassava fields, yet she doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply a Kiva loan to hire workers to weed her cassava fields and to buy insecticides. She would like to thank all lenders for her financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed her cassava fields and to buy insecticides

loans.name: Madhumala

texts.en:
Madhumala is 32 years old and a married lady. She lives at Singijani village in Falakata with her husband and three children (two daughters and one son). Her children are all students in different grades. Madhumala and her husband both attended school up to grade 5.

Though Madhumala is a housewife, she has a paddy farm and cultivates paddy rice. She manages the household chores and cultivation work alone. Her husband runs a fish business.

From the beginning, both Madhumala and her husband have faced lots of problems in covering the family expenses, but still they have not lost their hope to survive. The income from the farming is not too good. Due to a lack of capital, Madhumala couldn’t buy quality paddy seeds for cultivation. So, Madhumala has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and the necessary agricultural supplies so that she can cultivate more crops for better earnings.

Madhumala hopes that they will be able to live a healthy life and provide good education to her children with the profit from her business.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the agricultural inputs and the operational costs of paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida , 44 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store in her home for the people living in her street. She offers a variety of packs of biscuits, snacks and toffees. In order to avoid shortages, Zahida  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40000  to buy more packs of biscuits, candies and chips in various flavors. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, candies and chips in various flavors

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en:
Tanzeela has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business.

Now she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more sewing materials, such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: Chork’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chork makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer farmer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 45-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and their two sons in Bara Shoulmari village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is married to Harimohan, a farmer by profession. Both her sons are students.

Anjana's husband has been involved in agriculture for five years. Anjana assists her husband in the field work after completing her household chores. He cultivates potatoes, eggplant and other seasonal vegetables and had a very successful harvest to sell in the local market. Now his current income is quite insufficient for the growing expenses of his family, and so they have decided to start paddy cultivation. With rice being the staple food of the local people, the crop has great demand.

So Anjana is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband to purchase necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc., for paddy cultivation.

She hopes she will get good revenue from this cultivation. Her future plans are to continue working hard for business enhancement to provide a better life to her family and construct a concrete house for her family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Kamana

texts.en:
Kamana is 42 years old and a mother of two children. Her only daughter is married, and her son is a student of grade 5 in a village school. They live in a rural village called Baganbari in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal.

For the last four years, Kamana's husband has been running a clothing business with the help and support of Kamana. They have a small clothing shop adjacent to their house. He purchases various types of clothing like saris (a very common outfit used by the women of India), salwar suits, Kurtis, men’s T-shirts, etc., from the wholesale market and sells them to their customers who come to their shop.

Now Kamana wants to raise their income by increasing the volume of the business. Looking into the present scenario at the market, she is planning to purchase more good quality clothing, keeping in mind the forthcoming festive season. Kamana hopes that this will generate some extra income, so she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more stock of clothing for their business.

Kamana has a strong desire to give a better education to her son. She has a dream of giving her family a bright future by doing hard work with sincerity.

She is grateful to her lenders Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing for the clothing business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una señora de cincuenta y nueve años de edad, muy trabajadora y amante del campo, ella desde joven ha trabajado en maizales y cuido de animales. Junto a su esposo ha trabajado fuertemente su pequeña finca. Logro sacar exitosamente una cosecha de maíz, la cual le dejo muy buenas ganancias. 
Para seguir aumentando su produccion de cerdos Maria solicita un credito para comprar dos cerdos, los cuales planea engordar y hacer reproducir. Ella desea mantener a flote su negocio de crianza de cerdos. En un futuro desea equipar su finca con equipos que le faciliten el trabajo de campo, también además de criar cerdos, poder hacerlo con vacas.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, hardworking, and loves the country. Since she was young, she has worked in corn fields and caring for animals. Together with her husband, she has worked hard at their small farm. She was able to successfully harvest a corn crop, which earned them good profits.

In order to continue expanding their production of pigs, María is requesting a loan to purchase two pigs. She plans to fatten them and have them reproduce. She wants to keep her business caring for pigs afloat. In the future, she wants to equip her farm with equipment that will help them with their work. Also, in addition to raising pigs, she wants to raise cows as well.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesús

texts.es: Roberto de 37 años es un microempresario que inició su negocio al considerar una oportunidad de negocio el potencial y  la experiencia de su cónyuge, ella ha comercializado por años prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños; hace dos años organizó su punto de venta desde su casa y diariamente promueve ventas a partir de las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m. a vecinos y pobladores del municipio de Baranoa.  Su surtido es muy variado en su almacén pueden encontrar pantalones, camisas, sandalias, ropa interior, lentes de sol, artículos para el hogar entre otros. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, productos de mayor demanda para la temporada de fin de año. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio, adquirir un local comercial y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 37, is a small businessman who started his business upon considering his wife's potential and experience for a business opportunity. She has sold women's, men's, and children's, clothes for years. Two years ago he organized his point of sales from his house. He promotes his sales daily starting at 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. to his neighbors and people residing in the Baranoa municipality.

His stock is highly varied so that you can find pants, shirts, sandals, underwear, sun glasses, and household items, among others, in his store.

He is currently dealing with his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy clothes for women, men, and children and products that are in greater demand for the end of the year season.

His goal is to strengthen his business and to get a commercial place and his own house.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es:
Santos, de 46 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos están acompañados y tienen su propio hogar, pero solo una hija vive con ella y su nieto.

Santos, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años, antes realizaba ventas en la comunidad, ella decidió poner su propio negocio, pues la única tienda que hay está muy lejos del caserío, por lo cual ella decidió colocar su propio negocio, cuando ella no está en la tienda su hija le ayuda a atender el negocio, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. porque a esa hora llegan a comprar pan y café y cierran hasta las 6:00 p.m. de la noche.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda con azúcar, frijoles, café, arroz, jabones y condimentos.

El sueño de Santos, es poder tener la tienda más grande y con variedad para seguir invirtiendo y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos is 46 years old. She did not attend school. She has a partner who is employed. She has 4 children, all of whom have partners and their own homes, but one daughter lives with her and her grandchild.

Santos has had a small store for 2 years. Before she carried out sales in the community, she decided to set up her own store. Since the only store is very far from her small village, she therefore decided to organize her own shop. When she is not in the store, her daughter helps her attend the business. Her work schedule is from 6 am, because at that hour they arrive to buy bread and coffee, and they close at 6 pm at night.

Santos needs the loan to buy products for her store such as sugar, beans, coffee, rice, soaps, and condiments.

Santos' dream is to be able to have a larger store with variety in order to continue investing and getting profits.

loans.use: to buy products for her store such as sugar, beans, coffee, rice, soaps, and condiments.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita hails from Falakata in Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She is 43 years old and living with her husband and two sons. Her only daughter is married. One of her sons is a university student and the other is engaged in a vegetable vending business with his father.

Anita is a housewife, and her husband has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, eggplant, ladies finger, etc., in the daily market of the town for the last two years. He brings his stock from the local wholesalers.

This income from this business is hardly sufficient to maintain the family properly. As this is the only income-generating source for the family, Anita wants to buy bulk stock for sale. Buying stock in bulk will help to reduce her husband's frequent travel to the market, and eventually, transportation and buying costs.

So she is seeking a loan amount from BJS, Kiva's field partner, to purchase stock of vegetables in bulk. This will improve their earnings, enhance the business, and provide further education to her son and a decent lifestyle to her family.

Anita is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables in bulk for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ruqia's Group

texts.en:
Ruqia is 41 years old; she lives with her seven children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been selling fruits and vegetables for many years. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling. As a hawker, he can easily travel near to people. People like to buy fruit at their doors instead of going to the market. Due to the fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruit has increased and, by noon, he has run out of stock.

Ruqia feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for the family. She is receiving a loan for her husband so that he can buy fruit in larger quantities, as well as an equilibrium scale to weigh the fruit.

Ruqia wants to save some of the profit so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fruit and an equilibrium scale for her husband's fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Kohinur

texts.en:
Kohinur is a young housewife who is married and has three children (one son and two daughters). She is 28 years old. Kohinur remained illiterate due to her family's poor financial resources, and knows how to sign her name only. Her children are students of different grades. They live in the small village of Chuyakhola in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar.

Kohinur's husband earns for the family by running a business of supplying raw materials to different plywood shops and wood factories. He collects logs of wood from their village and neighboring villages and, after processing and cutting them into thin sheets, supplies them to plywood manufacturing mills.

Now Kohinur and her husband have decided to expand their business by purchasing more logs of wood. For that they need some capital, so Kohinur has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS.

She hopes she will be able to supply more raw materials to the plywood manufacturers. This will help her to become more efficient and confident and therefore improve her services to meet the customers’ demand. Kohinur hopes to generate more income and secure a better life for her family from this business profit.

She appreciates and thanks her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase logs of wood for her husband's existing business.

loans.name: Nazneen

texts.en: Nazneen has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained many customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more sewing supplies such as spools of thread, lace, and ribbons for completing the maximum orders on time. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing supplies.

loans.name: Annapurna

texts.en:
Annapurna, a 27-year-old, hardworking lady, resides in a village of Kandi in Murshidabad district, West Bengal, with her family. She is blessed with two daughters. Her one daughter is married, and the younger daughter goes to a local village school. Her husband works in a grill factory.

Annapurna is engaged with sewing work. She sews different clothing like saris, petticoats, blouses, etc., by her hand, as per the order of her customers. This enthusiastic woman supports her husband in running the household by being involved in the small-scale business of sewing work.

Now she needs to improve her business, but lack of capital is the main hindrance. Thus, Annapurna has asked for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS. The additional income from this endeavor will contribute to her monthly savings and help them in fulfilling her dreams of giving financial sustenance to her family.

She will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials like threads, needles, sari falls, etc., in bulk to get more orders to satisfy her customers. She hopes this loan amount will give a boost to her business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials to improve her sewing work business.

loans.name: Verdun 2 Group

texts.en: Rose Marie is the featured borrower of Verdun 2 Group. The Group members are friends who left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon to achieve better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines. Rose Marie is a 50-year-old, divorced mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. Education is very important for her. That's why she is working hard as a housekeeper to make sure that her children will benefit from a brighter future. Rose Marie is the second lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Jerlyn is the first lady on the right, Bethel is the second lady on the left, and Nila is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more jewelry to resell.

Grace has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 49 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charito has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Charito requested a loan from NWTF for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat. She will also use the loan for maintenance for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 62 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For 30 years Magdalena has had a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional supplies of charcoal to resell. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She now has a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more inventory of grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour, and rice. It will help her to meet customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, debido a los escasos recursos económicos de su familia no pudo estudiar y es madre soltera de 4 hijos.

María, se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura con la ayuda de sus hijos desde que se separó de su pareja, también se dedica a administrar una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa.

María, solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, este es un nuevo negocio le ayudara a cubrir sus gastos y los de sus hijos y así mejorara su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es tener un negocio bien surtido y bien establecido dentro del mercado, donde pueda comercializar sus productos en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
María, 34 years old, could not study due to her family’s scarce economic resources. Since she separated from her partner, she has made a living in agriculture with the help of her children. She also makes a living by running a small shop from her house.

María is requesting the loan to purchase clothing to sell. This is a new business that will help her cover her and her children’s expenses and therefore improve their quality of life. Her dream is to have a well-stocked and established business in the market where she can sell her products on a large scale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Khaldiye

texts.en:
khaldiye is a 56-year-old married mother with six children.

In 1996, she began a home-based business to sell foods to help support the family and to improve their lifestyle.

She will use a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas S.A.L. to buy food provisions to provide the best product to her clients. She has a very good reputation in her hometown and is certain that she will sell products.

She hopes to open her own store to attract regular customers and develop her business.

loans.use: to improve her merchandise and buy food.

loans.name: Niraz

texts.en:
Niraz is a 36 year-old Lebanese married housewife living with her husband and three children, one attends university and the others attend school. Her husband earns the main income and she takes care of her house and family.

She needs a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas S.A.L. to pay her child's university fees. She is planning to take another loan to ensure a great educational path for her children to work at a proper company and gain good experiences.

loans.use: to pay her child's university fees.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a married woman with 4 children who works hard to support her family.

She has a retail plants and flowers business and earns additional income raising pigs. Cherry is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy different kinds of plants and flowers to sell.

Cherry has sustained her business through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  different kinds of plants and flowers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 43-year-old married woman with one school-aged child. Marilyn works very hard

Marilyn has had a general store for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She sells canned good, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Auner Eliecer

texts.es: Auner es un emprendedor de 30 años apasionado por un objetivo en particular: posicionar su negocio en el municipio de Sabanalarga a donde llegó apenas hace un año convencido que el negocio de los alimentos podría generarle un ingreso mensual atractivo y seguro. Trabaja en su puesto de comidas desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m. ofreciendo a vecinos y transeúntes, ensaladas de frutas, jugos, helados, empanadas y toda clase de fritos de la región como arepas, empanadas, papas rellenas, deditos etc. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra al por mayor de los víveres que requiere para la preparación de sus productos y obtener descuentos, frutas, harinas y helados. Su meta fortalecer y posicionar su negocio con buenos precios y buen servicio y en lo personal desea comprar su casa propia y continuar ofreciéndole a su familia bienestar.
texts.en:
Auner is a 30 year old entrepreneur who is passionate about one objective in particular. That is to position his business in the Sabanalarga municipality. This is where he came, just a year ago, convinced that a food business would be able to generate an attractive and reliable monthly income for him.

He works at his food stand from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. selling to his neighbors and passersby. He sells fruit salad, juice, ice cream, empanadas, and all types of regional snacks like 'arepas' [flat bread made from corn dough], empenadas, stuffed potatoes, and 'deditos' [cheese sticks], etc.

He is currently processing his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy supplies in bulk that he needs to prepare his products. He will get discounts on fruit, flour, and ice cream.

His goal is to strengthen and position his business with good prices and good service. Personally, he wishes to buy his own house and to continue to provide for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy in bulk the supplies like fruit, flour, and ice cream that he needs to make his products and to get discounts.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a 37-year-old widow with four children, three attend school. Cleofe works very hard to provide for them.

Cleofe has run a general store for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future Cleofe would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods. and other personal care products.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 37-year old woman with three daughters and three sons. Her husband owns a workshop to maintain motorcycles. He is a professional and can easily fix the motorcycles. He uses various types of tools but due to a recent move, some of his important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Sajida requests a loan for her husband to compensate for this loss. He will buy tools, spare parts, tires, and brake shoes for his workshop.

She wants to provide a better education and living standard for her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase. Sajida thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools, spare parts, tires, and brake shoes for motorcycle repair workshop.

loans.name: Milton Saul

texts.es:
Milton, de 18 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero, aún vive con sus padres, hermanos y algunos sobrinos, pero él solo trabaja para cubrir sus gastos.

Milton, se dedica a trabajar en la sastrería elaborando pantalones, camisas, etc. de lo cual obtiene ingresos para el sustento propio y para apoyar a su padre en lo que puede.- Desde que tenía 13 años de edad aprendió todo acerca de la costura y desde entonces se dedicó a ese oficio porque le gustó, su lugar de trabajo es en su casa y los clientes tienen que llegar para tomar las medidas de las prendas que elaborará.

Milton, necesita el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser y el resto para comprar una motocicleta para salir a comprar los materiales que necesita.

Sus sueños son, continuar estudiando y construir una casa más grande y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Milton, age 18, went to school through high school. He is single, and he still lives with his parents, siblings, and some cousins. However, he only works to cover his expenses. Milton works as a tailor by making pants and shirts, etc. The income that he gets from this is for his own support and to help his father in what he can.

When he was 13 years old he learned everything about sewing. From then on he devoted himself to this trade because he liked it. His work place is at his house. The customers need to come to take measurements for the garments that he will make.

Milton needs the loan to buy a sewing machine. The rest is to buy a motorcycle so that he can go out to buy the materials he needs.

His dreams are to continue his educations and to build a bigger house in better condition.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to use the rest to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayisatu

texts.fr: Ayisatu est âgée de 31 ans et est une femme mariée. Ayisatu vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Agoè où elle revend les produits ménagés de tout genre pour la satisfaction de ses clients. Ayisatu s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et désire commander des douzaines de maïs et de glacières en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Ayisatu is a 31-year-old, married woman. Ayisatu cares for her three children and lives in Agoè where she resells all kinds of household products to meet her customers needs.

Ayisatu purchases supplies three times a month at the market. She wants to order dozens of corn and ice chests in order to sell well and then make a good profit.

She wishes to support her children's education and reorganize her business.

loans.use: to buy three dozen ice chests.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She has had a retail shop for 5 years and earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel has operated a transportation service for three years. The business earns a good income for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan which was used to buy a new motorcycle.

He requests a new loan to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance. He wants to ensure that his customers feel secure with his services. In the future, Ronel hopes to gain more profit and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

location.town: P-5, LOWER LOBOC, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 47-year-old married woman who is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristina has had a dried fish business for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of salt, bamboo, a fish net, fish, and other items for her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of salt, bamboo, a fish net,  fish, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Sindjere C Group

texts.fr: Halima est la dame qui tient le bélier par ses cornes sur la photo, elle est une malienne non alphabétisée, âgée de 28 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés, ils sont  âgés de 8 ans à 17ans. Son mari fait  du commerce de céréale.  Halima fait l’élevage des ovins, elle achète des béliers,  les  élève  puis les revend. Elle sollicite un prêt au R.M.C.R dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons, les élevés puis les revendre. Elle a 4 ans d’activités. Elle  fait ses achats et  ses ventes dans les foires de sa localité, son bénéfice lui permettra de prendre en charge certaines dépenses(les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants, l’habillement, la santé et des condiments) au sein  de sa famille. Ses rêves et ses espoirs sont : de pouvoir  subvenir toujours  aux besoins  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Halima is the woman holding the ram by the horns in the photo. She is an illiterate, 28-year-old woman from Mali. She is married and the mother of four children, all in school. They are between the ages of 8 and 17 years old.

Her husband sells grain. Halima raises sheep. She buys rams, raises them, then resells them. She is asking for this loan from RMCR in order to purchase more sheep, raise them and then resell them. She has had her business for four years. She makes her purchases and sales at local fairs.

Her profits will allow her to be responsible for some of her family's expenses (her children's school fees, clothing, health, and food). Her dreams and hopes are to be able to always meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rams to resell later.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 50-year-old married mother of two children, who decided nine years ago to establish her own business, which has to do with providing beauty services, after she got the necessary vocational training to enhance her skills and improve her talents.

Mona is working hard to develop her business and her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in buying necessary autumn and winter beauty products, which will help her diversify her services in a professional and well managed way.

She is a good supporter for her family.

loans.use: to buy necessary autumn and winter beauty products which will help her diversify her services in a professional and well managed way.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith is 24 years old, a single credit officer at a micro finance institution who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He has been working as a credit officer since 2014, earning approximately $7.50 per day.

Currently, Rith is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his third-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the third year successfully.

For his dreams, he wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary so he will be able to save money to build a proper house, and, if he gets children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fees

loans.name: Enalyn

texts.en:
Enalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase wood, paints, nails, and other materials for her fishing boat.

Enalyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Enalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paints, nails, and other materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 27 years old and he lives in the frontier village Sarigyugh village of Tavush region. Vahe here lives with his wife, daughter and his parents. He works at the gas station and simultaneously is engaged in farming and agriculture.

Now on his farm he has a cow, a heifer, a pig and chickens. His plot of land has a rich harvest of potatoes, tomatoes, garlic and greens. These vegetables and milk, meat and eggs Vahe’s mother sells at the wholesale market of the city.

Now Vahe wants to develop swine breeding in his farm and this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he wants to use for the purchase of piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to use for the purchase of piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 40-year-old mother with six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son works with a lathe machine to manufacture and renew spare parts of heavy machinery. He also manufactures dies using cutting tools and pieces of cast iron. He has been in this business for many years. He works continuously with the lathe machine, some important tools have been damaged and need to be replaced to ensure proper functioning of the lathe.

Her son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash to buy spare parts. Allal Rakhi requests a loan for her son to buy tools to continue his work.

Allah Rakhi hopes that this loan will prove to be productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy  tools for her son's lathe.

loans.name: Akossiwa  Kanlé

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme célibataire âgée de 43 ans qui habite à Baguida. Mère d’un enfant, Akossiwa est une marchande de fournitures scolaire et des produits ménagés qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des cahiers de deux-cent, cent pages et des verres à boire ; Akossiwa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire surtout dans ces périodes de la rentrée scolaire, afin de venir en aide à son enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a single, 43-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. The mother of one child, Akossiwa sells school supplies and household products which she purchases three times a month at the market and resells from the front of her home in order to make a profit.

Akossiwa needs this loan so that she can order 200- and 100-page notebooks and drinking glasses. She hopes to make a good profit, especially during back-to-school time, in order to help her child with his education.

loans.use: to buy one box of 200-page notebooks, two boxes of 100-page notebooks, and one box of drinking glasses.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 37 years old, married woman. Her brother, who lives with her, operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. He is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family.

However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her brother's business, Shameem has requested a loan of 60000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal and slate so she can meet her brother's customers’ demands without any delay.

loans.name: Faiva

texts.en: Faiva is a 62 year old mother with 5 children and had a small business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. Faiva requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her run the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Ana is married with 4 grown children. She is 40 years old and lives in Sapa Anding, Ramon Magsaysay, ZDS, Philippines. Ana owns and manages her rice farm just to earn for a living. She has been selling rice for over 13 years and has made favorable returns.

Ana joined and gain access in GDMPC. She requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm to enhance the growth of crops and for a high potential of return on investment. In the future, Ana hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more rice to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Warm greetings, dear lenders! Wella wants to convey her grateful appreciation for your previous financial assistance amounting to PhP 38,000. It has been utilized in purchasing utensils, equipments, tables and chairs for her catering business. As a result, it enhanced her earnings and supplemented for her family’s daily expenses and her child’s educational needs. Aside from this, she was able to provide a source of income to five helpers (cooks, waiters and servers). Thank you so much!

Persistent as she is, she plans to improve her business further. More cooking wares and utensils are needed as of now. She will also buy additional stock of frozen foods, meat, vegetables, and condiments. Again, she is imploring your kindness to extend her another loan worth PhP 40,000. This will meet the increasing demand for her business. Her increased productivity will surely give her higher profit and continuous livelihood for her five helpers.

Wella has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she can maintain her integrity. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking wares, utensils, stock of frozen foods, meat, vegetables, and condiments for her catering service

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Ending his first Kiva deal, this young farmer harries to be thankful for great support that Kiva gave him. Vahe is 29 years old and he lives alone in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. In his farm Vahe is mainly busy with poultry (he has 100 chickens and sells a lot of poultry and eggs) but he also has cows and piglets in his farm. In potato cultivation he is also engaged, since he has regular customers who take them from his farm in big amounts.

Vahe says that he likes his farming very much and compared with a year ago now he is more skilled and experienced in it. This time again Vahe needs Kiva support, in order to develop his poultry, that is to buy nearly 200 chickens and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to develop his poultry farm, that is to buy nearly 200 chickens and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 39 years old, divorced woman, with 2 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a clothing purchase and sale business. She buys clothes in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Perveen expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Srey works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 35 years old. He is married and has 3 children. 

His business is a food cafe. He has been in the business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of forty two thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase food like flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans etc. for the cafe as well as add some furniture. 

He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children as well as expanding the cafe. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food like flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans etc. for his cafe, as well as add some furniture.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish has been operating her own retail store for more than three years and she earns well from this. She works hard with her business in order to make a living. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Irish hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Vivtoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. She runs a business computer services, with internet services.

She has been in the business for three years. She earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase toner cartridges, printing papers and envelops. She will use the profits from expanded business service her loan and meet family expenses. Her hopes and dreams are to be a prominent entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase toner cartridges, printing papers and envelops.

loans.name: Etelinda

texts.es:
Etelinda, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus nietos.

Etelinda, tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos y de ganado, sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo y ella considero que era un buen negocio y continuo ejerciéndolo, la pequeña granja está en su casa.

Etelinda, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para cerdos y para comprar más cerdos, porque debido a la sequía no hubo pasto los animales, es por eso que necesita comprar alimento para ellos.

En un futuro planea tener una de las granjas de cerdos más grande de la zona.
texts.en:
buy supplies for pigs and buy more pigs.

Etelinda, 64 years old, finished fifth grade, is married and lives with her husband and grandchildren. Etelinda has devoted more than 15 years to the raising of pigs and cattle; her parents worked in the same thing and she thought it was a good business and continued to exercise it. The little farm is at her home.

Etelinda needs the loan to buy supplies for pigs and to buy more pigs, because due to the drought there was no grass for the animals. It is for that reason that she needs to buy food for them. In the future she plans to have one of the largest pig farms in the area.

loans.use: buy supplies for pigs and buy more pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old and married with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rosa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalina is 58 years old, a widow with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a plasticware retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Rosalina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of plasticware to sell.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plasticware to sell.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Richelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

In the future, Richelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

loans.name: Fari

texts.en:
Fari is 26 years old and single who lives with his mother, as families in the rural areas do. His father died many years ago, when Fari was very young.

His mother has been in and out the hospital for years. He is requesting this loan to pay for his mother visitation to a health specialist.

Fari works with an aluminum doors & windows manufacturing company, for a monthly pay of approximately $242. In the two dynym agricultural land his family owns, he plants seasonal veggies, grains, potatoes, pulses etc and has orchards such as plums, apples and grapevines. All these products are for family's consumption. About 500 square meters he has rented out to one of his distant relatives who has occupied the land with beehives. Thus, this brings Fari an income as little as $9.7/month.

loans.use: to pay the medical costs for his widowed mother .

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 39 years old, married woman; shown in the photo with her husband and one child. Her husband is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Shahida has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Shahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's van to provide better facilities to his customers.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. She graduated Gavar State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of secondary classes. From 1993 till today she works at a school as a teacher of secondary classes. Gayane is married and he has a large family; she lives with her husband, son, two daughters and mother-in-law. Her husband is a veterinarian.

Gayane mentions that she likes her work very much and tries to help each pupil in any hardship if they have any. Gayane with her family is also engaged in farming after her work at the school.
