This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Gayane asks as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature for her self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature for her self-development activities

loans.name: Yuth's Group

texts.en: Yuth’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yuth works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobiais a 32-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time.

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering materials.

loans.use: to buy new wooden boards and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab is a 47 year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four children, some of them is still attending school. She works in collaboration with her siblings in order to fulfill their family needs and to live in a respectful way. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her nephews’ educational fees. She insist that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for them in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her nephews’ educational fees

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old. He is married and has four children.

David's business is a retail shop. He has been in this business for seven years. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy to buy stocks of sugar, rice, soft drinks, detergents, cooking fat, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour to sell to his customers daily.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his brother. His hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, rice, soft drinks, detergents, cooking fat, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour to sell to his customers daily.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is dairy cows and farming. He has been in the business for 15 years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and animal feeds. He will use the profits from expanded business to conveniently buy animal feeds and farm inputs. His hopes and dreams are to uplift his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is positive that the children of a driver and a “sari-sari” store owner can also obtain a college degree. This goal fuels her to properly manage her store, while her husband, Doan, also works hard as a driver to supply their needs.

Melody’s once small sari-sari store is slowly developing into a grocery store. As soon as she’s able to complete and stabilize her grocery, she plans to invest in another business. She’s thinking of selling ready-to-wear apparel that can be placed adjacent to her grocery.

For now, she would like to ask for PHP 17,000 additional capital to buy more stocks to fill in some spaces of her store. She’s really working hard hoping that her income would be enough to save the amount needed to secure the title of their lot. Then she will procure a motorcycle. She’s a woman with many dreams but her foremost priority is the completion of her children’s college education, and regular financial support to her relatives.

Melody is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and beverages for her store

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Sonia is a 37-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a security guard while Sonia operates various businesses such as running a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, and candies. She also raises pigs and is also engaged in a small eatery business. Sonia describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a larger loan to buy grocery items (mentioned earlier). She will also buy piglets and food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil for her food selling business. Her goal in life is to let her children finish their studies. She is so thankful with the people who can help her make her dreams come true. By giving her the amount she is requesting, we can possibly give her the chance to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, piglets (to raise), meat, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil

loans.name: Raden

texts.en: Raden lives a simple life with his family in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. He is a 37-year-old, married man who raised his family through his fishing business. Aside from this, Raden and his wife are running a sari-sari store. Thus, he is asking for a larger loan to buy a new fishing boat and to buy assorted grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, spices, toiletries, chips, candy, biscuits, sugar, salt, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, and juice. Raden wants to improve their means of living. Thus, he is aiming for business improvements in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, oodles, canned goods, spices, toiletries, chips, candy, biscuits, sugar, salt, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, and juice

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: A 29-year-old man named Joel raised his family by running a fishing business. He is a married man who has two children aged one and three years old. In spite of the obstacles that Joel has encountered, including bad weather conditions that always hinders his ability to increase his catch, he is determined to continue running his business. Thus, he aims in the future to enhance his livelihood so he can provide for the needs of his family.  He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net and a fishing knot (serves as the main line to the fishing net). He also requires capital to pay for a laborer. Joel and his wife are also engaged in the business of buying and selling dried fish as another source of income.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a fishing knot (serves as the main line to the fishing net) and to pay for a laborer

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His business buys and sells cattle and goats. He has been in this business for 15 years. He earns a monthly income of eighty thousand Kenya shillings. This is his sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase livestock for sale. He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy and educated family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for sale

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with of three children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have educated children and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Jocelyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, fish net, sacks of salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, fish net, sacks of salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Fidel Victoriano

texts.es:
Fidel, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Fidel, tiene aproximadamente 15 años de dedicarse a la albañilería y a la carpintería, pero además de eso cultiva y le gusta tener ganado, el cual sus hijos cuidan.

El préstamo para comprar una vaca, porque tiene un terreno donde sembró y ha quedado pasto para alimentar vacas, de esta manera se le ayudará a él para que tenga otra fuente de ingreso para su familia. 

En un futuro planea tener más ganado y elaborar quesos para la venta.
texts.en:
Fidel, 51 years old, finished third grade, is in a relationship and lives with his partner and their two children, who attend the community school. Fidel has worked for approximately 15 years in masonry and carpentry, but besides that he raises and likes to have cattle, which his children care for.

The loan is to buy a cow, because he has a plot of land where he planted and grass has remained to feed cows. In this manner he will be helped to have another source of income for his family. In the future he plans to have more cattle and to make cheese for sale.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Hameeda's Group

texts.en:
Hameeda is 49-years old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s cloths. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers, this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now with the increase in their needs they consider it necessary to grow the business. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.

Therefore, Hameeda took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothing to sell.
She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene and her husband are engaged in the fishing business like most of the communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. They have been doing this for three years to earn a living. Aside from fishing, Marlene is also engaged in raising pigs. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net to help them enhance their catch. She will also buy piglets to raise and feed as well. 41-year-old Marlene dreams in the future to let her children finish their studies and have a better life someday. Additionally, she has a three-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, piglets, and feed

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
A 29-year-old married father of three children. This is Khaled, a Palestinian refugees who works hard to provide his beloved family with a decent, safe and joyful life. Working in the construction business, specialized in painting houses is his career. It wasn't his planned for life career, but unfortunately Palestinians in Lebanon have certain restraints set against them that have to do with working sectors and employment policies and procedures. Thus, he find himself the sole breadwinner of his family and wants to provide them with everything possible.

It's been fifteen years since he started this business, and he is well known in his region and domain and recommended by his customers.

His business just like any other business flows between high and low seasons. That's why he must make sure to manage distributing his supply and demand according to his acquired income and family's needs.

Today, and since Khaled's family experienced a hard winter season early last year, he is taking the necessary precautions to avoid future obstacles. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase the necessary protection for his house to keep it safe from rain and thunderstorms during the winter season.
He hopes that in the future, he can expand his business through providing diversified construction services.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary protection for his house to keep it safe from rain and thunderstorms during the winter season.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a resident of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is 57 years old woman and a mother of six adult children. Edna and her husband earn a living by fishing. They have been doing this for five years. Aside from fishing, Edna does buying and selling of scrap for recycling, in order to enhance their livelihood.  She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets She also needs an amount for additional capital to buy scrap. In the future, she wants to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and scrap for recycling.

loans.name: Gonenroses Group

texts.en:
Jena is the featured borrower of GoneNroses group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon, for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Jena is a 49-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines. Jena is the first lady on the right, Divinia is the lady in the middle, and Rosela is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees in Philippine

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 27,000 in which she bought yards of fabric of cashmeres, silks, polyesters, and for the initial rental advance to a second stall in addition to her current clothing stall. As of today, her stall is located inside a mall and she is gaining steady customers ordering and buying her clothes. The loan enabled her to increase her income to help in their everyday needs, and also to improve her business in a way that she is now able to hire two helpers to operate her clothing store.

Irine is now asking for another loan in the amount of PHP 60,000 to buy more yards of fabric to be sewn as dresses, and to sell as additional clothes in her new store. She wants to take the opportunity to increase her income as the holiday is fast approaching, and clothes are most in demand in this season. With the additional capital, Irine has a better opportunity to increase her income and still sell clothes at a low price.

She is working hard in her business to help provide better comfort for her family and most of all for the education of her children. Irine is now in Small Enterprise, as she is not just doing business to provide for her family, but also to provide employment to her community.

loans.use: to buy more yards of fabric to be sewn as dresses and to sell as additional clothes in her new store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with of two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 11 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve crop production. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a better business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve crop production.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, habita en casa propia, vive felizmente junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, una hija de 4 años de edad y dos hijos mayores de edad. María para poder sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia presta sus servicios domésticos, labor que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo y así también con el aporte que realiza su esposo logran cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. En vista de su necesidad, María, decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, hierro, madera y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un servicio sanitario, y de esta manera poder tener un mejor ambiente en su vivienda y así evitar posibles enfermedades.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old. She lives happily in her own house together with her life companion and her children, a 4 year old daughter and two adult sons. María in order to survive and to get her family ahead provides domestic services, work she has done for a long time. With her husband's contribution they manage to cover the basic needs of their household.

In view of her need María has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, re-bar, wood and pay for labor to construct a bathroom. In this way she can have a better life at her house and also avoid possible illnesses.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, re-bar, wood and pay for labor to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Petronillah

texts.en:
Petronillah is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her businesses are farming and a retail shop. She has been in business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock for her store of sugar, rice, detergents, cooking oil, maize flour etc. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her shop of sugar, rice, detergents, cooking oil, maize flour etc.

loans.name: Delmy Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmy de 25 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 2, 5 y 8 años de edad. Delmy es una persona muy trabajadora quien presta sus servicios en una empresa en las cercanías a su localidad con el fin de sacar adelante a sus tres hijos y darles una buena educación, además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. La vivienda de Delmy es pequeña y muy humilde, se ha construido con pedazos de plásticos y lámina deteriorada, el sueño de ella es poder vivir en una casa con materiales de mejor calidad y de esta forma brindarles una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos, de esta manera poder dormir sin preocupación los días de lluvias y para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloque, arena, cemento, láminas, hierro, clavos y pago de mano de obra para construir su vivienda. La cual desea hacer con la base de bloque y continuarla con lámina nueva y de buena calidad, de esta manera vivir mejor y de una forma más segura, sin temor a alguna tragedia por los cambios climáticos que en la actualidad se ven.
texts.en:
Delmy is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her life's companion and her children, ages 2, 5, and 8. Delmy is a very hard working person who is employed in an enterprise near her locality. She is working to advance her three children and to offer them a good education. In addition, her life's companion helps with the household economy.

Delmy's house is small and very humble. It is composed of pieces of plastic and deteriorated sheet metal.

Delmy's dream is to be able to live in a house constructed of better quality materials and, in this way, to provide a better life for her children, who will be able to sleep with less preoccupation on rainy days.

For this reason, she has requested a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement blocks plus new and better quality sheets of laminate, and as a consequence, to live better and more securely, without fear of tragedy due to climate changes than they have up to the present.

loans.use: invest in cement blocks, sand, cement, corrugated metal sheeting, iron, and nails, and to pay workers to construct a better house.

loans.name: Mybelyn Astrid

texts.es: Astrid de 29 años de edad, tiene 15 años de residir en vivienda propia y en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hijo de 11 años, sobrina de 10 años, un sobrino de 3 años de edad y al lado de su madre. Astrid es una persona muy trabajadora quien presta sus servicios en una empresa en las cercanías a su localidad, así también Astrid en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, busca otro medio por el cual obtener ingresos extras para la economía de su hogar y es para ello que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en sus tiempos libres, negocio que administra en su vivienda, además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. La vivienda de Astrid por el pasar de los años va bajando la calidad de los materiales con los que se ha construido y en este caso el techo de la vivienda se ha ido deteriorando haciendo más difícil la estancia en el hogar por la lluvia y es por ello que Astrid solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, hierro, clavos galvanizados y en el pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda. De esta manera estar más tranquilos y seguros y sin la preocupación por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Astrid, 29 years old, has lived in her own home for 15 years; she lives there with her life partner, her 11 year-old son, 10-year old niece, a 3 year-old nephew, and her mother.

Astrid is a very hardworking person who works for a company on the outskirts of her town. As well, looking to improve her quality of life and that of her family, Astrid looks for another means by which to obtain additional income for household expenses. For that reason she sells used clothing in her free time, a business she manages in her home; her life partner also helps her with the household expenses.

Astrid’s home, due to the passing of time, has suffered a degradation of the materials with which it was constructed; in this case the roof has been deteriorating, making it more difficult to live in the house due to the rain. And it is for this reason that Astrid is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheet metal, iron, galvanized nails and payment for labor to change the roof of her house, and in this manner have more peace and security without having to worry about the rain.

loans.use: invest in: sheet metal, iron, galvanized nails and payment for labor to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Kimheak's Group

texts.en:
Kimheak, 29, is single and she lives in Kampong Cham province. She is an industrious woman who raises pigs to earn the main source of income. She also sells some grocery items for additional income, as well. The challenge for her pig-raising business is the pigs occasionally get ill.

She formed a group with two members to request a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy piglets and pig feed to nourish them. She hopes to generate more income to improve her living conditions and expand the pigsty.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed to nourish them well, so that she can sell them for a better price.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 37-year-old married father of two beautiful daughters (featured with him in the photo). Three years ago, he got employed as a mechanic with a limited salary. He tries desperately to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is supported by his beloved wife, who works as a tutor and works hard for their daughters' happiness.

Today, Rabih is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. This is his third loan cycle with Al Majmoua. He has proven to be a good-standing borrower. His previous loans were also used for his daughters' school tuition fees, which is his main aim at this time.

Providing a better future for his beloved daughters is what he works hard to accomplish. He hopes that one day he can manage to establish his own business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Marta de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive al lado de sus hijos de 5 y 17 años de edad y una hija de 13 años. Marta con mucho esfuerzo lucha por que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan crecer con todo lo necesario en su vida. Marta se dedica a vender papelería en un Centro Escolar que se encuentra en las cercanías de su vivienda, actividad a la que se dedica durante las mañanas, así también posee un pequeño negocio en el cual vende carteras y bolsones en la entrada de una empresa vecina a su comunidad, y de esta manera obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus hijos. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Marta decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y a la vez construir un pequeño muro frente a su casa, y es que debido al paso del tiempo el techo de su vivienda se ha deteriorado y necesita ser reparado por las filtraciones del agua en esta época de lluvias y de esta manera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 42 years old. She is a single mother who lives together with her 5 and 17 year old sons and her 13 year old daughter. With great effort Marta has fought so that her children don't go without and can grow up with everything they need.

Marta works selling stationary in a educational center located close to her house. She does this activity in the mornings and she also has a small business selling wallets and purses at the entrance to a neighboring company in her community. In this way she obtains the income needed to cover her basic necessities and those of her children.

Looking to improve her quality of living Marta decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminated sheeting, nails, cement, sand and pay for labor to improve the roof of her house and construct a small wall in front of her house. With the passing of time her roof has deteriorated and it needs to be repaired to stop the infiltration of water in the rainy season. In this way she can improve her quality of living and that of her children a little.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting, nails, cement, sand and pay for labor to improve the roof of her house and construct a small wall.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is 36 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a power loom worker by profession. He has been working for five years to meet the family’s expenses. A loom is a device used to weave cloth and tapestry. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the warp threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads. Her husband used power loom machine for binding the fabric. Now, Balqees’ husband wants to buy a power loom machine for proper income but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to buy a winding machine. Therefore, Balqees has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Balqees’ husband can buy a power loom machine to earn an income. Balqees and her family will be thankful to Kiva, the lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a power loom machine for her husband.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 35 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife and their six children. His wife is unemployed and four of his children are completing their middle school studies. His house was damaged by the last war in Gaza.

Mohammad wants to rebuild his home's ceiling and windows. The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend damages and to be able pay workers. One of his biggest dreams is to see his children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone for helping him.

loans.use: to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend damages and to be able pay workers; he wants to rebuild the celling and the windows.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad, habita en casa propia en donde ha vivido toda su vida, ahí vive felizmente junto a su esposo y su madre de 70 años de edad. María para poder sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia presta sus servicios en una empresa, la cual se encuentra en las cercanías a su vivienda, labor que viene realizando desde hace varios años, de esta manera hace todo lo posible por cubrir sus necesidades básicas y ayudar a su madre de avanzada edad para que no le falte nada, así también con el aporte que realiza su esposo con su trabajo logran solventar la economía del hogar. María y su familia habitan en una casa muy humilde y con el pasar de los años va mostrando partes deterioradas, principalmente el techo de su vivienda, el cual es el más propenso a deteriorarse. Es de vital importancia repararlo para poder estar más tranquilos y seguros por la temporada de lluvias en esta época del año. Es por ello que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera ella y su familia puedan estar más tranquilos en esta época de invierno.
texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and lives in her own house where she has lived all her life.  There, she lives happily with her husband and her 70 year old mother. 

To survive and raise her family, Mary works in a factory near her home.  She has been involved in this type of work for several years.  In this way, she is able to cover her basic needs and help her elderly mother so that she will not lack anything.  Along with contributions made by her husband they manage to absolve their home finances. 

Maria and her family live in a humble home which, over the years, is showing damaged parts, mainly the roof of her house, which is the one that is most likely to deteriorate.  It is vital to repair it so as to be able to feel relaxed and and safe for it is the rainy season at this time of year. 

That is why Maria is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, beams and payment for labor to improve the roof of her house and so she and her family can rest easier during winter time.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, beams and payment for labor to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Sintia Lorena

texts.es: Sintia, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, reside en una comunidad del municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería y hace tres años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, como ser arroz, frijoles, huevos, refrescos, churros, pan, condimentos y otros abarrotes. El prestamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con la institución y es por 22,000 Lempiras, el cual piensa invertir su préstamo en la compra de productos para su pulpería como ser: carne de pollo, arroz, harina, golosinas,huevos, refrescos, frijoles y otros abarrotes y con una parte del prestamo va terminar de cancelar un saldo pendiente de deuda. El préstamo le ayudará en surtir más el negocio y obtener más ganancias. Sus metas son mejorar su vivienda y graduar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sintia is 30 years old, a single mother, has two children, and lives in a community in the town of Progreso, Yoro. In the past she was dedicated to selling merchandise, and three years ago she established a general store where she sells basic need products like rice, beans, eggs, soda, churros, bread, seasoning, and other groceries.

The loan that she is requesting is her second cycle with the institution and is for 22,000 Lempiras. She plans to use the loan to buy products for her general store like chicken, rice, flour, candy, eggs, soda, beans, and other groceries; and part of it to finish settling the outstanding balance of her debt.

The loan will help her to stock up her business and to get more profit. Her goals are to improve her home and for her children to graduate.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, eggs, flour, candy, soda, beans, and other items to sell; and to pay the balance of her debt.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is the age of 56 and a mother of five children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He owns a mechanical workshop. He has been running the mechanical workshop 10 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now he wants to buy mechanical machinery to earn a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase the mechanical machinery. Therefore, Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Naseem’s husband can purchase the mechanical machinery to earn an income.

Naseem and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy mechanical machinery for her husband.

loans.name: Romani

texts.en:
Romani is 67 years old, from Kutaisi, in west Georgia. He has a 29-year-old son, who works as a private artisan and gets a small income. They find it hard to tackle the financial difficulties, as the only breadwinner is his son, who is unable to cover all family expenses. Romani has great desire to make his bit to the family's well being and generate his own income.

He tried for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 1,300 USD for purchasing a secondhand car and start a taxi business. He will serve local people as a taxi driver, and will get his own daily income. This credit will be a great support for the family. Romani is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is the age of 52 and a mother of eight children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He owns an air conditioner repair shop. He has been running the air conditioner repair shop for five years to meet the family’s expenses. Now he wants to buy AC repair instruments to earn a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase the AC repairing instruments.

Therefore, Bano has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Bano’s son can purchase AC repair instruments to earn an income. Bano and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy instruments for her son's AC repair shop.

loans.name: Chandni

texts.en:
Chandni is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for three years.

Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Chandni's husband needs maintenance work on his taxi. The current condition of his taxi is not good because it requires much maintenance on a daily basis.

Her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Chandni has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Chandni's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. He then will provide better transport services to earn profitable income.

Chandni also plans to save some of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Chandni is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Chingoma Group

texts.en:
Stella is 44 years old. She is widowed and has one child and two orphans that depend on her.

Stella owns a hawker (a small, roadside grocery stand). She would like to use this loan to buy rice, beans and eggs to stock up the hawker. She has three paid employees that help with running the business.

Stella started her food stand so she could be financially independent. The profits from the business will help her to send her child to school and enable her to buy food for her family.

Stella hopes to build a good house for her family and also grow her hawker into a full-fledged grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs and beans for her hawker

loans.name: Elia Gricelda

texts.es: Elia de 20 años de edad, quien vive de manera humilde junto a sus padres y una hermanita de 5 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido desde su nacimiento. Elia es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logra llevar y de esta manera ayuda en la economía del hogar para que de esta forma poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida. La casa en la que habita es humilde y en busca de mejorarla, Elia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para encementar las paredes y reparar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Elia is 20 years old and lives humbly with her parents and a younger sister who is 5 years old. She has lived in the house they own since she was born. Elia is a very responsible young person and a hard worker. 

She makes her living raising and selling chickens and has managed to get her business underway through hard work and dedication. She is helping the household economy and in this way, little by little, is improving her quality of life. 

The house where she lives is modest and needs improvement. She is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and to pay for labor to cement the walls and repair the floor of the home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and to pay labor to cement the walls and repair the floor of the home.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Shirley, and this is her small general store located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. Shirley noticed that her store is not that appealing to customers due to her limited stock. Many customers prefer a store with a wide variety of selections. This is the reason that she wants to avail PHP 10,000 of additional capital to buy volumes of supplies like grocery items, beverages, and frozen foods such as chorizo, hotdogs, ham, and dressed chicken. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community.

If her store will grow and improve, she plans to control and slightly lower the retail price of her goods, so as to attract more buyers. Subsequently if her capital increases, she will also venture into selling of RTW’s. Her husband, Serafin, also works relentlessly to support their needs and the college expenses of their youngest daughter. This will pave the way for a more stable job for her in the future.

Shirley prays for a peaceful life and a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volumes of supplies like grocery items, beverages, and frozen foods such as chorizo, hotdogs, ham, and dressed chicken.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been running her retail business for 10 years. By applying for this loan, Gayane asks lenders to help her purchase new stock for the store (food, drinks, home supplies and some clothing).

Gayane considers it very important to have a large variety of products offered to her customers so she can meet their demand.

Gayane has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Gayane to invest in her store and develop it. She is now able to earn enough income to make monthly payments and she hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store (food, drinks, home supplies and some clothing).

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 39-year-old married woman. Her husband has been running a business selling milk for many years. He has three buffaloes, which provide him with milk to sell to the people of his locality.

He has a good client list and makes enough to support his family. He has been selling milk in front of his house but now he wants to sell milk at a shop. but he does not have enough savings for a shop.

This is Zubaida's fifth loan from Kiva field partner’s BRAC Pakistan. Her husband has gradually improved his business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. This loan will allow him to open a shop. Zubaida is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's milk shop.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 50-year-old, married father of four children, who has been employed in a car maintenance company since 2004. He is a hardworking employee, who puts so much effort into improving his family's living, especially because he is his family's sole earner.

His limited monthly salary forces him to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his daughters’ increasing school tuition fees. They are present next to him in the picture. His family is his life, and he always seeks to provide them with the best education. This is his third loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, where all his previous loans were invested in the place, and he has an impressive repayment history.

loans.use: to pay for his daughters' increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Jenny Marvely

texts.es: Jenny de 36 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de su hijo de 13 años de edad. Jenny tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual vende artículos básicos del hogar, negocio con el cual ayuda a cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, así también su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Jenny necesita mejorar la infraestructura en su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro de contención, ya que en los días de lluvia Jenny tiene un problema, y es que se filtra el agua por la parte de enfrente debido a que no cuenta con nada que retenga el agua que corre por las constantes lluvias.
texts.en:
Jenny is 36 years old and lives alongside her life partner and her 13-year-old son. Jenny has a small business in which she sells basic household goods, a business with which she helps cover the basic needs of her family. Her husband also helps with the household expenses.

Jenny needs to improve the foundation of her home, for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, brick, and steel, and to pay for labor for the construction of a retaining wall. This is because on rainy days Jenny has a problem, and it is that the water leaks in the front due to her not having anything to retain the water that flows from the constant rain.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and steel, and to pay for labor for the construction of a retaining wall.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan tiene 66 años, es una persona  que  se dedica más de 20 años a  la producción de papas, a pesar de su avanzada edad continua su emprendimiento para conseguir el alimento diario, Juan  solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos y al final lograr un buen resultado económico para sustentar su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Juan Cortez is 66 years old. He is a person who has worked producing potatoes for more than 20 years. In spite of his advanced age, he continues his business venture in order to obtain daily sustenance. 

Juan is applying for the money from the loan to invest it in the purchase of fungicides in order to have healthy crops and in the end achieve a good economic result to sustain his humble household.

loans.use: to invest in the production of potatoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una emprendedora de 30 años de edad, residenciada en Cartagena de Indias, una ciudad donde ha logrado crecer comercialmente a través de su perspicacia para los negocios. Cuando ella se reubicó en un nuevo barrio, palpó la falencia de servicios ofimáticos de impresión y fotocopiado, e inmediatamente buscó las maneras satisfacer esta necesidad entre los habitantes del sector por intermedio de un préstamo con el que adquirió los equipos necesarios para empezar a funcionar.  Dentro de poco empezó a incorporar a sus servicios venta de minutos a todos los operadores de celular, golosinas y mecatos para incrementar sus ingresos, así mismo lavadoras para el servicio de alquiler.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una mesa, una fotocopiadora más completa y surtir de mecatos, con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer a sus dos hijas un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 30 year old entrepreneur who resides in Cartagena de Indias. She has managed to grow commercially in this city through her business insight. When she moved to a new neighborhood she felt the lack of computer services to download and make copies. She immediately looked for the way to satisfy this need of the inhabitants of the area through a loan which she acquired all the equipment she needed to start to function. Shortly after she started to sell minutes for cell phone users, sweets and pastries to increase her income as well as washing machines for rent.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in the purchase of a table, a more complex photocopy machine and an assortment of pastries. With this investment she hopes to improve her income and provide her two daughters a better future.

loans.use: to invest in a table, a more complex photocopier and an assortment of pastries.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are regular.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

He hopes that in the future, he will have good living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Rem is a 38-year-old widowed mother of three children living in Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she has grown rice for twenty years. She also works in a factory and other paid jobs to earn additional income. She is able to earn around $12 USD per day to provide for her children's needs.

Recently, her rice was destroyed by insects which drastically reduced her income. Due to having not enough working capital, she is now leading a group of three to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income to be able to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her income to be able to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dúo Brisas De Barcenas Group

texts.es: Dúo Brisas de Barcenas, Ana Gabriela es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella tiene 25 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras,  cosméticos, y ropa para caballeros, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años cuando termino sus estudios a nivel medio, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería nueva para invertir en su negocio ya que actualmente sus clientes han solicitado diversidad de productos y asi satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que asi puede cuidar a su hijo y obtener ingresos para el hogar es cuarto crédito que ella tiene en Fape y agradece a Fape el apoyo que recibe, anhela tener un lugar propio para tener su local, compra de ropa para venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Brisas de Barcenas

Ana is a single mother with a two year old son. She is 25 years old, and she sells clothes, shoes, purses, cosmetics, and men's clothes. She started her business eight years go when she finished secondary school.

She is requesting the loan to buy new merchandise in order to invest in her business. Her customers have currently requested a diversity of products, and this way she will meet their needs. She likes her work a lot. This way she is able to take care of her son and get income for the household.

This is her fourth loan with FAPE.

She is grateful for the support she is getting from FAPE.

She longs to have her own place in order to have a spot to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jangaa

texts.en: Jangaa is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, milk, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, milk, soap and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, milk, soap and other items.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya, 19, is a young, single lady, who lives with her parents in Hashmeye. She has a small ‎grocery in her region, and her friends encouraged her to set up her business in this location. ‎ Haya is from a poor family and they live in a difficult financial situation. She could not ‎complete here education, but that does not keep Haya from standing up to these obstacles ‎without doing anything. Conversely, she started her own business and opened her small ‎grocery. She gets a good income from her work and she is very happy to work in this field.‎ ‎

Haya needs a loan to pay for her new products; she wants to purchase more food supplies ‎to offer a wider variety of products.‎ Haya dreams of getting her university degree, and to have more branches from her grocery.‎

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies ‎to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Jaliina

texts.en:
Jaliina is a repeat borrower with UGAFODE MDI. She is married with six children and is a resident of Ndejje. She has applied for a loan of 3,500,000 UGX to increase her shoe selling business.

However, Jaliina is faced with the challenge of low working capital that leads to loss of customers and business, and she is so hopeful that if financed her business will attract more business from customers and also increase her income.

She is so grateful for UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva funds that have helped to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow to enable him do dairy farming on the side.

His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Arsheen

texts.en:
Arsheen, age 39, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials to resell. However, due to lack of money, her husband finds it difficult. This would help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

For that, his wife Arsheen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials. Arsheen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his embroidery business.

loans.name: Dúo Martina De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Martina de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Martina de 64 años de edad, quien vive en una de las calles principales del pueblo.  Tiene una hija y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y lucha para que el negocio crezca cada día.  Es vendedora ambulante de juguetes de feria y tiene varios puntos de venta en diferentes pueblos.  Hay varios pedidos que tiene que cumplirle a sus compradoras y le hace falta materiales como papel esmaltado, plumas, cartón especial y diferentes tipos de juguetes de feria, por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y tener una bonita venta.
texts.en:
Martina is in charge of Dúo Martina de San Pedro (Duo Martina of San Pedro) group. She is 64 years old and lives in one of the main streets of town. She has a daughter and has the unconditional support of her husband. She is striving to make the business grow every day. She is a toy vendor at fairs and has several outlets in different towns.

She has several orders for which she is missing the materials such as glazed paper, pens, special cardboard, and different types of toys that are typical at fairs. She requests a loan to buy what she needs in order to have good sales.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell at fairs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in Gaza and works at a general store. Ahmad applied for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house. Ahmad's house needs repairs after the last war in Gaza, and making it better will allow his family to live in more psychologically comfort. He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs and help his parents. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house and make it better, which will allow him to live in more psychological comfort. He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is a 47-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.

Tanveer has been running her own beauty salon for past seven years. She also contributes her income, along with her husband, to manage the household.

Tanveer needs to buy different types of cosmetics (e.g., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories) for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose.

Therefore, Tanveer has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose, so she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Tanveer is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis está estudiando la carrera de instrumentación quirúrgica, él está en su segundo año, y se esfuerza para poder ser un buen profesional para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
El está estudiando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de sus conocimientos, ser útil no solo a sí mismo, sino también a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Derlis is studying surgical instrumentation, he is in his second year, and he strives to be a good professional in order to be able to help others.

He is studying in order to be someone in life, and through his knowledge, to be useful not only to himself but also to his family.

He is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay his university fees, and in this manner be able to continue fighting to realize his goals.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita con 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo, en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque.Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de la zona en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Emerita se dedica a la actividad de servicio de mano de obra agrícola en los campos del anexo la curva y sectores aledaños, desde hace más de 5 años de antiguedad. Solicita préstamo para la comercialización de animales. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ha tenido préstamos con nuestra institución, el último fue de S/.1,000.00 a 12 meses y lo a pagado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Emerita is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque. She has good personal and work references from the people who live in the area. The majority of people in the local area make a living from agriculture, small business and livestock.

For the last five years Emerita has made her living working as an agricultural labourer in the fields located in the "anexo La Curva" and surrounding areas. She is asking for a loan to start selling animals at market. She hopes to grow her business, increase her income and improve her quality of life.

She has borrowed from us in the past, her most recent loan for $1,000 over 12 months was paid on time.

loans.use: to sell animals at market and grow her business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: 19 years ago, Shabana started a small school in her home. With the help of her husband (pictured with her), the school grew into a renowned community school. Today, there are 574 students in the school. Providing education to females is at the heart of Shabana’s personal mission and 47% of her students are female. Making education accessible for both girls and boys from all income levels is an important goal for Shabana; however, she says lack of money is a constant challenge. She has recently requested a loan of 100,000 PKR to build an additional class room in the school.

loans.use: to build an additional class room in her school.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal and fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop well.

His children are growing and their needs are as well. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business, but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk. Therefore, Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy initial inventories of vegetables in bulk to sell from her husband's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia wants to prepare well for the next crop season, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations.  In order to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, she has applied for a loan from the Cooperative.  

She hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer to grow more produce.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila, aged 59, from the province of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Cristobal, a government employee, with whom she has grown-up children. One of them is currently reviewing for the licensure exam. Lucila’s whole family is working diligently to gain enough resources for their everyday needs and savings for the future.

While her husband goes to work everyday, she operates a general store that sells usual commodities like toiletries, snack items, canned goods, and beverages. Her eldest child also contributes by way of paying their monthly utilities such as electricity and water. But there are circumstances that Lucila cannot control like typhoons and other calamities. They are actually survivors of Typhoon Haiyan that swept Visayas region two years ago. They were able to rehabilitate their business through unity and cooperation.

Lucila’s experience during Haiyan strengthened her resolve to improve her business. She aims to buy more grocery items, beverages, frozen goods, and wallet load with the help of PHP 20,000 additional capital. She hopes you can extend your assistance to her and may you receive more blessings in return.

Lucila faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, beverages, frozen goods, and wallet load.

loans.name: Nadire

texts.en: The loan in the amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek that Nadire is requesting from you will be used to make some basic improvements to their family home.Nadire is married and a 30-year-old mother of a 4 and 1 year old. As far as their family's income is concerned, it comes from her profession as a seamstress and she stitches almost anything from clothing to bedding sheets, drapes, sofa covers, etc. "I had never done this profession before and no one had taught me this, but we had no money at all to eat, so I needed to do something and this was easy in a sense because i could do it from home while raising my little ones and paying no money for rent or other expenses," said Nadire to the loan officer who disbursed the loan to her. Her husband works on wood crafting projects but it is not a stable income. There is also a disability and some welfare income for their family. As someone can tell, her family is very poor and they need your compassion also to allow them to make the improvements to their home.

loans.use: to make some very basic improvements to her family's home because they are very poor.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is 41 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small garment store in which he sells jeans, pants, shirts and inner garments. He has been running this business for many years. The current business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family. It is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him.

Therefore, Hafeezan took a loan for her husband’s business. With help from this loan, he will purchase more used latest garments to sell.

Hafeezan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the latest garments for her husband's garment store.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas,  a la vez que estudia también trabaja para poder cumplir sus metas y objetivos.
Le falta poco para poder terminar sus estudios, y pone todo de sí para poder cumplir con sus metas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Christian is studying business administration; at the same time as he studies he is also working, in order to be able to realize his goals and objectives.

He only has a little way to go to finish his studies, and he is putting his all in order to be able to meet his goals. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

He is asking for this loan in order to be able to cover his university expenses, and in this manner be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: pay university expenses.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 47-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her son has been running a general store for the past four years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Zahida's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes, but due to financial constraints, he is not in suitable position to buy all of these products to sell.

Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all of these commodities and also will help him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to increase his general store business.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, which caused him to be unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en: Rachelle is engaged in various businesses. She has been running a sari-sari store for almost six years. In addition to this she sells food and frozen goods. Rachelle is a married woman and has three children ages 17, nine and seven years old. Her husband works abroad to provide for the needs of their children and give them a good education. Rachelle uses her earnings for their daily consumption and to buy some personal care products. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice, soft drinks and some drinking liquor. She will also buy frozen goods to sell. In the future, she wishes to send all her children to school and for them to finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice, soft drinks, some drinking liquor and frozen goods.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, trabaja en un banco a la vez que está estudiando,  es una persona  honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio, desea sobresalir adelante profesionalmente a través de los logros obtenidos. 
Su meta es de tener su título y poder trabajar de forma independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de tesis, y de esa forma tener cubierto ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Gloria is a young student in the city of Santaní. She works in a bank at the same time as she is studying. She is an honest and responsible, and is very dedicated to her studies. She wants to stand out professionally through the achievements she has won.

Her goal is to hold a degree and to be able to work independently.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in covering her thesis expenses, and in that way have that expense she has covered.

loans.use: to cover thesis expenses.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 48-year-old mother of five living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shakeela's son owns a laundry which he has run for 5 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.

Shakeela’s son wants to buy washing machine to increase his income, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do so. Therefore, Shakeela has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shakeela’s son can purchase a washing machine to increase his income. Shakeela and her family are very thankful to the KIVA lenders and BRAC Pakistan for funding this loan and helping to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her dry cleaner shop.

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en:
Gogita is a 23-year-old married man from the Ozurgeti district. He lives with his wife, parents and pensioner grandmother.

Gogita is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land, where the family grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Gogita needs to purchase a tractor.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a tractor and will use it for cultivation. He will also rent it out to generate additional income. Gogita awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor and use it to cultivate his agricultural land

loans.name: Agadadas

texts.en:
Agadadas is 34 years old and married. He has two kids. Agadadas is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in Bilasuvar region. He has been working at this job for 12 years.

Agadadas has experience and he has developed his own business himself, day after day. He is a telephone seller and repairman. He needs a loan of 1200 AZN to buy new materials and expand his business, so he requires help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new materials and expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish as requested by her customers, such as snapper, yellow striped fish,  tuna, squid, crab, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, su meta es obtener el título de Auditora y Contadora Publica, dedicarse a su profesión que está estudiando, tener un estudio contable propio y salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Es una persona muy sacrificada y pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Pilar. She is studying for an accounting degree. Her goal is to get a Public Accountant and Auditor degree; to earn a living at the profession she is studying; to have her own accounting studio; and to get ahead and help her family.

She is a very self-sacrificing person and she is requesting this loan to be able to pay her degree expenses, and in that way be able to cover that expense that she has.

She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay degree expenses.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 32-year-old carpenter from Voi, Kenya. He is the father of four, whose spouse provides additional income and has been in business for the last three years doing well.

This is his fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase timber for his workshop and use the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own a successful business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin is 44 years old and married. He has one child. Shahin is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He lives in Bilesuvar region with his family. He has been working this job for 15 years. Shahin has experience, and he is also a hardworking and steady person. Shahin is a tea seller. He needs a 1,200 AZN loan to renovate the teahouse (to buy new furniture and shelves, etc.), so he requires help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate the teahouse (to buy new furniture and shelves, etc).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more stock of rice bran

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 55 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is farming and she has been in this business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenya shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.  She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 67 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 30 years and earns a monthly income of forty five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her youngest child as well as reinvest in the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 48-year-old mother of six living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She runs a dairy farm to earn an income. She started her farm 25 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and pay for household expenses. On her small dairy farm, she has buffaloes and cows that produce milk which she sells in her town. Over the years, her husband has been breeding her buffalo and expanding his herd.

Khursheed wants to buy more buffalo for her dairy farm to earn a better living for her family, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to do so. She has become an expert in dairy farming. As a result, Khursheed has requested a loan so she will be able to buy buffalo. Khursheed is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy buffalo for herself.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 45-year-old married father of six children. He is a Palestinian refugee, who has run a vegetable selling shop since 2004.

Nidal lives and works in a refugee camp. He puts so much effort into improving his family's living. His business income is going fine, but not good enough to cover the increasing living expenses.

To improve his family's living, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a business for additional income. He will will start selling birds and is planning to open a pet shop in the future.

Nidal hopes to expand his business to open a shop outside the camp.

loans.use: to start a business for additional income. He will start selling birds and is planning to open a pet shop in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish like: grouper, tuna, sardines, yellow mottled fish, etc.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel, 25 years old, is a married man with a 1-year-old son who lives in a municipality of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines. Earlier this year, he started his own business as he began his married life. He owns a farm where he grows rice and corn (maize). When he was young, he was taught by his father to run this type of business.

It is very important to Ramel that this business can sustain because it is the financial support for his family. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of his plants. Ramel wants to improve his business so he can provide a good education for his son and for his future children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with of three children.

Her business is growing and selling vegetables. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings.
