She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and buy more farm inputs. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 45, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Ben, also 45, a security guard. They have two children who are currently in high school. Melinda and her husband work diligently towards one direction – to have a happy family living with sufficient resources, viable business, and successful career for their children.

Melinda wants to take another step towards their dream by availing of additional capital worth PhP 10,000. She will buy more supplies for her variety store so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer a store with wide selections. She knows that she can earn higher income with an enhanced capital. Subsequently she can set aside more savings because her children will be entering college soon.
 
She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store

loans.name: Basilo

texts.en: A loan of $ 600 will help Basilo to send his son to post-secondary school.  He hopes that by continuing his son’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs including tuition, books, school supplies and school registration.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and registration and to buy books and school supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and married with two children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Elena has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is 37 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maricor has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maricor requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maricor has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maricor would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, two of whom are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing.

Corazon dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahimxalil

texts.en: Ibrahimxalil is a hardworking farmer in the Bilasuvar region. He cultivates his own parcel of land and continuously produces rice in bulk for local consumption. To augment his rice production business, he is asking for a loan from Kiva Lenders. With this loan, he will pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, and seed bed preparation and purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, and seed bed preparation and to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Villarrica, estudia y trabajo para poder salir adelante para mejorar su vida por medio de sus conocimientos. Estudia la carrera de administración de empresas.
Ella comenta que está esforzándose para poder ser una profesional destaca en su área. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Liz is from the city of Villarrica. She studies and works to be able to get ahead in order to improve her life through her knowledge. She is studying for a business administration degree.

She comments that she is making an effort in order to be able to be a stand out professional in her domain. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her degree fees.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old, married and has one child for which she provides. She lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She owns and operates an Knitted bamboo businesses, which she has been doing for over six years. She earns well from this activity. Gina is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional materials to use such as bamboo. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in Knitted bamboo

loans.name: Emelinia

texts.en:
Emelinia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other materials needed for fishing for her fishing business.

Emelinia has been in this business for 3 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling bread.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 51 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Pacencia has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Pacencia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

Pacencia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Pacencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is 57 years old and married with five children. Felixberta works very hard to provide for them.

Felixberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Felixberta has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Rasoola

texts.en:
Rasoola is a 41-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. One child is too young and is fully dependent upon its mother.

Her son owns a garment business. His practice is to buy fabric from a wholesaler, dye the fabric into multiple shades, sew the garments, and sell them in the market. He has a lot of customers who like to buy garments from him. Due to the new customers, the demand is increasing day by day, but he does not have sufficient funds to buy more fabric.

Therefore, Rasoola requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy more fabric to fulfill the demand.

Rasoola is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking loans from BRAC Pakistan and investing in the business.

Rasoola is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her son's garment business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old, married and had three children. Her spouse is a carpenter.

She is cooking and selling barbeque (roasted or grilled meat) for income.

She hopes to improve her sales and she is need of additional capital so she is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy more meat to cook and grocery items to sell. This loan will help improve her services as well.

loans.use: to buy more meat to cook and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 55 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margie has a general store business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 66 years old and has children who are in school.

Elena has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo, a fish net and other materials for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elena has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo, a fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita works hard to support her family. Adelita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Adelita has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Adelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She has a food production/vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. 

Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients (sugar, cream, milk, and juice) and other materials for her food production/vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (sugar, cream, milk, and juice) and other materials for her food production/vending business

loans.name: Anjum

texts.en:
Anjum is a 46-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son.

Her son is a shoe maker and an expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby shoes for many years. This is the reason her son has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews rexine (an artifical leather) shoes through machine, after that attaches its sole by hand stitching. This is how he earns income for his family. Recently, he gotten a huge contract but he does not have capital to buy raw material to complete the contract.

Therefore, Anjum requested a loan for her son so he can buy raw material such as rexene, thread, glue, soles etc.

Anjun is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as Rexene, thread, glue, soles etc. for her son's shoe making business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 26 years old. She is a married and blessed with one child.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of fifty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow. She will use the profits from expanded business to boost the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Symbua

texts.en:
Syombua is 52 years old. She is a married and blessed with of 2 children.

Her business is a Posho mill (Maize flour mill). She has been in the business for 7 years and earns a monthly income of seventeen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the posho mill and she will then use the balance to pay school fees for her children.

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the posho mill and then she will use the balance to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like cement, sand and gravel etc.

Dolores has been in this business for 7 years now..

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, sand and gravel etc

loans.name: Princess Mariz

texts.en:
Princess Mariz is 24 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Princess Mariz has a general store in the Philippines. Princess Mariz requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Princess Mariz has been in this business for four years. In the future, Princess Mariz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Jessica works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

Jessica is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish, fishing net, salt, bamboo and other materials for her dried fish making business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, fishing net, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are presently in school. Joan works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

Joan has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products

loans.name: Marian

texts.ru: Marian молодой парень в возрасте 39 лет, женат и открыл небольшой бизнес в сфере животноводство. Marian в настоящее время имеет шесть дойных коров и 5 телят для мяса . Молоко от коров, продается , таким образом, семья, имеет стабильный ежемесячный доход и телят вырашивает до 18 месяцев , а затем продает. Для обеспечения провизий животных он обробатывает 2 гектара земли. У Marian сейчас серьезная проблема:  в помешение для животных нет елекричество. Этим летом он построил сарай для скота, но не может заселить скот, потому что нет электричество. Чтобы решить проблему Marian необходимо подключиться к электросети. Этот новый сарай позволит увеличить количество коров, которые, в свою очередь принесет больше прибыли для развития бизнеса в будущем, и в результате создаст новые рабочие места.
texts.en:
Marian is a young guy of the age of 39 years. He is married and has started a small livestock breeding business. Marian currently has six dairy cows and five calves for meat production. He sells the milk from the cows. This way his family has a stable monthly income. He breeds the calves for 18 months and then sells them. To secure food for the livestock he cultivates two hectares of land.

Marian currently has a serious issue; he does not have electricity in the premises where he keeps the livestock. This spring he built a livestock barn, but he is not able to keep the livestock there as it does not have electricity. In order to solve his problems, Marian needs to connect to the power grid.

The new barn will allow him to increase the number of cows, which in turn will bring in a larger income for developing the business further. As a result new jobs will be created.

loans.use: to connect to the power grid

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.ru: Курбоназар очень трудолюбивый и простой человек. Ему 51 год, он женат и замечательный отец троих детей. Курбоназар с утра до вечера трудится, чтобы его дети не нуждались ни в чем и жили хорошо. Он занимается сельским хозяйством на протяжении многих лет. В основном он занимается хлопководством. Этим он обеспечивает свою семью. Курбоназар обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить семена хлопка и минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Его основная проблема то, что у нег нет достаточно средств. Курбоназар очень ждет Вашей поддержки, так как без Вашей помощи он не сможет получить урожай и остается без дохода.
texts.en:
Kurbonazar is a very hardworking and simple person. He is 51 years old, married and a wonderful father to three children. Kurbonazar works from morning to late night, in order for his children not to be in need of anything but to live well. He has worked with agriculture for many years. He mainly works with cotton prodution. This way he provides for his family.

Kurbonazar applied for a loan in order to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers for cultivating the land. His main problem is that he does not have sufficient funding. Kurbonazar very much awaits your help, as without it, he will not be able to get a good harvest and will be left without an income.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers for processing the land

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children.

Her husband provides services of banner writing. He belongs to a poor family and is the single person responsible for his children and old parents.

His children become sick most of the time, and he has to spend most of his income upon their cure. He wants to grow his business so that he can easily generate more income than earlier, so that he can cherish his children and bear their medical expenses.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a Kiva loan so that her husband can buy paint, brushes and pieces of cloth so that he can write more banners. In this way, he can easily generate additional income for his family.

Parveen deserves Kiva support; she hopes that Kiva lenders will support her. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paint, paint brushes and white cloth for her husband's banner writing services.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз житель района Сарбанд. Ему 37 лет, он женат и отец 4 детей. С самого раннего детства Азиз ухаживал за животными и отправлял на пастбище. Сейчас у него есть свой бизнес. Он покупает маленьких телят, откармливая их, продает на местном рынке.  В этом деле ему помогает его семья. Теперь Азиз намерен расширить свой бизнес и купить несколько голов мелко рогатого скота.  Но для этого ему нужна финансовая поддержка. Азиз обращается к Вам и просит Вас поддержать его в этом деле и дать ему возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Aziz is a resident of the Sarband region. He is 37 years old and the father of four children. From early childhood, Aziz looked after livestock and was sent to the pasture. Currently he has his own business. He purchases calves, breeds them and resells them at the local market. His family helps him with the business.

Currently Aziz intends to expand his business and purchase some sheep and goats. However, he needs financial help to do this. Aziz appeals to you and requests you to support him in this matter, and give him the opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru: Это женщина Хуринисо. Она замужем имать троих детей. У нее одна дочка и двое сыновья. Хуринисо на районе Дангара живет вместе семьей. Она очень спокойная и талантливая женщина. Ей 43 года. У нее средняя образования. Хуринисо хотела заниматься шитьем. Сейчас Хуринисо в ателье предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она шьет женскую одежду на заказ. Хуринисо собирается поменять швейную машинку, потому что ее старая машинка устарела. Новая швейная машинка стоит дорого, но у нее не хватает денежных средств, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На оставшуюся часть кредита она купить швейные принадлежности. Хуринисо заранее выражает свою благодарность на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This woman is Khuriniso. She is married and has three children. She has one daughter and two sons. Khuriniso lives with her family in the Dangara region. She is a calm and talented woman. She is 43 years old and has secondary education.

Khuriniso wanted to work with sewing and currently she provides a sewing service from her studio. She sews women's clothing on order. Khuriniso decided to change her old sewing machine as it is outdated. A new sewing machine is expensive, and she does not have enough money for it. For this reason she applied for a loan. For the remaining part of the loan she will purchase sewing accessories.

Khuriniso extends her gratitude for your support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing accessories

loans.name: Pakize

texts.en:
Pakize is 47 years old and the mother of 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. Two of them attend elementary school but they are very eager to help Pakize with her work. She got married 15 years ago and her partner works in the agricultural sector. Pakize doesn't have a higher education, and because of this fact, she has been working since she was very young. She works farming vegetables such as cucumber, squash, and pumpkin. She learned to farm these types of crops through a program that was held in her community a few years ago. She also farms corn and beans with her husband and children to support the family. She previously had a small store which she managed, but she had to stop sales because she was sick for some time and had to pay unexpected expenses.

Pakize needs the loan to buy fertilizers such as foliate manure and other products for her crops. She will also reopen her store because there are no nearby stores in the area; the majority of people have to walk for more than 30 minutes to go shopping in the town center. Pakize dreams of growing her shop little by little. She also hopes her children can continue their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as foliate manure and other products for her crops.

loans.name: Salmina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilanculos província de Inhambane, tem 45 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
 Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura para o transporte dos seus produtos.
texts.en:
She was born in Vilanculos, Inhambane province. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three adult children, She is responsible for her niece, who lives in her house.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and she is planning to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and metal sheets to continue building her house.

In the future, she is planning to buy a vehicle to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheets, and other materials to continue building her house.

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru: 57 летняя дехканка из района Чиликул. Она уроженка района. Зулайхо замужем и мать 32 и 23 летных детей. Ее муж тоже дехканин, он занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Зулайхо родилась и выросла в семье дехканов. Она хорошо знается сельскохозяйственную деятельность. Зулайхо идет по стопам родителей. Она на земле выращивает овощи. Зулайхо все свое время проводит на земле. Зулайхо  собирается,  посадит морковь, и для обработки земельный участок ей нужно минеральные удобрение. И решила взять кредит и за счет кредита приобрести семена морковь и минеральные удобрение.
texts.en:
This 57 years old farmer is from the Jilikul region. She is a native of this region. Zulayho is married and the mother of two children of 32 and 29 years. Her husband is also a farmer. He works with field crop cultivation.

Zulayho was born and grew up in a family of farmers. She knows this business well. Zulayho is walking in her parents' footsteps. She grows vegetables and spends all her time on her land.

Zulayho decided to sow carrots, and to process the land she needs mineral fertilizers. She decided to take a loan and through it purhcase carrot seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase carrot seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cake ingredients and clothing to be sold

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо настоящая бизнес леди. Ей 40 лет она замужем и имеет 3 милых детей. Ее муж занимается ремонтом домов. Мехринисо 2 года как занимается продажей бытовой химии на базаре. Несмотря на то, что в этом деле она недавно, у нее уже есть постоянные клиенты. Она очень вежливо встречает их и помогает им выбрать все необходимое. Однако сейчас товара в ее магазине стало мало и она обращается к Вам за кредитом, чтобы закупить новую партию товаров и расширить свой ассортимент.  Она очень надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Mehriniso is a modern business lady. She is 40 years old, married and has three dear children. Her husband works with renovating houses. Mehriniso has worked with selling cleaning products at the market for two years. Despite having been in this area only for a short time, she has returning customers. She greets them happily and helps them select everything necessary.

Currently Mehriniso has less goods in her store and she is appealing to you for a loan, in order to purchase a new batch of goods and expand her assortment. She needs you very much.

loans.use: to purchase a new batch of goods and expand her assortment.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 26-year-married mother of two children, who has been running her shop selling gifts and toys since 2010. She is a hard working lady, well known in her region for her special customer services.

Ayat is working hard to develop her business. That's why she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase new gift items and souvenirs in addition to requested stationery.

She hopes to expand her business in a well-managed way, so that she can start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new gift items and souvenirs in addition to requested stationery

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is 32 years old and married with three children. She runs an architectural engineering office in Boureen in the city of Nablus. Nahed has been in this business for 8 years, and she has no employees working for her. Her other source of income comes from a commercial taxi that her husband drives. Nahed says that the main challenge of her business is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand the office.

She requested the loan from ACAD to buy new engineering equipment to improve her office. Nahed says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family's standard of living. In the future Nahed would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new engineering equipment for her office

loans.name: Sadamo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 24 anos de idade, solteiro, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku,  com o qual pretende adquirir bens para sua casa como: televisor, congelador e estante para mobiliar a sua casa.
Futuramente pretende erguer uma obra de residência, adquirir uma viatura familiar e contrair matrimónio.
texts.en:
He was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. He is 24 years old and single. He is not responsible for anyone else.

This is his first loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to buy some household goods, such as a TV set, a freezer, and a shelf to furnish her house.

In the future, he is planning to build a house, purchase a vehicle, and get married.

loans.use: to buy a TV set, a freezer, and a shelf to furnish his house.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
Accra is the capital of Ghana, and Teshie is in the northern part of Accra, which has trade and fishery as its main economic activities. The group is made up five members and are into the sale of fried fish, waakye (cooked rice and beans), slippers, charcoal, gari (cassava flour) and pork.

Omega, the only male in the group, sells pork. He is 31 years old and resides with his wife and two children. Omega has been selling pork for 2 years now with the support of his wife. He is doing a very good business by fulfilling the demands of his customers on time. The monthly family income of Omega is not good enough, so therefore he is in need of financial support at an affordable interest rate. With this loan amount, Omega will purchase very attractive live pigs which he will kill, dress and sell to customers. He hopes this will definitely help him to expand the business and to earn more profit. Omega’s dream is to provide better education to his children for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase very attractive live pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service her motorcycle

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña katupyry  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas ellas  se encuentran trabajando y luchando, esforzándose por salir  de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Floriana, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza para que su familia tenga una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, leche, huevo, panificados, carne, y otros, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda y podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que todas tienen de poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
This group, called Katupyry, took the Poverty Elimination Survey. All its members fight and work hard to leave poverty.

One of the members is Floriana, who is a hardworking and enterprising person. She works hard so that her family can live a dignified life and have everything they need.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, milk, eggs, bakery products, meat, and other products. This will help her a lot, and she will be able to fulfill her customers' needs.

She is grateful for the opportunity they are getting to continue helping their beloved ones, so that they have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, eggs, bakery products, meat, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 30-year-old retail shop and food kiosk owner in Voi, Kenya. He is a father of three and has been in this business for the last three years doing well.

This is first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves, bread and wheat flour and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own a prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves, bread and wheat flour

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is thankful to Kiva and CCT for their continuous support of his livelihood. Being a single parent has challenged him to work harder for his only child. Driving his tricycle under the heat of the sun six days a week is not an easy job, but Redentor feels fulfilled in that he is thereby able to provide for his child.

He is again humbly requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to pay for tires, tune-up, oil change and accessories for his tricycle. It is important that his vehicle is always in a good running condition to ensure safe and efficient service, and thus stable income to support himself and his child. He trusts in your positive response.

Redentor plans to buy another unit to improve his income so he can save for his child's education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the registration and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 40-year-old married woman from Tkibuli district. She has a husband, a pensioner mother and a school aged daughter and son.

The family's only income is from a lease, which is 150 GEL per month. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they don't have enough money to cover even basic needs, and they live in poverty. Because of this situation, Lela lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan to purchase a truck. Her husband will start working on private orders and will transport cargoes.


The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Lela and her family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders, and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to buy a truck to make significant income for the family's welfare.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher runs his shoe store in Gavar Town. Mher is father of three children and lives together with his mother, wife and children.

Mher works hard to provide high quality service and shoes to his clients so they come back to his store again. He has applied for this loan to purchase a winter season shoe collection to meet customers' demand.

Mher has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important, for Mher to have big variety of products offered to his customers and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a winter season shoe collection to meet customers' demand

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Progresistas está en su ciclo número 12º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Cristina es una de las personas que se destaca por su trabajo y entusiasmo, poco a poco ha ido mejorando y da a sus seres queridos una vida digna, tiene como anhelo poder mejorar su taller de costura, ya que ella se dedica a las confecciones, y con esta actividad ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos,  gomas, cierres y otros productos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y ayudar a su vez a su familia.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Mujeres Progresistas [Progressive Women]. This is their 12th cycle in the Women Committee Program; they all work and fight to get ahead. They set the goal of growing, not only economically, but also personally.

Cristina is a person that stands out because she works hard and with enthusiasm. Little by little, she has managed to improve and give her loved ones a dignified life. Her wish is to improve her dressmaking shop, since she is a seamstress. She helps her family thanks to this activity.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastic bands, zippers, and other products, in order to continue working as she has been doing it so far, and helping her family at the same time.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastic bands, zippers, and other products.

loans.name: Blanket Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is thirty-nine years old Sia, married with two children. Her children are all going to school.

Sia belongs to a solidarity group of 4 women, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Blanket” is the name of Sia’s solidarity group. “Blanket” group needs a total loan of 5,750,000SLL. Sia will receive 1,437,000SLL which she needs in order to purchase an additional 5 cartons of raw fish and 7 cartons of chickens for her business. In the group picture, Sia is on the left.

Sia established her fish and chicken business in 2011. She established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs especially her children. Sia uses the profits from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Sia is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 8 am to 6 pm.

In the future, Sia plans to support her children to acquire University education. She hopes to do more than what she is doing presently. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 5 cartons of raw fish and 7 cartons of chickens.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of 28,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children as well as reinvest in the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and see her children clear education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Broke Stone Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a member of Broke Stone. She is married with six children ages 20, 18, 14, nine, eight and three years old. Five of them are school children. (In the group picture, Kadiatu is on the right).

Fifteen years ago, Kadiatu established her soft drinks business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she earns from the business. She sells six days per week from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Kadiatu plans to use the loan to buy 20 crates of different kinds of drinks for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used for paying her children's school fees. Kadiatu and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL, of which Kadiatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.

Kadiatu plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life. Kadiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 20 crates of different kinds of drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives with her son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Rita's son works with the police and her grandchildren attend the local village school.

To help her son support the family's living, Rita has been involved in a farming business. Rita has a greenhouse and 6 piglets on her farm at the moment. She is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel for land cultivation. This will help Rita to get prepared for the winter season, and she hopes for lenders' support.

As this is Rita's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Jovenes Luchadores Group

texts.es:
El Comité está conformado en total por 10 jóvenes con grandes perspectivas y propósitos que hace tiempo se encuentran trabajando en el programa de comité de jóvenes emprendedores. Son hijos y familiares de clientas de comités que están inculcados con ejemplos para poder trabajar y obtener sus ganancias
Una de las que integra este grupo es Cecilia, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería, ella por medio de sus ventas se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, y ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa manera poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is made of of a total of ten youth with great prospects and intentions. They have been working in the Young Enterpreneur Committees Program for some time. They are the children and family members of clients of the Committees which are instilled as examples of how to work and make a profit.

One member of the group is Cecilia who works selling lingerie. Through her sales she earns her living in a dignified and honest way and she helps her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of lingerie so she can continue with her sales and doing this continue to help her family.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for sale.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a 71-year-old farmer living in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a mother of four adults. For the past twenty-five years, she has been doing well in agribusiness.

This is her fourth time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after successfully repaying her previous loans. She will use the money to purchase fertilizer and seeds and use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to employ more youth on her farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in their daily sustenance. Despite her age, at sixty four she is thankful that she is still strong enough to attend to her store and piggery business.

She is once again humbly asking for a Php 50000 PHP loan to buy and refill her store with more quantities of canned goods, coffee, soda, instant noodles, eggs, cooking oil, beverages, toiletries, etc. to attract more customers. Part of the loan she will use to buy feed to raise healthy hogs. Teodora hopes you will again consider her request.

Teodora's simple dream is for her store to grow and have a bigger piggery farm so she could help send her grandchildren to school. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business, as well as feed for her hog raising.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is a young and experienced farmer, living with his mother in Arpeni village, Shirak region. He has been involved in farming since a young age.

Like most farmers in the region, Sasun is involved in livestock breeding. He keeps 11 calves, 5 cows, 35 sheep, and 15 hens. With the help of his mother, Sasun also cultivates wheat and grass as forage to feed the livestock.

Sasun asks for this loan in order to be able to enlarge the number of livestock by 30 sheep. Shirak is a poor region with a high unemployment rate and low living standards.

Lack of access to loans, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people when developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Sasun's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for thirty sheep to enlarge his livestock and gather more income for his family.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a young and energetic woman of 47 years from Kandi. She works as a domestic cook in her locality. She is married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter got married and her son works in a local garment shop. She lives in a small village of Kandi, Murshidabad, West Bengal.

Asha's husband plays different kinds of musical instruments like drums, flutes, and orchestras at different social occasions such as weddings, birthdays, and other occasions. He has been in this business for the last ten years. This season is a popular time which generates much business for him and he is well paid to run his family.

Now he would like to purchase more musical instruments as some of them are not working properly. So Asha is asking for the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase some musical instruments.

She hopes this will help to grow her husband’s business and generate more income to run her family smoothly. She has a dream to renovate their house to a concrete one with the generated profit from the business.

She is very happy and thanks Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more music systems for her husband's existing business.

loans.name: Shendrack

texts.en:
Shendrack is a 32-year-old retail shop supplier in Voi, Kenya. He is a father of two. His wife provides additional income. Shendrack has been in this job for the last four years and he is doing very well.

This is his second time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase stocks of milk, sugar, tea leaves, bread, and wheat flour for supplying to retail stores.

Shendrack will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He hopes to own a large wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves, bread, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Uttara

texts.en:
25-year-old Uttara is a young, energetic lady who lives in the small village of Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is blessed with two children (one daughter and one son).

Her husband is engaged in the milk selling business. Uttara has helped her husband by running her cow husbandry for the last 10 years. She rears cows and her husband sells the milk to their locality. Uttara also sells the cow dung in her neighborhood for additional income, which is used as manure in rural areas.

Nowadays the demand for milk is very high, so they are thinking of expanding their business, but they lack capital to invest in their business. Thus Uttara applied for a loan from Kiva via BJS. With the help of this loan she will purchase one more cow and can sell more milk and cow dung.

Uttara is now optimistic that she can earn a good profit from her business. They thank Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to expand her dairy business.

loans.name: Brook Lane Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Adama is a member of Brook Lane. She is married with seven children ages 31, 30, 27, 24, 20, 16 and 10 years old. Three of them are in school, two are employees and the others are in university. (In the group picture, Adama is in the middle)

Twenty-four years ago, Adama established her cooked food business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she earns from the business. She sells six days per week from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Adama plans to use the loan to buy two bags of rice, 10 gallons of palm oil and 10 gallons of groundnut oil, etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used for paying her children's school fees.

Adama and her group members need a loan totaling 5,750,000 SLL, of which Adama is entitled to 1,150,000 SLL. Adama plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life. Adama and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 10 gallons of palm oil, 10 gallons of groundnut oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 20 cartons of chicken for resale.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz, who is a 42-year-old married man, lives in a small village called Kvaliti. He has pensioner parents, a school-aged son and a wife, who lives abroad and works as a nurse.

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Ramaz was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on family owned agricultural land, growing grapes and nuts. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for good prices.

Now, he needs financial support to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables, and to have money for working capital to continue running his agribusiness. Ramaz has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with favorable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Ramaz will start selling fruits and vegetables in an open market in the district, and will earn significant income, which will help him to meet all daily costs more effectively. The loan will greatly assist Ramaz, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start selling fruits and vegetables throughout the district.

loans.name: Florentina Esmilce

texts.es:
Florentina es una persona muy sacrificada, que siempre trabaja en las confecciones, por medio de su trabajo da a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho. Con su anterior préstamo pudo comprar telas, para poder seguir su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo nuevo para poder refaccionar su vivienda, el cual es su taller de confecciones y poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Florentina is a very selfless woman, who has always worked as a dressmaker. 

Through her work, she gives her family a decent living and everything they need. She wants to start improving their living conditions. This is why she works very hard. 

She used her previous loan to buy fabric to be able to continue with her work.

She is requesting this new loan to refurbish her house, which also serves as her sewing workshop, so that she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to refurbish her house, which also serves as her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Diala

texts.en: Diala is a 33 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and three children, all of them are still attending school. She is a housewife where she is dedicated from her home and family. Her husband owns a pharmacy in his town and he is the main income provider but his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees.  She said that this loan will surely helped her to insure the school year for them what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 41 years old and married with three children, two children are still in school, Cherryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care.

Cherryl has been in this business for 11 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future Cherryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 61 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Nida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Push Me Up Group

texts.en:
Hawa is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of "Push Me Up" solidarity group. "Push Me Up" solidarity group has four members. (See group picture. Hawa is on the far left).

Sixteen years ago, Hawa established her household utensils business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children. She operates her business six days a week, from 10am to 6pm.

“Push Me Up” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Hawa is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy cigarettes by gross for her business.

Hawa hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Hawa is married with two children, ages thirteen and four. All are school-going children.

In the future, Hawa plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Hawa and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes by gross for her business.

loans.name: Salorn's Group

texts.en: Salorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Salorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Pultney Sellers Group

texts.en:
Issa is a 41-year-old business man. He is a member of Pultney Sellers solidarity group. Pultney Sellers solidarity group has six members who are all men.

Issa has been in this clothing business for the past 21 years. He opens his business six days a week, from 8am to 6pm. Issa established his business to help support his children in school. He pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food from the profit he gets from his business.

Issa and his group members need a loan totaling 12,000,000 SLL, of which Issa is entitled to 3,000,000 SLL. He will use the loan to buy 20 packets of jeans, 20 packets of t-shirts, etc. for his business.

He hopes that this loan will help him generate more profit to support his family. Issa is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. In the feature, Issa plans to save more money to provide for his children’s university education. He believes educating his children to university level will better the lives of his family.

Issa and the rest of the group members thank you for your support. In the photo, Issa is in the middle from the left.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of jeans, 20 packets of t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal, a 48 years old man, lives in village Mukhiani, Tskaltubo district, with his brother, who get social assistance from the local government, being regarded as a very poor family. They both were unable to get high education and started a small agribusiness.

Jemal cultivates a plot of family-owned agricultural land and generates approximately 160 GEL per month. He has great desire somehow to increase the productivity and monthly income and expand his agribusiness. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

Jemal requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Jemal will purchase a bull and get some income from this new activity.
Jemal and his brother will be very grateful for the financial support and kindness, as their living condition will improve and they will tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and expand his agribusiness.

loans.name: Oceannic Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is forty-five-year-old Mariatu. She is married, and has five children ages of 28, 27, 22, 20 and 17 years old. Four of them are working, and the other is still in school. Mariatu belongs to a solidarity group of five women who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams.

“Oceanic” is the name of Mariatu’s solidarity group. “Oceanic” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Mariatu will receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase four bales of bags, 10 cartons of pens and 10 pairs of shoes for her business. (In the group picture, Mariatu is in the middle.)

Mariatu established her bags, pens, shoes and clothing business in 1995. She established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Mariatu uses the profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family, and to support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Mariatu is a hardworking women.

In the future, Mariatu plans to support her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day, she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting the group.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of bags, 10 cartons pens and 10 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a sari-sari store owner. She is 36 years old woman who lived in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines together with her family. Hannah is a mother of two children ages 17 and 15 years old. She is proficiently running her business for 13 years. The profit that she earns has a great helps in paying their daily expenses such as food, some in their household expenses such as bills and some for personal care products.

With this, she is asking a bigger amount for to buy commodities such as chips, candies, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drink and juice. She also buys soft drinks and drinking liquor. In the future, Hannah wishes to be a successful business woman. And she can achieved it by our help, with the help of the money she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drink and juice; soft drinks and drinking liquor

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with of five children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 11 years. She earns a monthly income of seventeen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year old Marites grows vegetables. For almost 5 years now, Marites sold vegetables like batong (beans) and okra. She lives in the town of Barili, Cebu.
She  is married woman with two children ages 11 and 13.
Her husband  is a farmer. 

A loan of 7,000 PHP will help Marites improve the yield of farm. She could buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and fertilizers . It enables her to produce high quality vegetables that could improve her income. She could continue provide her family with healthy diets and better shelter to live. And she is also hoping to continue finance the schooling of her children for brighter future.

Marites is determined that she could make it productive by investing other possible business ventures to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. Her business is farming. 

She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a healthy educated family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is 28 year old welder at Kilifi Kenya.

He is a father of two, whose spouse provides an additional income and has been in this business for the last five years, doing well.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after successfully repaying the first loan.

He will use the money to purchase metal sheets for his workshop and the anticipated profit to educate his children.

He hopes to own a large workshop in future.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets for his workshop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 52 years old, married with three children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer farmer and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 47-year-old woman, hailing from Chuakhola village in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is an active and independent woman with an objective to develop the financial status of her family. She is a mother of two children. Her daughter is married and her son is completing his bachelor's education. Her husband is engaged in a small business of renting cars on different occasions.

Mamata is a hardworking woman who has taken a great role in developing the financial conditions of her family as her husband's income is very scanty. She has been engaged in a clothing business from her house for the last two years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business.

She sells mainly sarees and other garments according to the demands of her clients who are mostly her neighbors. Her husband helps her to purchase stocks from the wholesale market. Her opinion is that, from the small income of her business, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible.

She plans to purchase sarees in various qualities & colours and other garments at the wholesale rate. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for future.

She is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase different types of sarees and other garments for her existing business.

loans.name: Sarwat

texts.en:
Sarwat is 32, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, Sarwat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk in bulk for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida has successfully built her business manufacturing shoes with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing.

Now she requested for a 50000 PKR to buy additional material for making shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc

loans.name: Kuña Katypyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas esperanzas, quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo unido y solidario, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esmerándose por crecer.
La Sra. Jacinta, una de las integrantes solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos como verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, para que con ellos pueda seguir con su negocio de venta de comidas.
Comenta que ella misma todos los días se levanta muy temprano a poder preparar sus comidas, y que de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group is in its first cycle of the committee of women program. It is a new group that has many hopes. They want to improve their living conditions through their work, in unity and solidarity. They are part of the elimination of poverty program, fighting and striving to grow.

Jacinta, one of the members, seeks the loan to buy items such greens, meat, condiments, vegetables and others, so that she can continue, with her business selling food.

She states that every day she gets up very early in order to prepare the food. In this way she makes a living in a dignified and honest manner.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, condiments, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Kakali

texts.en:
Kakali is 33 years old, a rural housewife who is busy with her daily household chores. She lives in a village of Kandi, Murshidabad district with her husband and two sons. Her sons study in different grades in the nearby village school.

Kakali’s husband runs a stationery shop in their locality. He sells all the daily need items like soap, oil, powder, shampoo, etc. In her free time, Kakali also help her husband in this business. They are running this business from past 10 years. This is the only source of income of the family.

With the price hike of essential commodities, they are facing a problem in managing their household expenses as well as the educational costs' of their two sons.

Now they need to expand their business. They want to add varieties of items in their stock so that they will be able to satisfy more customers’ needs, but they lack funds to invest. So as a responsible lady, Kakali seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

They will utilize the loan to purchase varieties of stationery items at a wholesale rate. This loan will help them to expand their business. They convey their thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery items for her husband’s stationery shop.

loans.name: Tapati

texts.en:
Tapati is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Kandi, Murshidabad district, West Bengal. She is married and a mother of one daughter who is studying in grade 9.

Tapati‘s husband Tapan is engaged in utensils business. Tapati runs her own clothing business from her home. She purchases mainly saris and others clothing like shirts and pants (per customers' demands) from the wholesale market and sell them in her locality for a profitable price.

She has acquired many years of experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize his experience to generate more profits, but she needs to take a loan to expand her business. Due to the upcoming festive season, the demand for clothing will increase as well. Thus to satisfy customers’ demand she needs some capital to upgrade her inventory.

So Tapati is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She wants to purchase more stock of varieties of clothing for her existing business. With this small help, she will be able to improve the business for a secure life for them.

Tapati is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing for her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 56 years old. He is married and has 6 children. His business is motorcycle taxi and farming. He has been in this business for 14 years.

Justus earns a monthly income of thirty five thousand Kenyan shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Justus will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet family budget. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a better business and a better family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Annapurna

texts.en:
Annapurna is 45 years old. She is a housewife and a mother of one daughter who is married. She lives with her husband Dilip in a small village of Kandi in Murshidabad district.

Annapurna's husband deals in the wood business. As he has grown old and feeble, it is a very tedious job for him. As a result, his income can barely cover his family's household.

Annapurna wants to supplement her husband's scanty income and so she is running a business of selling cow milk. She rears a dairy cow for three years and sells milk to her neighbors for additional income.

With the growing increase in the prices of daily necessities, she wants to increase her income, so she wants to purchase one dairy cow. She expects to get additional earnings by selling more milk to her neighbors. With this aim, Annapurna has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow.

She hopes the earnings from her business will provide good financial sustenance to her family and give them a smooth life.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for enhancing her milk supply business.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
30-year-old Saraswati is from a small village of Kandi, in Mushidabad district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two sons. One of them is studying and another one is working in a garage. Her husband Priyanath is engaged in sewing work.

Saraswati helps to run the family by running her own animal husbandry. She purchases goat kids and after rearing and fattening she sells them to the market. She wants her family to be financially stable and independent. So she has decided to grow her animal selling business. She plans to purchase more goat kids. Adding more quantity to her inventory will help her cater to the demand of her customers.

To make her plan a reality, Saraswati seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS, which she will utilize to buy baby goats. The loan will help this hardworking and enterprising woman take the next crucial step towards developing her livelihood and guaranteeing a better future.

Saraswati is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives with her family in the village of Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is blessed with four children (a son and three daughters). Two daughters are married and the others are still students. She and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, bamboo and wood).

Champa's husband has been involved in a musical instruments renting business. He offers drums, flutes, orchestras, sound boxes, microphones, speakers, etc., for rent for special occasions such as marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, and different functions. He has been involved in this business for the last few years, and this business is the only means of income for the family. He wants to go ahead with his business.

Now he wants to grow his business in order to satisfy his customers, and thus earn more income for the family. To do so he needs capital, which he doesn't have. For this reason, Champa has come forward and asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more decorative musical items to grow the business.

She hopes to keep on expanding their business, which will improve their present financial situation. She will be able to educate her children properly so that they can be established in life.

Champa is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding.

loans.use: To purchase more musical instruments for their existing business.

loans.name: Khalaf

texts.en: Khalaf is 37, married to a housewife and has a son and a daughter. He has a small grocery store business and it is the only source of income to the family. He previously requested 4000 EGP loan and is requesting 7000 EGP to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is farming. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 14,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve his crop production. 

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and to meet the family budget. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a better business and educate his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve his crop production.

loans.name: Nekiswa

texts.en:
Nekiswa is 25 years old. She is married and has 2 children.

Nekiswa has had a livestock business for 6 years. She will be using this loan to purchase additional dairy cattle and cattle feeds. With the anticipated profits she will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in life.

loans.use: buy cattle & feed

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix thanks Kiva and CCT for their tireless financial and moral support of his livelihood. He has received a number of loans which certainly helped him obtain a productive harvest of pineapples on his farm, thus providing income to feed his children and send them to school. Once again he is seeking your assistance in the amount of PHP 35,000 to pay for fertilizers for a productive harvest.

Aside from his farm, he also sells processed food. He will use part of the loan to pay for processed food like "tocino" (cured pork meat), longanisa (Filipino-style sausages made with ground meat cured with garlic and spices), hot dogs and bologna to sell at retail price. These are very popular for breakfast, which led Felix to sell these commonly eaten and easily prepared dishes.

He trusts that you will again consider his request. He still has one child who wants to study at college to prepare him for a better future. Felix also aims to acquire a delivery car to deliver plants and processed food to his customers.

He prays for God to continually prosper his business to save for their retirement. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.
