loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies for his farm and to buy processed foods to sell.

loans.name: German Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es:
German, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla y pagara la preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz en esta nueva temporada, tiene la esperanza que el clima sea favorable y así tener una cosecha abundante.
El resultado de haber invertido el crédito anterior en su negocio es positivo, con las cosechas pudo abastecer su hogar y generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
German is seeking a new loan to buy manure, fertilizers and seed, and to pay for the preparation of land to plant corn in the new season. He hopes that the climate will be favorable in order to have an abundant crop

The result of having invested the previous loan in his business was favorable. From what he harvested, he was able to provide for his home and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and seed, and to pay for the preparation of the land to plant corn in the new season.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is a 50-year-old hardworking woman who lives in Shyambazar village of Kandi of West Bengal. Unfortunately she lost her husband a few years back. She is a mother of two daughters. Her daughters are married.

Bharati has run a puffed rice business for the last 10 years. Puffed rice is a very popular snack in most of the rural areas. It is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. She purchases the rice, makes the puffed rice, and sells it in the locality and the local market.

As she is the only earning member of the family, she is facing lots of problems while running the business. But her strong determination provides the courage in her to continue the business and become an entrepreneur. Now Bharati wants to expand her business to generate more profit. Thus she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner).

Bharati will purchase more rice for her business with the help of this loan. She expects a good income from her business. She conveys her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is 31, married to a farmer and has one child. She started a small poultry project to help her husband with the family income. She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more birds such as chickens, ducks and geese to expand her project and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks and geese.

loans.name: Rosy Beatriz

texts.es:
Rosy, de 24 años de edad, está estudiando en la universidad, pero también trabaja, está casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes en su vehículo.

Rosy, trabaja como agente policial desde hace más de 6 años al servicio de la comunidad, pero también en sus días de descanso vende lociones, joyas de fantasía y acero, este negocio lo inicio hace 1 año y lo realiza en su comunidad.

El préstamo que está solicitando Rosy, es para comprar mercadería para su negocio como joyas, lociones, entre otros, porque quiere invertir más, porque considera que la demanda es mayor cada día. 

A futuro Rosy, quiere que sus hijos logren culminar sus estudios universitarios y se conviertan en personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rosy is 24 years old. She is studying at the university, but she also works. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works making trips in his vehicle. Rosy has worked as a police agent in the community for more than 6 years, but on her days off, she also sells lotions, costume jewelry and steel jewelry. She began this business one year ago, and sells in her community.

The loan Rosy is seeking is to buy merchandise for her business, such as jewelry and lotions, among other things, because she wants to invest more, as demand is higher every day. In the future Rosy wants her children to finish college and become people of good standing in society.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as jewelry and lotions, among other things.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia , a forty-three-year old woman with two ages 4-10 years old from Dumanjug, Cebu. Her partner earns a living by working in a private company as a driver.
She operates a sari-sari(variety) store, catering neighbors and local settlers in community.

She would like to improve the content of her store, by purchasing variety of stocks. She joined CEVI, to avail the loan to purchase grocery items like hard drinks,beverages , condiments and also to purchase a refrigerator. She could now cater for cold drinks and frozen goods to her customers. Thus, she could now able to continue send her children to school.

She is looking forward for a better opportunities as she continue managing her sari-sari (variety) store for sustainable living.

loans.use: to restock grocery items like hard drinks,condiments and to purchase a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and expand to frozen foods

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old. He is married and has 2 children.

Francis' business is farming. He has been in this business for 13 years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen-thousand Kenyan shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

Francis will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a higher income earning business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shandrack

texts.en:
Shandrack is 61 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His business is farming.

Shandrack has been in the farming business for 13 years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen-thousand Kenyan shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

Shandrack will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a higher income earning business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sylivester

texts.en:
Sylivester is a 59 year old cattle farmer at Kilifi Kenya. 

He is a father of four who has been in livestock business for the last 16 years doing great.

This is his eighth loan with VisionFund Kenya,  which he will use to purchase food as well as medicine for his cattle 

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to pay school fees for his son at the university. 

He hopes to have well educated children in future.

loans.use: to purchase food as well as medicine for his cattle

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 47 years old. He is married and has 4 children. His business is farming. He has been in this business for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is Festus' first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for better crop production. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a higher income generating business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, unions, gallons of oil, packets of Maggi etc.

loans.name: Best System Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a thirty-seven-year-old business woman. She is a member of Best System solidarity group. Best System solidarity group has four members (see group picture, Kadiatu stands in front with the white T-shirt).

Ten years ago Kadiatu established her local foodstuff business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 10am to 6pm.

“Best System” group needs a total loan of 4,600,000 SLL. Kadiatu is entitled to 1,150,000 SLL which she will use to buy 15 gallons of palm oil, 2 bags of rice, 15 gallons of groundnut oil for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

Kadiatu is married and has two girls age eleven, both are school-going children. In the future, Kadiatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Kadiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nohemy Arely

texts.es:
Nohemy, es dueña de un comedor, lo fundo hace 10 años, atiende al público de diez de la mañana a ocho de la noche, su mayor ventaja es que disfruta mucho de la cocina; ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos de corta edad, su pareja tiene un empleo como motorista y sus parientes le ayudan económicamente en ocasiones.
El capital que está solicitando prestado lo invertirá en la compra de mesas para atender mejor a sus clientes, ofrecerá un lugar más cómodo y espera poder atraer nuevos clientes.
Sus sueños son tener un local propio y comprar una casa nueva.
texts.en:
Nohemy owns an eating establishment. She started it 10 years ago. She serves the public from ten in the morning to eight at night. Her greatest advantage is that she really enjoys cooking. She lives with her husband and their small children. Her husband works as a driver, and her parents help them economically on occasion.

The loan she is seeking she will invest in the purchase of tables to better serve her customers, offer them a more comfortable place, and be able to attract new customers. Her dreams are to have her own locale and to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy tables to better serve her customers and offer them a more comfortable place.

loans.name: Aasma

texts.en: Aasma  has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business.  Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Residing in a wooden house located in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Chea is a 47 years old. She has five children, one of whom (a daughter) is in school. Chea’s husband is working as construction workers for the main source of income while she is working as factory worker to earn additional income.
This is the first time for her to apply for a loan from VisionFund which will be used to pay for health care cost of her child who is getting sick. She hopefully wants to see her child recovers from her illness and gets healthier than before.

loans.use: To pay for health care cost of her beloved child who is getting sick.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is from Falakata. She is a 28-year-old married housewife. Her family consists of her husband and one son who is a student in grade one.

Mamata's husband is a farmer with many years of experience running his agricultural business. He grows different seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land. Mamata also helps in her husband’s work. They gather the harvest and sell it in their local market and the family somehow manages to support itself.

Now Mamata and her husband would like to enlarge their business in order to have a better lifestyle. Their present income is too scanty to cope with the present price rise of essential commodities. They have decided to cultivate radishes in their farm land. They have chosen this crop as it is profitable and there is good demand for the product in the present market, so Mamata applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). Mamata has decided to use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other things necessary for radish cultivation.

Mamata is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who believes that hard work always gives good results. She wants to do her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard. She also dreams of constructing a concrete house for them.

She is very grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for radish cultivation.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with 6 children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a healthy, happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 50 years old. He is married and has 6 children.

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 11 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet the family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a higher income-earning business and a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production

loans.name: Everlene

texts.en:
Everlene is 57 years old. She is married and blessed with 7 children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty four thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sopheap works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is the age of 42, she is married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchases goats, billy goats, bull calf, heifers etc. from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock which is very tough for him in old age. He is doing effort and earning money for the survival of both of them.
He does not have other sources to generate income for his family, he has to wait till the Muslim sacrifice day (Eid-Ul-Azha) for generating maximum income. He used this profit's amount till whole year to cherish his family.He wants to buy stock of fodder to feed his cattle till long time but he does not have enough cash remaining.
Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy Billy goats and bull calves for raising and then sell. And he could earn maximum profit to pass their lives with peace and calm.
She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy billy goats and bull calves for her husband's livestock trading.

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
These people also part of the group called Arise and shine in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. This part of the city contain citizens who are very friendly and hardworking. Four dedicated members are together in this group and they are working hard to make their dreams for better lives come true. They are into grocery, soft drinks, gari (cassava flour), smoke fish and fast food.

Salomey has three children and is married to an electrician. In order to provide more income for the family, Salomey sells grocery, soft drinks, gari (cassava flour). She is asking for a loan to buy more grocery, soft drinks, gari (cassava flour) for resale to her customers. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva and 10th loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

They promise to repay the loan without trouble.

loans.use: to buy more grocery, soft drinks, gari (cassava flour) for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Gladis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Gladis, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene 32 años de edad y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, todos viven juntos; tiene como negocio una pupusería, la cual abrió hace un año, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, atiende a sus clientes de viernes a domingo.
Invertirá en materia prima como: harina, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, gas licuado, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas, pretende tener surtido su inventario para continuar trabajando y generando los ingresos necesarios para dar un buen servicio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su visión es ir fortaleciendo poco a poco más su negocio y darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Gladis is 27 years old, she is married and her husband is 32 years old. She has two children, ages 4 and 6. They all live together.
She has a business selling stuffed tortillas, which she opened one year ago. She learned the trade from her mother and she attends to her customers from Friday to Sunday.
She will invest in ingredients such as: flour, cheese, pork, oil, liquid gas, etc. to prepare the stuffed tortillas to sell. She hopes to stock her supplies in order to continue working and generating the necessary income to provide good service and satisfy the needs of her customers.
Her vision is to strengthen her business little by little and give her family a more dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients such as: flour, cheese, pork, oil, liquid gas, etc. to prepare stuffed tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Mrs. Thuong  is 49 years old, married, and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as protect the environment. A small business is the main income source for her family, and she is able to pay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from timber  trade. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Mrs. Loi is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She is married and has two children. She has operated a cafe for 5 years. She would like to take out a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health for her family, especially her children. Her income is mainly from her business and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una señora con 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad, quedo viuda hace 18 años, pese a esto no pudo continuar con sus estudios, le toco trabajar y estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
Los fracasos que ha tenido en ocasiones anteriores no son impedimento para querer salir adelante y cumplir el sueño de tener su propio negocio y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios en la cocina de fusión. Usted puede ayudarle a ella con el préstamo, para que pueda aprender e inicie con su camino profesional.
texts.en:
Elena is a 42-year old woman. She has three children, two of whom are grown. She became widow 18 years ago, and therefore she couldn't finish her studies and had to take care of her sons.

The failures she has had in the past do not keep her from wanting to get ahead and fulfill her dream of having her own business and bring economic stability to her son. She is applying for a loan to be able to pay for her studies in fusion cuisine. You can help her with the loan, so she can learn and start with her professional career.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in fusion cuisine.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven soñadora, emprendedora, motivada y con ganas de salir adelante, tiene 22 años de edad, no tiene hijos, solo una determinación de progresar y construir un gran futuro para ella y su familia.
Nació en el seno de una familia humilde, pero quiere cambiar dicha realidad, trabajando y estudiando para convertirse en una gran empresaria y tener la oportunidad de comprarle una vivienda a su madre, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar productos de la marca Amway como shampoo, acondicionador, vitaminas y otros, los cuales distribuirá a amigos, familiares y tocara puerta a puerta buscando vender productos.
Ella busca tener sus propios recursos, para iniciar su empresa y tener la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young dreamer and entrepreneur, motivated and ready to move forward. She is 22 years old and does not have children, just a determination to progress in life and create a great future for her and her family.

She was born in the center of a humble family, but she wants to change that reality by working and studying to become a great businesswoman and have the opportunity to buy a home for her mother. She therefore requests a loan to buy Amway products such as shampoo, conditioner, vitamins and others, which she will distribute to friends and relatives. She will go door to door to look to sell her products.

She seeks to have her own resources to start her business and have the opportunity to study at the collegiate level.

loans.use: to buy Amway products such as shampoo, conditioner, vitamins and others.

loans.name: Freddinar

texts.en:
Freddinar is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. Her business is farming. 

She has been in the business for 7 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a healthy and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old and has a retail shop which she has been running for 3 years now. She is married and has been blessed with 3 children. Her spouse also earns additional income to support the family.

This is Margaret's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to buy sugar, wheat and maize flours, cooking fat, milk, and bread to resell. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy food for her family.

In the future Margaret hopes to expand her retail shop and make more income so as to provide for her family's needs and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat and maize flours, cooking fat, milk, and bread for resale.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan  is 30 years old, married, the mother of three children and very hardworking. All of her children are in school, and she earns most of her income from raising animals. She has requested a loan to build a latrine, which can improve the health of her family. With help from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan fully and on time.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung is 24 years old. There are 5 people in her family. Animal husbandry is her main source of income. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education expenses from her pig raising income.

Mrs. Nhung also earns daily income from gardening vegetables, in addition to raising chickens and pigs. She is interested in improving the living standards for her family, so she has decided they need a loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Esperanza De Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA DE SANTIAGO II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Liliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de CD´s y DVD´s. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Liliana es integrante, ella indica que son dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, aceite y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza de Santiago II" is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Focal Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by an executive board, with Liliana as the president.

The businesses run by the communal bank's members are varied, including meat sales, cosmetic sales, clothing sales, food sales, and CD and DVD sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Liliana. She shares that she has been with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles, joining because of the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling food; she says that she started this business many years ago by her own initiative.

The loan she is now requesting is to increase capital (to buy noodles, oil, and rice wholesale), which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. Later, after preparing the food, she will sell it from her sales location. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family economically. She lives in a civil union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, and rice wholesale

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a 39-year-old livestock farmer who lives in Kilifi, Kenya. She is the mother of six children, has been in agribusiness for the last three years, and is doing well. She has requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to improve her business by buying animal feed. She will use the profits she expects to earn to educate her children.  Her goal for the future is to have well-educated children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with of 3 children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

Dorcus will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to improve production. She will use the profits to expand the business as well as pay her children's school fees.

Dorcus' hopes and dreams are to ensure her children receive the best education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to improve production.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyet  is 49 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are employed. She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially her children's, but lacks capital. She is requesting a loan to build a latrine because this will improve her family's health. She will repay this loan using the earnings from her small business.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is a hardworking woman who is 52 years old and lives with her family in a small house that does not have a hygienic latrine. Her family earns its income mainly from husbandry and a small business. She is requesting this loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. She will repay this loan with her monthly earnings.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 24 years old. He is married, with one child. He has had a motorcycle transport business for three years.

Bernard will be using the loan to buy another motorcycle and he hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, make more income, and be successful.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
Mrs. Dau is 58 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom have jobs. She would like to improve her family’s standard of living, especially for her children, but she has a lack of capital.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from a salary and from selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San is a hardworking 50-year-old woman. She is requesting this loan to build a latrine to improve the health of her family and also for environment protection. Her family has a business and earns a regular monthly income which they will use to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que tiene en su negocio, le servirá para comprar abono e insecticidas y así darle un buen trato a sus cultivos de granos básicos, espera continuar teniendo estabilidad en sus ingresos.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha podido mantener más surtida la tienda y mejorar sus ingresos, su grupo familiar se mantiene y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades económicas o de salud.
texts.en:
Rosa decided to request a new loan due to the good results she is having form her business. It will help her to buy fertilizer and insecticides to treat her staple grain crops. She hopes to continue to have a stable income.

With the help of the previous loan, she has been able to keep her store stocked better and increase her income. Her family supports itself, and for the moment has not had financial or health difficulties.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to treat her staple grain crops.

loans.name: Gs El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Marció es una persona que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 10 años, se levanta todos los días muy temprano para poder darle mantenimiento a su finca, el cosecha al año un promedio de 100 quintales de café y sus ventas las realiza en los principales beneficios de la zona.
Don Marcio solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar de 65watt ya que en su comunidad carecen de energía eléctrica, es de mucha utilidad contar con un sistema solar ya que en la temporada de corta de café les ayuda a poder trabajar hasta por las noches ya que pueden medir y despulpar el café en las horas que ya no hay luz del sol, también ayuda a que sus hijos puedan realizar las tareas que les asignan en la escuela.
Don Marcio está solicitando el apoyo del crédito de forma grupal con las siguientes personas:
Juan, se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 12 años.
Delmer se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 10 años.
María se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años.
José se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 30 años.
Alberto se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 16 años.
Wendy se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 5 años.
Todos ellos solicitan el apoyo del crédito porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para hacer la inversión en un panel solar y sus sueños y deseos son compartidos ya que no tienen luz eléctrica en sus hogares y quieren darles una mejor vida a sus familias.

Honduras Agosto 2015
texts.en:
Marcio is a person who has been earning a living as a coffee grower for the past 10 years. He gets up very early in the morning every day to care for his coffee plantation. He harvests an average of 100 quintals of coffee per year, and he sells his product to the main coffee processing plants in the area.

Marcio is requesting a loan to buy a 65-watt solar panel because there is no access to electricity in his community. Having a solar panel is very useful because during the harvest season, coffee growers could even work during the night-time. They would be able to measure and depulp the coffee cherries when there is no sunlight. Moreover, his children could use the solar panel to do their homework.

Marcio is requesting the loan as a member of a group made up of the following people:

Juan, who has been a coffee grower for 12 years; Delmer, for 10 years; María, for 8 years; José, for 30 years; Alberto, for 16 years; and Wendy, for 5 years.

All of them are requesting this loan because they don't have enough capital to invest in a solar panel. They share the same hopes and dreams as they don't have electricity in their homes, and they want to provide their families with a better standard of living.

Honduras, August 2015

loans.use: to buy a 65-watt solar panel for his home.

loans.name: Gs Buenos Aires Group

texts.es:
El Señor Francis tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar. Su actividad es la caficultura es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad por su honrradez y su seriedad, Don Francis desde hace mucho tiempo habita en una comunidad al oriente de Honduras donde el clima es bueno para el cultivo de cafe y  cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo del cultivo de café y el tanbiem cuenta con una pulperia donde su familia la atiende.
Don Francis su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que con el crédito tiene pensado que será un gran avance para cumplir sus sueños ya que en su comunidad no cuentan con energía solar, el crédito lo esta solicitando para obtener la planta solar. Sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se ara realidad el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA. los demas integrantes se dedican a la caficultura y comercio y lo integran: Santos, Luis ,Alicia y Ana.





                                                           Trojes, Honduras Julio 2015
texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old. He is the father of two children and he lives with his partner. He grows coffee and is a very well-known person in his community for his honesty and seriousness. Francis has lived in a community in the east of Honduras for a long time where the weather is good for growing coffee. He has a lot of experience growing coffee and he also has worked in the grocery store that his family runs.
Francis' dream is to improve his family's living conditions. The loan will be a great support in accomplishing his dreams. His community does not have solar energy and the loan that he is requesting is to buy a solar plant.
This is a dream that he has had for a long time and it will now become a reality because of the support of the Microfinance Prisma of Honduras and Kiva.
The other members also work growing coffee and they are: Santos, Luis, Alicia and Ana.












Trojes, Honduras Julio 2015

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his home.

loans.name: Zonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan mucho para cubrir las carencias que nacen en su hogar, ella se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de fotógrafa y su esposo es el encargado de las filmaciones, tiene nueve años de estar realizando dicha actividad, ya tiene clientes establecidos y comenta que su mayor dificultad es no tener un local para el negocio.
Está necesitando de un préstamo para comprar papel fotográfico, memorias y también podrá pagar la reparación de su equipo fotográfico, su objetivo es tener en buen estado sus herramientas para trabajar en el momento que sus clientes lo soliciten.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un local para su negocio y capacitar a sus hijos, ya independientes, para que ellos administren el negocio en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her husband. They both work hard to cover their household needs. She works as a photographer and her husband works as a videographer. She has nine years of experience in this field and she has loyal customers. She states that her greatest challenge is not having a retail location for her business.

She is in need of a loan to purchase photo paper, memory cards and to pay to repair her photography equipment. Her goal is to ensure that her work equipment is in good condition so that she is able to respond to her customers' needs. She aspires to have her own retail location for he business and be able to train her adult children so that they can take over the business in the future.

loans.use: purchase photo paper, memory cards and pay to repair her photography equipment so that her equipment is in working condition.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 21-year-old married woman who started four years ago working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Amal is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special autumn and winter beauty cosmetics to develop her business.

Amal hopes to open her own shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy special autumn and winter beauty cosmetics to develop her business

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a 41-year-old snacks trader at Kilifi, Kenya.

She is a mother of five and whose spouse provides them with additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years and is doing well.

This is Nazi's fourth loan to finance her business from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase cashew nuts and the anticipated profit to educate her children.

Nazi hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts.

loans.name: Malgara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Malgara, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su esposo vive en Estados Unidos desde hace dos años y solo tiene una niña. 

Malgara, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde desde hace 1 año, decidió colocar esta granja porque tenia necesidad de una actividad que le generara ingresos.

Malgara, necesita el préstamo para comprar alimento para pollos de engorde, porque cada vez que va hasta la ciudad a comprarlo tiene que gastar en trasporte, pero si compra una buena cantidad se ahorraría el dinero de transporte. 

Malgara, siempre ha soñado con tener una granja más grande.
texts.en: Malgara is 36 years old and studied up to ninth grade. She has a partner who has been living in the United States for two years, and she only has one daughter. For a year, Malgara has had a small farm with broiler chickens. She decided to start this farm because she needed a business that produced income. Malgara needs the loan to buy food for the broiler chickens, because every time she goes to the city to buy it she has to spend in transportation; but if she buys a good amount she would save  transportation money. Malgara has always dreamed of having a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy food for broiler chickens.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Norn, who is a 51-year-old married woman with five children, two of them married, can only make $5 USD per day to support her family. Norn resides in a rural area of Khsach Kandal District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 30 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Norn would like to get a low-interest, Kiva-funded loan from HKL in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Gs El Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El Señor Omar tiene 41 años de edad, es padre de 3  hijos, convive con su compañeraa de hogar en una comunidad al oriente de Honduras donde el clima es adecuado para la agricultura. Su actividad principal es la caficultura contando con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y cuenta con una exelente plantacion de café.
Don Omar su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de de vidad tanto de el y de su familia y con el apoyo de Microfinanciera Prisma y Kiva podra realizar gran parte de sus sueños ya que siempre ha soñado con tener  Luz en su hogar gracias a este prestamo se le ara realidad un sueño que ha tenido hace mucho tiempo. Y su familia podra disfrutar de tener luz por las noches.
Los demas integrantes del grupo se dedican ala caficultura y ganaderia y lo integran: Teodoro, Carlos y Kevin quienes tambien sueñan con tener energia en sus hogares. 


                                                             Trojes, Honduras - 2015
texts.en: Omar is 41 years old. He has 3 children and lives with his domestic partner in a community in the eastern region of Honduras where the weather is adequate for agriculture. His main business activity is coffee farming, and he has a lot of experience managing this activity and has an excellent coffee plantation. Omar's dream is to improve his life conditions and those of his family. With the support of Prisma Microfinancing and Kiva, he will be able to achieve a great part of his dreams, because he has always dreamed of having light in his house. Thanks to this loan he will be able to make his dream reality and his family will be able to have light at night. The other group members work in coffee farming and animal husbandry, and are Teodoro, Carlos y Kevin, who also dream of having energy in their homes.

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his home.

loans.name: Manna

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Manna is a married woman who lives at a small village called Bahara Paschimpara of Kandi in Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is a responsible wife and mother of four daughters. Among the four daughters, two are married, and the other two go to school. Manna is an active and enterprising woman. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

Her husband’s income is not enough for her day-to-day increasing household expenses. So, Manna started an animal husbandry business from her home to support her husband financially. She rears cows and sells the milk and cow dung in her locality. In their area, the demand for the milk is very high. She knows it’s a profitable business, and she can earn more income from this business. But lack of money is a hurdle in the way of her success.

So, Manna applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow for upgrading her existing business. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand the business in order to strengthen her economic condition.

She thanks Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 51 years old. She is married but they don’t have a child. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from the expanded business to boost her business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha, aged 29, is a married woman. She has two little children (one son and one daughter). Both are students in local schools. Unfortunately, Bishakha could not complete her secondary education, as her parents could not afford it. She lives with her husband and children in their own semi-concrete house at Raghunathpur village in Murshidabad district of West Bengal.

Bishakha is hardworking and optimistic. She is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good food and clothing. Ten years ago, she and her husband started up a business selling cow milk in her locality. There is no suitable place in their house to rear cows, so they purchase milk in bulk quantity from the milkmen from their village and other villages, and sell the milk to their neighbors, local markets, and tea stalls.

They can't make enough profit through their business, as she lacks the funds to purchase more milk. She needs to improve their business to cover her household expenses. They have earned the good will of their neighbors, as they sell good milk.

With the determination to earn better for her family and cater to more customers, she turned to BJS ( Kiva 's partner) for a loan. She sought a loan to purchase more milk for their business. She hopes this will make them successful with their new venture. She dreams to see her children to be established in life.

Bishakha gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Pratima hails from Falakata. She is a married woman and a mother of three daughters. She could not continue her studies after secondary education, but she wants her children to get proper education, which they deserve. Two of her daughters are students in a local school, and the other is a preschooler.

Pratima's husband is a farmer. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. He has been a vegetable grower for the last three years. Being the only source of income, he strives hard so that his production is plentiful. Being a housewife, Pratima also helps her husband in his work after managing her household work.

With a meager monthly income, her husband is unable to invest in the business after fulfilling all the needs of his family of five members. Now, they want to cultivate tomatoes because this is the perfect season to cultivate the crop. So, Pratima is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to start cultivation of tomatoes.

With the loan that she is receiving, Pratima plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other necessary things. Her ambition is to expand the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing tomatoes.

Pratima appreciates the support of her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other necessary agricultural inputs for tomato cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor es una persona mayor de edad que aun labora para mantener a su familia, por su edad tiene serios problemas en su dentadura y desea una placa para poder tener sus dientes completos y así poder alimentarse de manera adecuada y sin dolor. Desgraciadamente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder solventar su tratamiento.
texts.en:
This gentleman is an older individual who works in order to sustain his family. Due to his age, he has serious dental problems and would like a partial dental plate so that he can have a complete set of teeth. This would allow him to adequately feed himself without any pain.

Unfortunately, the borrower does not have sufficient resources to pay for this treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is 36 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is supplying mobile phone calling cards, phone accessories and soft drinks as well as farming. He has been in the business for 13 years. He earns a monthly income of thirty-five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase stock of mobile phone calling cards. He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy and educated family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of mobile phone calling cards.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mrs. Ty is a hard-working woman, 55 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from a small business.

Ty would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members.

With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a rural area. Raising poultry and cattle is her main job, which she has been doing for more than five years.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her standard of living, especially for her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Huan

texts.en:
Mrs. Huan is a hard-working woman, 68 years old. She is married and has two children.

Huan needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environmental protection.

Her family’s income is from husbandry and a pension, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan, as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mwatua

texts.en:
Mwatua is a 54-year-old, coconut farmer at Kilifi, Kenya. He is a father of five who has been in agribusiness for the last ten years, doing well with the support of his spouse.

This is Mwatua's second loan to finance his business from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the money to purchase coconuts and groundnuts to sell and the anticipated profit to educate his children.

He hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and groundnuts.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que tiene en su negocio, le servirá para comprar abono e insecticidas y así darle un buen trato a sus cultivos de granos básicos, espera continuar teniendo estabilidad en sus ingresos.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha tenido cosechas más abundantes y mejores ingresos, su grupo familiar se mantiene y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades económicas o de salud.
texts.en: Rosa decided to request a new loan because of the good results she had in her business. She will use it to buy fertilizers and insecticides to give good treatment to her basic grains' crops. She hopes to keep having a stable income. With the previous loan she has had more abundant harvests and better income. Her family is supported, and for now she has not had financial nor health problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to give good treatment to her basic grains' crops.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Reina Ester

texts.es:
Reina, tiene como actividades económicas la crianza de cerdos, siembra de granos básicos y venta de tamales, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad, los cuales son totalmente dependientes, tiene su negocio de manera independiente, aprendió el oficio de sus parientes, cuenta con experiencia y tiene un horario de trabajo de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
En busca de una opción para mejorar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito en Padecomsm con el que comprará cerdos e insumos agrícolas, cuidará mejor de sus cultivos y atenderá a más clientes, espera incrementar las ventas e ingresos.
Los sueños por los que Reina trabaja muy duro son remodelar su vivienda y pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina works raising pigs, planting basic grains, and selling tamales. She is married and lives with her husband and her children who are three and seven years old, and depend on them totally. She does her work independently, and she learned from her relatives. She has experience and a fixed work schedule from 6:00am to 5:00pm. She does not find it difficult to do all of her work.

In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan from Padecomsm to purchase pigs and farming supplies so she can better care for her crops and serve more customers. She hopes to increase her sales and income.

Reina works hard to achieve her dreams of remodeling her home and paying for her children to attend university.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and agricultural supplies so she can improve her crops and serve more customers.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen, 25 years old, lives in Irbid. She is a student in the university majoring in arts. ‎What she wants most is to graduate and practice her profession in ‎her field and to be ‎professional. The most difficult obstacle that she faces is ‎the lack of money, since the ‎monthly payments are expensive, and if ‎she doesn't pay on time, she misses some of ‎the semester. ‎
‎ ‎
However, thanks to the loan that she received, she will be able to pay ‎without any problem, and ‎she will continue studying serenely. Haneen is very happy knowing that people from all over ‎the world are ‎concerned about the future of all the young people who want to get ‎ahead. ‎

loans.use: To pay for her university fees

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with 7 children. Her business is farming, and she has been in this business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

This is Peninah's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

Peninah will use the profits from more business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is deeply grateful to Kiva and its supporters and CCT for their tireless support for small business people like her. The loans which were granted to her were a great help in growing and sustaining her ornamental business. She also has a jeepney which her husband drives.

Once again she would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, pots, nets and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamentals. Part of the loan she will use for the maintenance of her jeepney to avoid sudden breakdowns and ensure a stable income. Cecilia makes her best efforts to take care of her two businesses since they have been her source of income that provides for her loved ones. She trusts your continuous support for her livelihood.

Cecilia's simple wish is to sustain and grow her business. She prays that her grandchildren will always be healthy and strong. She dreams of acquiring another lot to expand her ornamental farm. She prays for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy pots, nets, plastic bags, fertilizer, wire and baskets for her ornamentals and for her jeepney's maintenance.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a repeat client to UGAFODE. He is married with 5 children, 3 of whom are attending school.

John practices goat trading as his major source of income. He has been doing this for a period of 20 years.

John has relied on his business for all of his family's financial needs. However, when his children reached high school, his business alone could not meet all of his financial needs. He decided to join UGAFODE for the financial assistance to boost his business and increase his sales and earn more profits.

John applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more goats for resale. He thanks UGAFODE for financial support which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy goats to resell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. Her business is farming which she has been practicing for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

Florence will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production. She will use the profits earned from more business to educate her children.

Florence's hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and an educated family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Gs La Alianza Group

texts.es:
El Señor Oscar tiene 37 años de edad, es padre de seis hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar, habita en la Aldea de La Alianza de Capire al oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es la caficultura, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y tambien se dedica a aserrar madera de donde cuenta con ingresos diarios.
Don Oscar su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia El siempre a querido que su familia tenga Luz por las noches ya que quiere que sus hijos y su hogar tenga desarrollo, con el crédito que esta solicitando podrá obtener una planta solar, sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se ara realidad por que con una planta solar le cambiara la forma de vivir, y se le ara realidad con  el apoyo de la  Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA. los demás integrantes se dedican a la caficultura y Agricultura lo integran: Melvin, Oseas y Francisco Todos con el mismo sueño de tener energía en sus hogares y con la necesidad de capital para hacer esta inversión.


                                                             Trojes, Honduras - Agosto 2015
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old, he is the father of six children and he lives with his partner in the village of Alianza de Capire in the east of Honduras. His occupation is growing coffee. He has a lot of experience in this area and he also works cutting wood for his daily income.
Oscar's dream is to improve his family's living conditions. He has always wanted to have electricity at night and he wants his children and his home to be more developed. With the loan that he is requesting he will be able to buy a solar plant. He has dreamed of having electricity for a long time and now it will become a reality with the support of Microfinance Prisma of Honduras and Kiva.
The other members work growing coffee and in agriculture. They are: Melvin, Oseas and Francisco. They all have the same dream of having electricity in their homes and need the finances to make the investment.

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his home.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARCO IRIS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carla es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de polainas, venta de mantas, venta de comida, licorería, venta de material escolar. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carla es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de unas tías que son clientas de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo la elaboración de los platos de comida de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ARCO IRIS” ["Rainbow"] is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II regional center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, of which Carla is the President. The businesses carried out by the members of this communal bank are varied; among them are transportation services and businesses selling clothing, leggings, woven blankets, food, liquor or school supplies.

The loan they are applying for will benefit small microentrepreneurs in the group where Carla is a member. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, on the invitation of some aunts who are clients of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food. She reports that she started this business several years ago, learning from her mother how to prepare various dishes.

The funds from the loan she will receive will be used to increase her capital (buying rice and noodles on a wholesale basis). She will buy these products from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and later she will prepare them and sell them from her sales stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she has a live-in partner and three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Susa

texts.en:
A struggling “sari-sari” store – this is the kind of business that Susa operates. She has a lot of collectibles from her neighbors in Tigbauan, Iloilo. Many of her debtors pay after several weeks or months and it depletes her capital. But she cannot force them because she understands that money isn’t always easy to earn. It’s a good thing that her children are already grown-up and one of them is already working. She’s a widow who was able to raise her children well. And now her children are offering help by providing food daily and by doing the household chores.

Susa still aims to improve her variety store so it can earn enough for her needs. As much as possible, she doesn’t want to depend on her children, because sooner or later they will be starting their own families. She’s praying for 13,000 PHP in financial assistance that would be very helpful for her to buy additional inventory of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Susa is an enthusiastic member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca,  vive con su esposo y dos hijos, además de realiza labores domésticas elabora tamales para vender y tener dinero para cubrir gastos familiares, su negocio lo inicio con capital propio hace tres años, su jornada de trabajo es de nueve de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Con el financiamiento comprara aceite, maíz, frijoles, leña, etc., al tener los materiales necesarios ella elaborara mayor cantidad de tamales, pretende tener un negocio más competitivo y ofrecer a sus clientes productos de mayor calidad, espera que sus ingresos incrementen.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio y tener más popularidad en la zona.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and two children. In addition to doing the housework, she makes tamales to sell and have money to cover the household expenses. She started her business with her own capital three years ago. She works from nine in the morning until four in the afternoon.

With the loan, she will buy oil, corn, beans, firewood, etc., to have the necessary materials to make a larger quantity of tamales. She intends on having a more competitive business and offering her customers a better quality product. She hopes to increase her income.

Her dream is to maintain her business and be more popular in the area.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, beans, firewood, etc., to have the necessary materials to make a larger quantity of tamales.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a farmer from Debedavan village of the Tavush region. She lives with her mother and two little kids.

Rita's farm is rich with harvest. She currently grows plum, pomegranate and fig trees. Rita also keeps three sows and 71 chickens. She works hard to provide appropriate living conditions for her family.

Aiming to enlarge the number of cattle on the farm and be prepared for the winter season, Rita is asking for this loan. She plans to purchase a cow and calf. This will help her to have milk in the winter and get dairy products.

As this is Rita's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before because they have no credit history

loans.use: to pay for a cow and calf

loans.name: Betulia

texts.es:
La señora Betulia tiene 58 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras,  es madre soltera, tiene casa propia y su actividad principal es el comercio, se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboracion de rosquillas y hojaldras, estos productos los vende al por mayor y al detalle a diferentes pulperias de la zona y a personas que le viciten.
Doña Betulia sus clientes le  prefieren por sus productos que son de buena calidad y por  la buena atencion que les brinda a sus clientes, esta solictando el prestamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de sus productos como maiz, huevos, soda, leña, harina, etc. y asi cumplir con la demanda de producto de sus clientes.
Doña Betulia su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida.


Trojes, Honduras -  Agosto  del 2015.
texts.en:
Betulia is 58 years old. She lives in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras. She is a single mother. She owns her own home and her main activity is being a merchant. For 15 years she has made doughnuts and puff pastries. She sells these products wholesale and retail to different stores in the area and to people who order from her.

Betulia's customers prefer her because her products are of good quality and because she offers good service to her customers. She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials to make her products, such as corn, eggs, soda, firewood, flour, etc., so she can meet the demand of her customers.

Betulia's dream is to be able to improve her living conditions.


Trojes, Honduras - August of 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs, soda, firewood, flour,  etc.

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE MAYO” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son varios, entre ellos existen: venta de té y café, venta de jugos de frutas, venta de carne de res, venta de faldas y chompas, venta de zapatillas, venta de material escolar.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café y té; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace treinta y cinco años, quien le ayudo a emprender este negocio es su hermana, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija mayor.

Ahora el crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar y café por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros, el área de salud, las capacitaciones y los créditos otorgados en la institución.
texts.en:
The “18 DE MAYO” communal bank will start its twelfth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Juan Pablo II focal center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Ruth is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling coffee and tea, selling fruit juices, selling beef, selling skirts and sweaters, selling slippers, and selling school supplies.

The loan that the micro-business woman will take out will benefit them, including Ruth. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Now she has a business selling coffee and tea. She reports that she started this business thirty five years ago, and it was her sister who helped her start it. Now it is her oldest daughter her helps her in the business.

The loan she will take out now will be to increase capital by buying sugar and coffee wholesale that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings, the area of health, the trainings and the loans given by the institution.

loans.use: to buy sugar and coffee wholesale.

loans.name: Otto Vladimir

texts.es:
Otto manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior ha podido mantenerse desarrollando sus actividades propias del taller de estructuras metálicas y de construcció, sus condiciones económicas ha mejorado, tiene estabilidad en el negocio y no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar.
El nuevo crédito que solicita le será de utilidad para comprar hierro, laminas y tubos para fabricar balcones, espera que los resultados de la inversión sean tan positivos como los del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Otto says that with the previous loan he has been able to continue developing his own projects in the workshop for metal structures and construction. His economic conditions have improved, he has stability in his business, and he has not had difficulty working.

The new loan Otto is requesting will go towards purchasing iron, sheet metal, and pipes for building balconies. He hopes the results of the investment will be as positive as those of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase iron, sheet metal, and pipes for building balconies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 58 años de edad, está soltera, estudio hasta tercer grado, porque sus padres vivían en extrema pobreza, fue por esa razón que solo se dedicó a trabajar en las milpas y en las algodoneras; actualmente vive con 2 hijos de 45 y 36 años de edad que son los que le ayudan en su trabajo de crianza de pollos de engorde y del ganado.

Maribel, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la crianza de pollos de engorde, este oficio lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de subsistencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de pollos, logro colocar un cafetin en la escuela de su cantón, en donde vende golosinas y algún tipo de comida, para los niños que asisten a la escuela, ella trabaja en el cafetin todos los días desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 

Maribel, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 500 pollos de engorde y también para surtir su cafetin con más productos, para tener todo lo que los niños buscan para comer.

Maribel, sueña con hacer su casa de ladrillo porque donde actualmente vive es de adobe.
texts.en:
Maribel, who is 58 years old, is single. She attended school through third grade because her parents lived in extreme poverty. It was for this reason that she has only worked in the corn and cotton fields. She now lives with her two children, ages 45 and 36, who are the ones who help her in her work of raising chickens and cattle.

Maribel has raised chickens for eight years. She learned this work out of the same need for subsistence. With the earnings that she obtains from selling chickens, she managed to set up a cafe in the school in her canton, where she sells candies and some type of food to the children who attend the school. She works in the cafe every day from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Maribel is applying for the loan to buy 500 chickens to raise and also to stock her cafe with more products in order to have what the children are looking for to eat.

Maribel dreams of building a house of brick, because the one where she now lives is made from adobe.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens to raise and also to stock her cafe with more products.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es:
Yolanda, vive con su esposo y un nieto, la fuente de ingresos familiar es una pequeña pensión que su esposo recibe y las ganancias que le genera una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, que  ella personalmente administra, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, el negocio lo tiene desde hace cinco años y lo fundo con capital propio.
Comprará lácteos, galletas, pan, golosinas, cereales, entre otros productos para presentar un mejor inventario a sus clientes, sus planes son incorporar nuevos productos a su negocio para disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes, tiene la fe de generar nuevas ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Yolando lives with her husband and one grandchild. The family's source of income is a small pension that her husband receives and the earnings generated from a general store that she personally runs. She attends to her customers from six in the morning until six in the evening. She has had this business for 5 years and she started it with her own funds.
She will buy milk, cookies, bread, candy, and cereal, among other products to provide a better inventory for her customers. Her plan is to incorporate new products into her business to meet her customer's needs. She has faith that she will generate a better income.
Her dream is to have a larger business and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy milk, cookies, bread, candy, and cereal, among other products to provide a better inventory for her customers.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna is a 44-year-old rural housewife and a mother of three children (two daughters and one son). Her daughters are married. She lives with her husband and their only son at Raghunathpur village in Murshidabad. Her 20-year-old son, who studied to the seventh grade, is engaged in his father's business. Jamuna and her husband both are illiterate, but can sign their names.

Jamuna's husband makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, and wardrobes per customers' orders. In order to construct the furniture, he requires materials such as nails, a hammer, and good modern tools, so Jamuna wants to invest money to buy all the required materials for enhancing the carpentry work.

With the hope of improving their present economic situation, Jamuna is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to give her husband the possibility of buying necessary tools. This will allow him to handle the larger requests from his clients and supply the orders on time.

She also hopes that this business will generate enough income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead. She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
