Martha, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad.

Martha, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad desde hace 5 años este trabajo lo aprendió con su hermana porque ella tiene este tipo de negocio también; anteriormente solo estudiaba y le ayudaba a su mamá en su casa, su negocio está a 10 minutos de su casa y viaja en bus, su horario es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar cajas de ropa y tener más inventario en su tienda, para mejorar su condición económica.

Martha, desea que su negocio crezca para la temporada de fin de año y espera que su hija comience a estudiar el otro año.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 21 years old, completed secondary school. She is single and has a four-year-old daughter.

Martha has had a business of selling clothing in the city for five years. She learned this work with her sister, because she also has this type of business. In the past, she only went to school and helped her mother in her house. Her business is 10 minutes from her house, and she travels by bus. Her schedule is from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm.

Martha needs the loan to buy boxes of clothing and have more inventory in her store in order to improve her economic conditions.

Martha wants her business to increase for the season at the end of the year, and she hopes that her daughter will begin to go to school next year.

loans.use: to buy boxes of clothing and have more inventory in her store.

loans.name: Carlos Enrrique

texts.es:
El señor Carlos de  44  años de edad  vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijos  en su casa propia,   se dedica desde hace 10  años a la actividad de venta de leña seca para cocinar y a la venta de agua, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas de San Lorenzo que cuentan con su negocio de ventas de comida.
Don Carlos es un hombre emprendedor que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra 24 tambos plasticos nuevos para la venta agua purificada en su coche ya que esta también es otra actividad que realiza,   con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y sacar adelante a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2015.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in his own house.
He has worked for 10 years selling water and dry firewood for cooking. His customers are all friends, neighbours and people of San Lorenzo who rely on their businesses of selling food.
Carlos is an entrepreneurial man who strives everyday to improve his quality of life. He is requesting the loan to buy 24 new plastic barrels for selling purified water from his car, as this is the other activity that he does. With this loan he hopes to improve his income and quality of life.
His dream is to expand his business in order to improve his quality of life and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic barrels for his business.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Brillantes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ESTRELLITAS BRILLANTES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de sombreros, venta de pañales, venta de artículos varios, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años ya que con los ahorros que tenía decide emprender su propio negocio, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija. 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS ESTRELLITAS BRILLANTES” communal bank is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is made up of eleven members and is lead by a board of directors with Filomena as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of food, selling blankets, selling hats, selling diapers, selling a variety of items, the sales of clothing and a neighborhood store.

The loan they are taking out will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs Filomena being one. She indicated that it is the first time that she is part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a promotion by the institution in her area.

At present she has a business selling food. She says that she learned to do this on her own initiative a few years ago as she decided to start her own business with the savings she had. Her daughter currently helps her with her business.

The loan that she is taking out now will be to increase her capital (buying rice, noodles and potatoes wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto which she will later make and sell in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Chhabi

texts.en:
Chhabi is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She lives with her family in Shibrambati, a rural area in Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is uneducated and can sign her name only. She was deprived of education due to her parental poverty. Her son reads in grade 12 and the daughter studies in college.

Chhabi is a housewife who looks after her husband and children and manages the household work. Her husband, Uttam, is a rickshaw puller. He carries people on his rickshaw (a means of transport operated by cycle, widely used in rural areas) from one place to another inside the village. He lives with his family in very poor conditions. He doesn't surrender to this, but strives strongly to improve life for his family.

He is a hardworking and responsible man, and is trying to buy a new rickshaw to give it on rent for another means of income. His goal is to earn enough money to care for his family. He believes this business will be very profitable for him, and he can earn a lot of money. Unfortunately, the money he has saved is not enough to purchase a new cycle-van.

That is why Chhabi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) in order to buy a rickshaw. Chhabi hopes that her husband will surely expand his work and improve their social and financial living conditions in the future. She dreams to provide higher education to her children.

Chhabi is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Pedro Ascencio

texts.es:
Pedro, de 30 años de edad, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos que ya asisten a la escuela.

Pedro, tiene una pequeña panadería desde hace 1 año, pero además de la panadería también trabaja como jornalero, la panadería la tiene en su casa y su pareja y sus hermanos le ayudan a hacer pan.

Pedro, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina para elaborar pan dulce, para no estar viajando hasta la ciudad tan seguido.

Pedro, sueña con tener una panadería más grande y prospera para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 30 years old, only went to school through fifth grade. He is married, and his wife does the domestic tasks. He has two children who already go to school.

Pedro has had a little bakery for a year, but in addition to the bakery, he also works as a day laborer. The bakery is in his house, and his wife and siblings help him to make bread.

Pedro needs the loan to buy flour to make sweet bread, so that he won't be traveling to the city so often.

Pedro dreams of having a bigger bakery and flourishing so that he obtains more income.

loans.use: to buy flour to make sweet bread.

loans.name: Iti

texts.en:
Iti is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives at Kandi of Murshidabad district in West Bengal. She is a mother of two young children ( one son and one daughter) ; her son is a student and daughter is married. Iti is an enterprising woman. She engages herself in a family-run sewing business and works together with her husband. For additional income, her husband runs an orchestra business of orchestra at many occasions.

Iti's husband purchases sewing materials from a nearby town and Iti helps him by stitching different men's and women's attire. Her husband supplies the products to the local shops as well as to their neighbors. They strive hard to survive, as this business is the prime source of income for the family.

Unfortunately, their tireless work brings very marginal income per month, which is barely enough for the household as well as to bear the educational cost of her son. They feel that they should increase their production, but they do not have sufficient capital to invest in their business. So, Iti asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner). She will purchase one improved sewing machine, which will help her to sew more clothing with ease.

Iti wishes to grow her business and save enough for the future for her son's education. She thanks her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en: Honorio lives in San Miguel Buenavista, Tlacoapa with his family. His town is located in Guerrero, one of the states with higher poverty rates in Mexico. It is located at 7,300 ft. of altitude, which makes it a remote town where inhabitants  lack of basic services, such as electricity, potable water and drainage system. Honorio is a farmer, he cultivates corn, beans and pumpkin to earn money and for his own consumption. He wants to invest in a solar system to help his kids to have a better light to study and to protect them from the candle smoke, but he needs a loan to start his dream. He believes, a solar system can make a big  difference in their life quality.

loans.use: to purchase a solar systems to light his house and allow his kids do their homework after the sunset without breathing smoke from the candles and ocote.

loans.name: Luz Del Camino Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DEL CAMINO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nely es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de productos por catálogo, salón de belleza, tienda de barrio, venta de gaseosas y dulces, venta de celulares, venta de edredones y frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nely es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de su comadre que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza; da a conocer, que antes de iniciar este negocio, ella estudio en un instituto, después de haber culminado sus estudios, trabajó como ayudante en un salón de belleza y con los ahorros que logro obtener decidió emprender su propio negocio, hace doce años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una plancha secadora, que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz, para posteriormente ofrecer sus servicios en su salón de belleza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones, el área de salud  y el monto de crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luz del Camino" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  The group meets at the Juan Pablo II central office.  The group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Nely is the Secretary.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: clothing sales, catalog sales, beauty salon, soft drink and sweets sales, cellular phone sales, and comforter and blanket sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small business-people in this group, of which Nely  is a member.  Nely joined this group at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  At this time, she has a beauty salon, a business that she got to know by studying at an institution.  Later, after finishing her studies, she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon, and with the money she was able to save she decided to start up her own business 12 years ago.

Nely will use this loan to buy a hair iron and hair dryer from the sellers in the city of La Paz  to use in her beauty salon.  Her work enables her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training, the health services, and the loans that the institutions offers.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 63, is married and has one child. She catches and sells fish in her village market to make a living and help support her parents.

Lilia has applied for a 5,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner GDMPC to buy additional fishing nets for her work. She wants to make enough money to build a comfortable and safe house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her work.

loans.name: Mamena

texts.en:
Mamena is a 39-year-old married lady hailing from Falakata. She is blessed with four children (one daughter and three sons), all of whom are students. She is a housewife who lives with her family in Bara Shoulmari village. Unfortunately, Mamena and her husband did not receive any formal education and remain uneducated; they can only sign their names.

Mamena's husband has been running a small grocery store for two years. Mamena tries to help her husband run the store. He offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many regular customers. He is passionate about his work, and client demand is high. But business challenges combined with family expenses frustrate him because the income is not at all sufficient to support a family of six members. He wants to grow his business and make his store fully stocked with different grocery items.

So, Mamena requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour, biscuits, cakes and other daily necessities in bulk from the wholesale market at lower rates. In this way, her husband will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently, and she expects to boost her earnings to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

Mamena expresses her gratitude to her lenders, BJS, and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en: Vin’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vin works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida  has successfully established her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.name: Carmelo Jose

texts.en:
Carmelo Jose is 43 years old and lives in Tierra Alta, Colombia. He has two children, a girl who is eleven years old and a boy, eight. He has lived in the countryside for many years because his family are farmers. His father taught him to farm, and now he owns his own farm where he grows a variety of foods.

Carmelo wants to make improvements to his farm so as to give his family a better quality of life but lacks the capital to do so. He has applied for a 1,000,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy farm inputs and pay for some technical assistance.

For Carmelo, his children are the most important thing in life, so he works hard to give them the best. He dreams of paying for a good education for them and someday leaving them the farm. You can help him realize his ambitions through this loan.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for some technical assistance.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 60-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. With her determination of lifting her financial stability, she is proficiently running her rice retailing business. She has been doing this for 20 years to sustain each day, thus, for household expenses, food and personal care products. In short, the profits that she earns from her sales aren’t enough for this woman who dreams of a sustainable means of living.    That’s why she is requesting of a loan to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de polleras, venta de queso. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, con un pequeño capital para emprender su negocio, menciona que este negocio lo aprendió de su sobrina que tenía un negocio similar. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes y carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Las Emprendedoras” (The Enterprising Ones) communal bank is starting its twelfth lending cycles with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. The communal bank is made up of ten members and overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Nancy is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: selling food, selling fish, clothing sales, t-shirt sales and selling cheese.

The loan the communal bank is taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, including señora Nancy. Señora Nancy says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the communal bank. Señora Nancy currently has a business selling food that she prepares. She tells us that she started the business several years ago; with a small amount of capital, she launched her business. She says that she learned the business from a niece, who had a similar business herself.

The loan that señora Nancy is now taking out is to increase her capital (to purchase wholesale groceries and meat), which she will acquire from the sellers in El Alto and later use to make the food that she sells from her food stall. Señora Nancy's work allows her to generate the income she needs to help her family financially. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Nancy replied that she liked the trainings and health information that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries and meat.

loans.name: Víctor Antonio

texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old and the head of a family in Cienaga de Oro, Colombia. For many years he’s wanted to have his own business because he is an entrepreneur and an independent soul who wants to be a success. This year he took the plunge, and now he’s the owner of a chicken ranch.

Victor has been working hard to improve his business and increase his profits, all to improve his and his family’s lives. He wants to invest in his chicken venture so he has applied for a 1,000,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

Victor has big dreams and always finds a way to accomplish them. He would like to make improvements to his house. Now he’s asking for a little assistance. Help him achieve his goals through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nedilen

texts.en:
Nedilen is married and resides at Puntod, Lopez Jaena with her family. Nedilen has sold fish for 8 years and her husband fishes for a living. She has repaid successfully her previous loan and took a new loan to purchase hooks and nets to catch more fish to sell.

In the future, Nedilen hopes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

location.town: P-4, PUNTOD, LOPEZ JAENA, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Ericka De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Ericka de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Erika, quien tiene tres hijos, es casada y tiene una venta de verduras en el mercado del pueblo desde hace 8 años. Su sueño es tener otras ventas y así dejarles a sus hijos un negocio para que puedan salir adelante como sus padres lo hicieron con ella.  Hay varias verduras como tomate por caja, papa por quintal, plátano por caja, güisquil por bulto y mas que le hacen falta comprar en la venta y no le alcanza el dinero, por eso ella necesita un préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta  y no quedarles mal a las señoras en donde ella entrega verdura y así también tener muy bonitas ganancias.
texts.en:
This is the Ericka of San Pedro solidarity group. In charge of this group is Señora Erika, who has three children, is married, and has had a business selling vegetables in the town market for 8 years now. Her dream is to have other sales and to leave her children a business with which they may succeed, as her parents did with her.

She has various vegetables such as tomatoes by the box, potatoes by the 100 pound, plantains by the box, packages of Chayotes, and more that she needs to buy, but does not have the money for. For this reason she needs a loan to buy what she lacks, so as to not be in bad standing with the women where she delivers the vegetables, and to have very good earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wilson Jose

texts.en:
Wilson is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has 3 children and this responsible father continues to work to give them a good quality of life. In 1995 he decided to start his own business, he’s the owner of a mechanical workshop.

Sometimes the costs of the supplies can be really expensive, but he wants to create a successful business. He expects to be competitive and sustain his business and will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts, oil, and tires.

Wilson's children are the most important thing and all that he does is for them. He wants to make his business successful so someday he can leave it to his children. Help Wilson to accomplish all his dreams, a loan will get him so much closer.

loans.use: to buy some motorcycle parts, oil, and tires.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosaura, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de carnes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are members of the community bank "Virgen del Carmen" (Our Lady of Mount Carmel). This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, belonging to the province of Cusco, in the Cusco Region.

The featured member is Señora Rosaura, who continues to make her living with her meat selling business. She has spent a lot of time with her business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is still selling in one of the Cusco markets. She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream-come-true through Kiva, and agrees to comply with her payment due dates. This member is requesting a loan to buy meat.

All of the members appreciate the credit granted and are committed to meeting their quotas. The member whose photo is superimposed on the group photo asked permission to be late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to purchase meats.

loans.name: Eulises Enrique

texts.en:
Eulises is 25 and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has 2 sons who are 13 and 14 years of age, and they are the reason that Eulises works hard and why he decided to start his own business 10 years ago. He owns a business to raise pigs.

His business has a problem, and it is that it has a lot of competition, so he has to work extra hard and find strategies to sell more. He plans to be more competitive and sustain his business. He’s asking for a loan to buy pigs, food, vaccines, and vitamins.

Eulises dreams that his business will be successful and recognized. He would like to improve the conditions of his house. You can help him with a loan and watch him accomplish all his dreams.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She always has been a really ambitious woman who fights hard to accomplish all what she wants. Five years ago, she started her own business to raise pigs.

This business has a lot of competition and she works hard and raises her pigs with extreme care and attention. She hopes to have a sustainable business. She requests a loan to buy some pigs, vaccines, and food.

Claudia dreams big and knows she’s going to accomplish big things in her life. She wants to improve the conditions of her house so her family can have a better quality of life. Support Claudia with the loan she’s asking for and help her improve her business and her life.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vaccines, and food.

loans.name: Antonio Manuel

texts.en:
Antonio is 66 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has a daughter who he loves very much and who encourages him to go further and be successful. In 2005, he decided to start his own retail business to better provide for his family.

His store is not the only one in his location, he has a lot of competition. He wants to invest in his business and be more competitive. He’s asking for a loan to buy snacks, sodas, beer, and a cooler.

Antonio wants his daughter to be successful in life, and he has educated and raises her to accomplish that. He hopes one day to leave the business to her to manage and make it more successful. Help this devoted father to accomplish his dreams and to keep supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sodas, beer, and a cooler.

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.en:
Virginia is 25 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She is a strong woman who wants to have success in life. She works hard and dreams big. Three years ago, she inherited a business to raise pigs and her mother taught her how to do her job.

It is hard to make a lot of money because of the competition, but people with ambition and good sales strategies can be successful. She wants to sustain her business and asks for a loan to buy pigs, food, vaccines, and vitamins.

Virginia never stops dreaming because she’s sure she’s meant to success and accomplish big things. He hopes he can repair some damages that her house has so she and her family can live safer. Help now Virginia with a loan and let her be closer to achieve all her goals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food, vaccine, and vitamins.

loans.name: Edinson Antonio

texts.en:
Edinson is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl; he loves his family and works hard to give them a good quality of life. Ten years ago, this responsible father started his own business to provide for his family. He inherited from his family's farm to grow different kind of products.

There’s a lot of competition in his location, but he works hard to keep his family's tradition and to make it successful. He wants to see his business last for many years. He’s asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.

Edinson wants to give to his family a good life so they feel proud of him and learn to be independent. Help this man to accomplish his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.en:
Mauricio is 19 years old and lives in the municipality of Sonson. He’s always been a dreamer and a fighter who fights hard for what he wants, which is to run his own business. He inherited a farm business from his family and his father taught him everything.

The weather and the high costs of the inputs have been a constant problem to this business. In order to have a sustainable business, he wants to invest in it, but needs capital. He requests a loan to buy insecticides, fertilizer, creole potatoes, and beans seeds.

Mauricio is a young man with a clear goal to work hard, accomplish his dreams, and support his family. This is just the beginning and you can be part of this story by loaning and supporting the dreams of this young man.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, creole potatoes, and beans seeds.

loans.name: Damarys Luz

texts.en:
Damarys is 43 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She has 3 children who are 9, 21 and 22. They are the main reason that Damarys works hard. In order to provide for her family, she started her own business 10 years ago to raise pigs.

There is a lot of competition in her location, so she works extra hard to offer better service and products. She wants to sustain her business so that her family never lacks anything. She’s asking for a loan to buy pigs, food, and vaccines.

Damarys loves her children and wants them to be successful and good people. She hopes one day to leave her business to them. Help Damarys with a loan so she can accomplish all her dreams.

loans.use: to buy some pigs, food, and vaccines.

loans.name: Gilma Rosa

texts.en:
Gilma is 65 years old and lives in the municipality of Barbacoas. She has 8 grown children. She always wanted to have a big family, and she accomplished that, which is like anything she proposes to do. Last year she decided to start her own business to raise pigs.

She wants to improve her business by increasing her sales, being more competitive, and having a sustainable business. She lacks capital to invest in her business and requests a loan to buy pigs and food.

Gilma shows everybody that it is never too late to fulfill dreams, and she wants to accomplish a lot more, like improving the condition of her house. You can be part of this beautiful story by supporting her with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana, who is 27 years old and a married woman, lives in the small village of Namupara in Murshidabad district with her family. Her family is comprised of her husband and one very young son who is a preschooler. She is fortunate enough that she was able to complete her secondary education unlike most other women in her village who were deprived of an education. Her husband also received a secondary education. Her husband is a cultivator who works on his farmland from dawn to dusk to grow vegetables to earn for the family. But his inconsistent income is quite insufficient for the family's livelihood.

For giving financial help to the family, Kalpana started dairy farming five years back with the purchase of one cow. She has been supplying milk to her neighbors who are her clients. Now to earn more for the family, she has decided to expand her business by selling more milk. She wants to purchase another cow.

So she has asked for financial help from BJS (Kiva's partner). The addition of one more cow will increase her productivity and help her to earn more. It will be a great support for this hardworking woman, enabling her to live in better conditions. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure a good education for her son so he may progress in life.

This loan will be a great support for the family so Kalpana thanks her lenders wholeheartedly.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Felix Tomas

texts.es: Felix tiene 54 años de edad, que estudia y trabaja. Actualmente esta estudiando un diplomado de especialización en Normas Internacionales de Información Financiera. Decidió estudiar dicha especialización, porque en un mundo tan competitivo solo los conocimientos avanzados permiten sobrevivir con éxito. Su pareja y sus dos hijas son su mayor motivación para seguir adelante. El crédito que requiere lo destinara para el pago de sus estudios de diplomado. Felix se siente feliz y agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como él.
texts.en: Felix is 54-years old and he studies and works. Currently, he is studying a diploma with specialization in International Financing Reporting Standards. He decided to study this specialization because in a world so competitive, only advanced knowledge allows successful survival. His partner and his two daughters are his big motivation to keep going. The loan that he needs will be used to pay for his graduate studies. Felix is happy and thankful to the Kiva loaners for helping people like him.

loans.use: to pay for graduate studies.

loans.name: Kumkum

texts.en:
Kumkum is a hardworking entrepreneur from Kandi. She is 45 years old and resides with her husband and two sons. Kumkum was deprived of an education in her young age because of the poor financial resources of her family. Her husband passed grade five. One of their sons is in school; the other is engaged in agricultural activities. They live in the small village of Namupara in the district of Murshidabad.

Kumkum's husband works as a worker for a small private company. They find it is hard to depend on his income, as it is very scanty. So Kumkum has been actively involved in cattle farming for the last two years. She enjoys dairy farming - milking her cows is her hobby. She supplies milk to her neighbors to generate additional income for the family. But the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of business capital, which is very desirable to make her more productive and valuable as a dairy farmer.

To solve this problem, Kumkum is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. Having an additional cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. In the short run, she will be saving the returns to provide her son with a better education. In the long run, she will have saved enough money to go for better breeds of cows. Kumkum's dream is to build her capital and asset base in order to lead a financially secure life in the future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Nilufa

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Nilufa hails from the small village of Mukuldanga in Falakata in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a young housewife who lives with her husband and two lovely sons in their own house. One son is in grade one and the other is a preschooler.

Her husband Jahidul is the sole breadwinner for the family. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells his harvest in the local market. Apart from covering household expenses, he does end up compromising on meeting his family’s needs. So, to earn more he has decided to cultivate cauliflower. Being a winter season vegetable, the cultivation has to be started very soon and cauliflower is in great demand in his locality. To help her husband, Nilufa seeks a loan from Kiva and BJS.

With the loan, Nilufa will purchase the necessary farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation to grow their business and earn more to ensure financial stability for her family’s well being.

She expresses her gratitude towards her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila hails from Falakata. She is a 30-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of Chuyakhola in Falakata, Alipurduar district, West Bengal. Both her children are students and read in grade nine and grade eight respectively. Urmila's husband is a farmer by profession.

Urmila is an energetic and active lady. As her husband's meager income is insufficient for covering the family's basic needs, she is engaged in her small scale business of raising cows and selling milk. She raises cows and sells the milk to her neighbors and local dairy shops. With the earnings from this business, they can somehow manage their family expenses. Due to the increasing costs of living and education, she needs to develop her business. So Urmila is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

It will be a small step forward bringing a hike in the income as well as savings, which will help her to build financial stability for her family and the means for guaranteeing her children a good education.

She is grateful to her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for the expansion of her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es:
Reina, de 58 años de edad, está casada, solo estudio hasta primer grado, se dedicó a trabajar desde que era muy pequeña, con ella viven sus 4 hijos, todos trabajan en diferentes actividades para ayudar al sustento diario, ya que su esposo los abandonó hace muchos años, por lo que ella vela por su hogar.

Reina, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la crianza de pollos de engorde y cerdos, este negocio lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de sobrevivir, no tiene ninguna oportunidad de un empleo formal, todos los días trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana, ella prepara la comida para sus cerdos y pollos, les lava sus bebederos y les da de comer, luego se dedica a los oficios de la casa y esa es rutina de todos los días.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 pollos de engorde y 2 cerdos, estos los engordara durante cierto tiempo para luego venderlos y con la ganancia, seguirá trabajando y tendrá segura la comida de sus hijos. 

Reina, sueña con viajar a Estados Unidos y conocer muchas ciudades bonitas, ya que siempre a vivido en su cantón, sin poder conocer ni su país.
texts.en:
Reina is 58-years old. She is married and only went to school until the 1st grade. She started working when she was very young. Her 4 children live with her and they all do different jobs to help feed the family, because her husband abandoned them many years ago, which is why she takes care of her home.

Reina has been raising broiler chickens and pigs for 30 years. She learned this business from the need to survive, as she does not have any opportunity for a formal job. Every day she works from 6 AM. She prepares the food for her pigs and chickens, she washes their drinking troughs and she gives them food. Afterwards, she does household jobs and that is the routine every day.

Reina needs the loan to buy 100 broiler chickens and 2 pigs. She will fatten them for a certain time to later sell them. With the earnings, she will continue working and will assure her children are fed. Reina dreams of traveling to the United States to visit many beautiful cities, because she has always lived in her small town without even being able to travel in her country.

loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chickens and 2 pigs.

loans.name: Joselin

texts.es: Joselin es una joven estudiante de la carrera de diseño de modas, actualmente tiene 19 años y cursa su 4to ciclo en su instituto. Ella se dedica diariamente a confeccionar, remallar y reparar trajes en su pequeño negocio que se sitúa en su hogar. Ella comenta que desde pequeña tuvo la afición sobre los trajes y diseños, es por eso que actualmente lucha día a día para ser mejor estudiante y persona. El préstamo solicitado es para poder pagar sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales requeridos en sus clases. Ella se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus meta.
texts.en: Joselin is a young student in the Fashion Design career. She is 19-years old and in her 4th cycle in her institution. She works every day making, mending and repairing outfits in her small business located in her house. She says that since she was young she had a liking towards outfits and design. For that reason, she is currently fighting day-after-day to be a better student and person. The loan will be used to pay her fees and to buy some materials required in her classes. She is very thankful for the people of Kiva for helping her to meet her goal.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Sandhya lives in a small village called Dhallapara in Kandi, West Bengal. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband and her elder son are engaged in making tin boxes. Her youngest son and only daughter are studying in different grades.

Sandhya’s husband's income is very inconsistent. To help her husband financially, she runs an animal husbandry business. She buys goat kids from the wholesale market at a lower price and after raising them, when they are mature, she sells them to the local meat shops at a profitable price. Now she wants to expand her business because the demand for goat meat is very high in her locality.

So Sandhya applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more goat kids for her business.

She is very thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy more goat kids for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Laboo

texts.en:
Laboo is a 40-year-old hardworking woman from a very rural village called Bahara Paschimpara in Kandi, West Bengal. She is the mother of a daughter who is married. Her husband is engaged in farming.

Besides managing her family, Laboo has been running an animal husbandry business for many years. She takes care of her cows and sells the milk and cow dung in her locality. Now she wants to develop her business by supplying more milk to her customers.

So, Laboo applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow to upgrade her existing business. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand the business in order to strengthen her economic condition.

Laboo conveys her heartiest thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 25 años de edad, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, el esposo trabaja de albañil y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad.

Flor, se dedica al comercio de semilla de marañón asada, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, en la zona es común que la gente vende semilla de marañón porque hay varias marañoneras, antes de este negocio se dedicaba al oficio domestico, el comercio lo hace a 1 kilómetro de su casa.

Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla de marañón para procesarla y venderla.

Flor, sueña con tener una casa de bloque, porque donde vive es de lámina.
texts.en: Flor is 25-years old. She only went to school until the 5th grade. She is married and her husband works as a builder and they have 2 younger children. Flor works selling roasted cashews and has been doing this business for 5 years. In the area, it is common for the people to sell cashews because there are many cashew plants. Before this business, she worked in domestic chores. The business is 1 kilometer from her house. Flor needs the loan to buy cashews to process and sell. Flor dreams of having a cement block house because the one she has now is metal.

loans.use: to buy cashews to process and sell.

loans.name: Alicia Del Camen

texts.es:
Alicia, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el campo, tienen dos hijos, uno está en el extranjero y el otro vive con ella.

Alicia, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su comunidad desde hace 8 años, comenzó a vender en su casa poco a poco y ahora sale a vender en toda la comunidad; antes solo se dedicaba a criar pollos en su casa para vender; ahora sale a vender desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta que termina la ruta y luego vuelve.

Alicia, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos y comenzar nuevamente el negocio de la granja y asi tendrá otro ingreso más para su familia.
 
Alicia, sueña con poder tener una granja grande en su casa y para tener este negocio para fin de año ya que es cuando la demanda crece .
texts.en:
Alicia, 43 years old, went to school until the eighth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a farmer. They have two children: one is out of the country, and the other lives with her.

Alicia has had a business selling clothes in her community for 8 years. She began making sales in her house little by little, and now she goes out to sell to the whole community. Before, the only thing she did was raise chickens in her house to sell. Now, she goes out to work from 8:00 a.m. until she finishes her route and comes home.

Alicia needs the loan to purchase chickens and restart her farm business. That way, she'll have an additional source of income for her family. She dreams of having a big farm at her house, and to have this business by the end of the year, because that's when the demand grows.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and restart her farming business.

loans.name: Sol  Andino Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL ANDINO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de frazadas para bebé, venta de pipocas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una sobrina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pipocas de maíz; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace varios años. 

El crédito que sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de maíz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Sol Andino" loan group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Pan American Center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board where Juana is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association take on are various, and among them are: selling furniture, selling baby blankets, and selling popcorn. The loan that they will take out will benefit the small businesses where Juana is a member. She points out that this is the first time that she has been with Pro Mujer, joining from an invitation from a niece who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling popcorn. She learned this business from her husband several years ago. The loan that she will take out will be to increase capital by buying wholesale corn, which she will get from the sellers in the city of El Alto. After making it, she will sell it in her stall. This form of work allows her to get an income to support her family economically, because she is married with two children. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Sanas

texts.en:
Sanas, age 41, is a resident of the small village of Parangerpar in Falakata in the state of West Bengal. She lives there with her husband and four children (one son and three daughters). Her youngest daughter and only son are studying in grades 9 and 8, respectively. Two of her daughters are married. Her husband runs a small hotel in their locality.

Sanas runs a small animal husbandry business and raises cows to sell milk to her neighbors and the local market. With just a little monthly income, her family is constantly at risk of falling into financial strain. Realizing that she should improve her business to give her family complete financial stability, she is keen to expand her small-scale business by selling more milk and cattle by-products like cow dung, etc. She intends to buy another dairy cow to quickly scale up the size of her business. Thus, Sanas seeks a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS.

She hopes her income will increase substantially and that she will be able to provide financial sustenance to her family.

Sanas is very much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Rimi

texts.en:
Rimi is only a 19-year-old cheerful woman who lives with her husband in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. She studied up to grade 12. Her husband has a laundry shop, which he runs from their home. Rimi helps her husband to run the laundry shop smoothly.

Rimi and her husband wash and press garments and other materials such as curtains, quilt bed sheets, bed covers etc. Their neighbours are the main customers, and they and their laundry service are well known in the community for quick and improved services. Now they want to rent a shop in the market to serve more customers. They also want to decorate their shop with new machinery. But they do not have sufficient money for that.

For that reason, Rimi is seeking a microfinance loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay the rent and buy detergents, a new ironing machine etc. for her laundry business. She hopes there will be a big increase in earnings through the use of this loan. She hopes the extension of her business will earn more revenue to provide her proper economical provisions. She wants to get ahead with the business for her secure future. Rimi is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay the rental fee and buy different items for her existing laundry shop.

loans.name: Sitarani

texts.en:
Sitarani is a married woman living with her family in a small village, Parangerpar, in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a 46-year-old woman. Her family consists of her husband and her 19-year-old daughter who studies in college. Sitarani and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names. So they are determined to provide a higher education for their only daughter and that motivates them to strive hard.

Sitarani's husband runs a sweetmeat shop where he sells different types of sweets made from cottage cheese.

Sitarani has been engaged in a sewing business for many years. She stitches ready-made garments like blouses, petticoats, pants, shirts, frocks, etc. and sells them in her local area. Yet, the family income is insufficient to maintain the family of three and she faces a hardship to run her family smoothly. For this reason, she wants to expand her sewing work business. To fulfill her customers' demands, she has to increase her volume of sewing work and products as well. Thus, Sitarani seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine to enhance the volume of her business.

This would let Sitarani increase the family's income as well as her family’s savings. With the acquired profit, she dreams of purchasing a car for her family in the future.

Sitarani is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her small-scale sewing business.

loans.name: Sarbamangalal

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Sarbamangalal lives in Kandi with her husband and two grown-up sons. Her sons both work in a small company. She is a homemaker and her husband is involved in fishery business. He has a lot of experience in this field because he has been engaged in this business for 30 years.

They have a fish pond and he uses the pond for business purposes. He has been involved in this business for a long time since fish is very popular among the people of this region. For family functions and festivals, crowds of customers gather at the fish markets. Now he wants to expand his business but money is the main problem. So, to help her husband, Sarbamangalal applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. Her husband wants to use the money to fulfill the demands of his valuable customers by enhancing his stock.

The loan amount will be used to buy a variety of fingerlings to raise in the pond and some fish feed to expand the business and sell more fish for income generation. They hope that they can expand their fishery business with the help of this loan and save money to develop their family's financial status.

She and her husband thank her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fingerlings and fish feed for her husband's existing business.

loans.name: Latika

texts.en:
Latika lives in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. She is 49 years old. She is blessed with three grown-up children (Two sons and one daughter). Her elder son is working at a company, her younger son is jobless and her only daughter is married.

Her husband Nimai is engaged in an orchestra business. Latika runs a stall in her locality where she sells a variety of grocery items after managing all the household work. She sells items like spices, eggs, pulses, soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. that are in great demand among the local villagers and neighbors. But the family's earnings hardly cover the family's basic needs. In order to meet the growing inflation and to keep provisions for the future, Latika wants to grow her grocery business. She realizes that she can earn more profit if she can increase her stock on a large scale. To buy more grocery items in bulk, she needs capital. So she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan amount to purchase more grocery items and daily-needed commodities in bulk so that she can satisfy her customers' demands and earn more. With the increased income, Latika will be able to expand her business and save better for her family’s secure future.

Latika thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her stall.

loans.name: Mamuni

texts.en:
Mamuni is a 29-year-old hardworking and optimistic housewife. She lives with her husband and their five-year-old son in Baganbari village in Falakata, West Bengal. She started her own sewing business so that she could provide her son with a better education than the primary schooling she had.

Mamuni's husband is a farmer whose earnings are very scant. Mamuni supplements her husband's income by sewing and selling clothes to her villagers. She supports her family with the income she earns by sewing clothes like dresses, blouses, shirts, frocks, etc. Her small business brings a good monthly income and she diligently saves a small part of this, running her home with the rest of her income supported by the income her husband brings in.

Aware that these savings will be insufficient, she is working to increase her business earning potential. To improve her productivity and take on more customers, she wants to buy a new and better sewing machine. To put this plan into action, Mamuni needs access to funds. So, she is requesting a loan from Kiva via BJS, who gives microloans to needy hardworking women like her to start or enlarge micro businesses.

Mamuni will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine and hopes she will be able to cater to more customers. She will use this significant boost in her savings to educate her son and invest in the further growth of her business.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her existing sewing business.

loans.name: Fredina

texts.en:
Fredina is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children.

Her business is farming, and she has been in this business for 9 years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with of four children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to ensure her children receive the best education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en: Mercidita lives a simple life with her family in a town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and the mother of five children. Four of these children are school aged children ages 12, nine, six and one year old. Her husband does farming business to raise their family, while Mercidita is engaged in hog raising business. This will give her the opportunity to enhance their livelihood.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Aside from raising pigs, she also sells food to the community that it enables her to help her husband in providing their daily needs. Her goal in life is to expand her hog raising business to have enough money to give a quality education to her children. By the help of a loan, she will buy additional piglets and she will also buy ingredients for making food (snacks) to sell. She will buy flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy piglets. Also ingredients for making snacks, such as flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of forty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshas, aged 54, has been involved in a embroidered cloth selling business for about ten years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter season's embroidered and printed clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Andeleijar

texts.en:
Andeleijar is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with of 5 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old. She is a single mother blessed with 4 children of ages between 17 and 5 years respectively.

She has had a quarrying business for 20 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She has borrowed KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, after paying the previous loan successful she will be using the loan to purchase quarry equipment. 

With the anticipated profits  she will repay her loan as well as expand her current business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established quarry business and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase quarry equipment

loans.name: Janester

texts.en:
Janester is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and see her children clear education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 35 year old who works in a quarry. 

He is a father of three who has been in this business for the last five years doing very well.

This is his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business, he will use the money to hire track for transporting his products from site to various distribution locations.

With the anticipated profits, Stephen will be able to repay his loan. 

He hopes to own a tractor in future.

loans.use: to hire track for transporting his products from site to various distribution locations

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en: Meresi is a 50 year old lady married with 09 children with 03 still attending school, Meresi deals in trading goats and second hand clothes sales. Meresi is a repeat client to the institution, she has been taking loans for her business and paying school fees for her children.       Meresi applied for a loan of 1,500,000 to boost her business i.e. buying more clothes for her business.   She thanks Ugafode for support which has enabled her to educate her children and sustain her business.

loans.use: to boost her used clothing sales business by buying more clothes.

loans.name: Dat

texts.en: Mrs. Dat is 53 years old. She is married and has four children, so she works very hard to provide for them.   Husbandry is the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard, as well as environment protection.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is 58 years old. She is a single mother blessed with 4 grown up children of ages between 35 and 24 years. She has had a farming business for 20 years currently earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000.

She has borrowed KES. 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, After paying the previous loans successfully. Emma will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established farming business enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and animal feeds and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for selling and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Bay

texts.en: Mrs. Bay is 48 years old and lives with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.        She runs a general store and requested a loan through QBWDF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.She  has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong  is 31 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity  and  selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rita Yanira

texts.es:
Rita, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la siembra de maíz, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad y están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Rita, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace 15 ños, antes trabajaba en el campo con sus padres y luego se acompaño y siempre cultiva maíz junto a su pareja, el lugar donde siembra está a 35 minutos de su casa y lo hacen en un carruaje halado por un caballo, ella trabaja junto a su pareja y se levanta muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y salir a la parcela a las 5:30 a.m. y regresa a casa a las 3:00 p.m. 

Rita, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera. 

Rita, desea seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y comprar otra ternera.
texts.en:
33-year old Rita has a grade 9 education. Her partner earns his living by growing maize. She has two children aged 12 and 9; they both attend school in the community. Rita has grown basic grains for 15 years. Before that she worked in the fields with her parents, and then with her partner she now grows maize. Their land is 35 minutes from their house, and they travel there in a horse-drawn cart.

Rita works with her partner. She gets up very early to make breakfast and then leaves for work at 5:30 am. She returns to the house at 3:00 pm.

She needs a loan to buy a calf. She wants to carry on working and help her children so they can continue in school. She also wishes to buy another calf.

loans.use: buy a calf

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 44 years old. He is married to Sylivia and they have been blessed with 5 children.

He has had a welding business for 15 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He has borrowed KES 22,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his third loan, after repaying the previous loan successfully.

He will be using the loan to purchase a welding machine. Hence he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater for medical care, expanding his current business and repay his loan too.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a twenty five year old cashew nuts trader at Kilifi Kenya.

She is a mother of two whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this field for the last one year, doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business.
She will use the money to purchase cashew nuts for resale at a profit and the anticipated profit to educate her children.

She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts for resale at a profit

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na is 39 years old. She is married and has two children. She has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family. Her income is mainly from business and fishing so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, cada una de ellas están luchando por sus seres queridos, para poder darles un mejor estilo de vida, y con ello evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
La Sra. Narcisa es una de las personas que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a las confecciones, por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para sobrevivir día a día. Narcisa es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por eso que decidió unirse al grupo y pone siempre su mayor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are fifteen women in this group. Each one of them works hard to give her family a better standard of living and avoid what happened through necessity to each of them.

Sra. Narcisa is one of the members of the group. She is a seamstress, and that is how she earns enough money to survive each day. Narcisa is a very hardworking woman who makes a great effort to improve her living conditions. For this reason she decided to join the group, and she always puts her best foot forward.

She is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons etc. so she can carry on making clothing. Narcisa is grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons etc. for dressmaking

loans.name: Pioneras 2015 Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 4, 8 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora, su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los migrantes del campo de occidente y del lugar.
Isabel es morena de cabello negro y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (de rodillas al centro, viste blusa negra y pantalón jean azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó  a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, tienda de barrio, frutería, verdulería, artesanía en cuero, taller de reparación de refrigeradores, venta de refrescos y panadería. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; ella compra ropa por mayor y la selecciona por género y edad para venderla ambulantemente en lugares y zonas comerciales, “necesito surtir la ropa para venderla de mejor manera…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa rota constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta y contar con mucha ropa para vender, ella desea comprar ropa por mayor para separarla y venderla por género. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para venderla por géneros.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 37 year old woman who lives with her partner and three children aged 4, 8 and 10. She makes a living selling used clothing. She is a good mother, independent and very hard working. She works as a street trader in the "plan 3000 " neighbourhood which comprises migrants from the western countryside and surroundings.
Isabel has a dark complexion, black hair and medium build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, she speaks Spanish. (she is kneeling in the centre of the photo wearing a black blouse and blue jeans).
She lives with her partner who works in construction and her children who are at school. Their home is made of timber and enjoys all the basic services. Her wish to improve her business has lead her to the micro-finance group. The group members are engaged in the following business activity; food sales, neighbourhood store, fruit shop, vegetable shop, leather handicrafts, fridge repair shop, soft drinks and bread shop. Isabel's business is selling used clothing; she buys the clothes wholesale and then sorts the clothes by age and type to sell on the streets and in the commercial areas.
" I need to sort the clothing to be able to sell it for the best price" she remarks. The advantage of her business is that clothing is always wearing out however the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy used clothing wholesale. Her dream is to have a permanent stall and have plenty of clothing to sell; she wants to buy clothing wholesale so she can then sort it and sell it retail. This is her first loan cycle with the institution after two years trading in this business. This is the background to Isabel's request for a loan to buy used clothing wholesale that she will then sell retail.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale for retail sale.

loans.name: Liliana Margarita

texts.es: Liliana es una microempresaria dedicada al expendio de carne de res y pescado en Arjona un municipio de Bolívar, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de una amiga que se dedicaba a la misma actividad y que logró contactarla con sus proveedores.  Tiempo después su amiga se trasladó de ciudad y Liliana continuó con esta actividad en la que lleva tres años, ofreciéndole a su familia bienestar.  Ella vive con su cónyuge y su hija que ya cumplió la mayoría de edad, en la comodidad de su hogar y aprovechando el espacio de su refrigerador, conserva sus carnes y pescados que diariamente vende a sus vecinos y amigos;  generalmente sus ventas se realizan de contado y pero también ofrece comodidad de pago a algunos clientes.  En la actualidad Liliana no tiene la capacidad para responder a las solicitudes de sus clientes, su refrigerador ya no es suficientes para abastecer su demanda, es por ello que solicitó su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir un enfriador y comprar una nueva línea de alimentos que combinan muy bien con las carnes y el pescado; yuca y maíz.  Con esta inversión logrará incrementar sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones de conservación de los alimentos.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local donde pueda agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Liliana is a businesswoman who sells meat and fish in Arjona, a municipality in Bolívar. She started the business with help from a friend who had the same kind of business and helped her connect with suppliers. Time passed and her friend moved to town. Liliana continued and she has now run her business for three years, contributing to the wellbeing of her family. She lives with her husband and daughter who is now grown up.

From the comfort of her home Liliana uses the space in her refrigerator to preserve the meat and fish which she sells on a daily basis to neighbours and friends. Most of the sales are for cash, but she also offers easy payment terms to some customers.

Currently Liliana doesn't have the capacity to respond to her customers' wishes. Her fridge isn't large enough to satisfy their demands. So she is seeking her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy a cooler and a new line of food which goes well with meat and fish: yucca and maize. With this investment she will be able to increase sales and improve the conditions in which the food is kept.

Liliana's goal in the future is to have premises so she can expand her business.

loans.use: buy a cooler and a new line of food which goes well with meat and fish: yucca and maize

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre  San Antonio está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo.
La Sra. Ana  es una de las personas de este grupo, ella se destaca por ser una persona trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, a través de su esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y puede dar a su familia una vida digna. Ella comenta que se unió al grupo para poder crecer y ayudar de una mejor manera a su familia, todo por medio de la venta de comidas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados,  hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas,  que le ayudará  al crecimiento de su negocio,  y  así mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This community bank group is called San Antonio and it is starting its second women's committee loan cycle.  All the members work and help each other get ahead through their continuous efforts and group support.

Ana is one of the members of the group.  She stands out as a hard-working, determined, enterprising person who has improved her situation through her efforts, giving her family a decent lifestyle.  She says she joined the group in order to grow and help her family, which she does through food sales.  She works every day starting very early in the morning.

She is requesting a loan to buy food supplies such as vegetables, meats, condiments, breads and other supplies.  This way she can continue with sales and help expand her business in order to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy food supplies such as vegetables, meats, condiments, bread and other items.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramon  se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, el grupo se formó en el barrio en  la ciudad de Santaní, el grupo está conformado por 18 integrantes todas con actividades independientes, y se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
 La señora Benita una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, que después ella vende o faena. Comenta que le ha ido ya muy bien en su negocio, es por eso que cada día va mejorando más y más.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales y también para poder refaccionar el gallinero que tiene, agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The community bank San Ramon is in its fifth women's committee loan cycle.  The group was established in this neighborhood of the city of Santani.  There are 18 members who have independent businesses and make an effort to get ahead.

Benita is one of the members of the group and she raises barnyard animals which she sells.  She claims business is going very well for her, so every day her situation is improving.

She is requesting a loan to buy balanced animal feed and to repair her chicken coop.  She is grateful for this opportunity which is very helpful.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and repair her chicken coop.

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, comenta que eligió esta carrera ya que quiere poder ejercer su profesión y ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Él es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se esfuerza.
texts.en:
Junior is from the city of San Ignacio. He is studying for a degree in Nursing and said that he chose this line of study because wants to practice in this profession and be able to help other people.

Junior is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. This will allow him to continue his studies. Junior is a person who wants to make something out of his life, so he strives to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: to pay his degree fees.
